name: Shield Warden (Champion)
desc: You use your shield to protect your allies. When you have a shield raised, you can use your Shield Block reaction when an attack is made against an ally adjacent to you. If you do, the shield prevents that ally from taking damage instead of preventing you from taking damage, following the normal rules for Shield Block.

hints.desc: When you have a shield raised, you can use your Shield Block reaction when an attack is made against an ally adjacent to you. If you do, the shield prevents that ally from taking damage instead of preventing you from taking damage, following the normal rules for Shield Block.

shortdesc: You use your shield to protect your allies as well as yourself.

name: Double Slice
desc: You lash out at your foe with both weapons.
shortdesc: You lash out at your foe with both weapons.

name: Everstand Stance
desc: You brace your shield with both hands, enhancing its potential for both offense and defense.
specialdesc: This class feat is available to Knights of Lastwall. Those with the champion trait are champion class feats. Those with both the champion and fighter traits are both champion class feats and fighter class feats; when you take one of these feats, it loses the trait that doesn't apply to your class.
shortdesc: You brace your shield with both hands, enhancing its potential for both offense and defense.

name: Exacting Strike
desc: You make a controlled attack, fully accounting for your momentum.
shortdesc: You make a controlled attack, fully accounting for your momentum.

name: Point-Blank Shot
desc: You take aim to pick off nearby enemies quickly.
shortdesc: You take aim to pick off nearby enemies quickly.

name: Power Attack
desc: You unleash a particularly powerful attack that clobbers your foe but leaves you a bit unsteady.
shortdesc: You unleash a particularly powerful attack that clobbers your foe but leaves you a bit unsteady.

name: Reactive Shield
desc: You can snap your shield into place just as you would take a blow, avoiding the hit at the last second.
shortdesc: You can snap your shield into place just as you would take a blow, avoiding the hit at the last second.

name: Snagging Strike
desc: You combine an attack with quick grappling moves to throw an enemy off balance as long as it stays in your reach.
shortdesc: You combine an attack with quick grappling moves to throw an enemy off balance as long as it stays in your reach.

name: Sudden Charge
desc: With a quick sprint, you dash up to your foe and swing.
shortdesc: With a quick sprint, you dash up to your foe and swing.

name: Aggressive Block
desc: You push back as you block the attack, knocking your foe away or off balance.
shortdesc: You push back as you block the attack, knocking your foe away or off balance.

name: Assisting Shot
desc: With a quick shot, you interfere with a foe in combat.
shortdesc: With a quick shot, you interfere with a foe in combat.

name: Brutish Shove
desc: Throwing your weight behind your attack, you hit you opponent hard enough to make it stumble back.
shortdesc: Throwing your weight behind your attack, you hit you opponent hard enough to make it stumble back.

name: Combat Grab
desc: You swipe at your opponent and grab at them.
shortdesc: You swipe at your opponent and grab at them.

name: Dueling Parry
desc: You can parry attacks against you with your one-handed weapon.
shortdesc: You can parry attacks against you with your one-handed weapon.

name: Intimidating Strike
desc: Your blow not only wounds creatures but also shatters their confidence.
shortdesc: Your blow not only wounds creatures but also shatters their confidence.

name: Lunge
desc: Extending your body to its limits, you attack an enemy that would normally be beyond your reach.
shortdesc: Extending your body to its limits, you attack an enemy that would normally be beyond your reach.

name: Double Shot
desc: You shoot twice in blindingly fast succession.
shortdesc: You shoot twice in blindingly fast succession.

name: Dual-Handed Assault
desc: You snap your free hand over to grip your weapon just long enough to add momentum and deliver a more powerful blow to your opponent.
shortdesc: You snap your free hand over to grip your weapon just long enough to add momentum and deliver a more powerful blow to your opponent.

name: Everstand Strike
desc: Your follow-up blow leaves you an opening to set your shield.
specialdesc: This class feat is available to Knights of Lastwall. Those with the champion trait are champion class feats. Those with both the champion and fighter traits are both champion class feats and fighter class feats; when you take one of these feats, it loses the trait that doesn't apply to your class.
shortdesc: Your follow-up blow leaves you an opening to set your shield.

name: Knockdown
desc: You make an attack to knock a foe off balance, then follow up immediately with a sweep to topple them.
shortdesc: You make an attack to knock a foe off balance, then follow up immediately with a sweep to topple them.

name: Powerful Shove
desc:
You can push larger foes around with your attack. You can use Aggressive Block or Brutish Shove against a creature up to two sizes larger than you.

When a creature you Shove has to stop moving because it would hit an object, it takes damage equal to your Strength modifier (minimum 1). This happens regardless of how you Shoved the creature.

hints.desc: You can use Aggressive Block or Brutish Shove against a creature up to two sizes larger than you.

When a creature you Shove has to stop moving because it would hit an object, it takes |dice=strmod| damage equal to your Strength modifier (minimum 1). This happens regardless of how you Shoved the creature.

shortdesc: You can push larger foes around with your attack.

name: Quick Reversal
desc: You turn your foes' flanking against them with a quick reverse.
shortdesc: You turn your foes' flanking against them with a quick reverse.

name: Shielded Stride
desc: When your shield is up, your enemies' blows can't touch you. When you have your shield raised, you can Stride to move half your Speed without triggering reactions that are triggered by your movement (such as Attacks of Opportunity). You can use Shielded Stride while Flying or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

hints.desc: When you have your shield raised, you can Stride to move half your Speed without triggering reactions that are triggered by your movement (such as Attacks of Opportunity). You can use Shielded Stride while Flying or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

shortdesc: When your shield is up, your enemies' blows can't touch you.

name: Swipe
desc: You make a wide, arcing swing.
shortdesc: You make a wide, arcing swing.

name: Twin Parry
desc: You use your two weapons to parry attacks.
shortdesc: You use your two weapons to parry attacks.

name: Advanced Weapon Training
desc: You've studied the art of wielding an advanced weapon. Choose a weapon group. You gain proficiency with all advanced weapons in that group as if they were martial weapons of their weapon group.
shortdesc: You've studied the art of wielding an advanced weapon.

name: Advanced Weapon Training: Axe
desc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced axes. You gain proficiency with all advanced axes as if they were martial axes.
shortdesc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced axes.

name: Advanced Weapon Training: Bomb
desc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced bombs. You gain proficiency with all advanced bombs as if they were martial bombs.
shortdesc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced bombs.

name: Advanced Weapon Training: Bow
desc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced bows. You gain proficiency with all advanced bows as if they were martial bows.
shortdesc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced bows.

name: Advanced Weapon Training: Brawling
desc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced brawling weapons. You gain proficiency with all advanced brawling weapons as if they were martial brawling weapons.
shortdesc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced brawling weapons.

name: Advanced Weapon Training: Club
desc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced clubs. You gain proficiency with all advanced clubs as if they were martial clubs.
shortdesc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced clubs.

name: Advanced Weapon Training: Dart
desc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced darts. You gain proficiency with all advanced darts as if they were martial darts.
shortdesc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced darts.

name: Advanced Weapon Training: Flail
desc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced flails. You gain proficiency with all advanced flails as if they were martial flails.
shortdesc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced flails.

name: Advanced Weapon Training: Hammer
desc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced hammers. You gain proficiency with all advanced hammers as if they were martial hammers.
shortdesc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced hammers.

name: Advanced Weapon Training: Knife
desc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced knives. You gain proficiency with all advanced knives as if they were martial knives.
shortdesc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced knifes.

name: Advanced Weapon Training: Pick
desc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced picks. You gain proficiency with all advanced picks as if they were martial picks.
shortdesc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced picks.

name: Advanced Weapon Training: Polearm
desc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced polearms. You gain proficiency with all advanced polearms as if they were martial polearms.
shortdesc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced polearms.

name: Advanced Weapon Training: Shield
desc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced shield weapons. You gain proficiency with all advanced shield weapons as if they were martial shield weapons.
shortdesc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced shields.

name: Advanced Weapon Training: Sling
desc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced slings. You gain proficiency with all advanced slings as if they were martial slings.
shortdesc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced slings.

name: Advanced Weapon Training: Spear
desc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced spears. You gain proficiency with all advanced spears as if they were martial spears.
shortdesc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced spears.

name: Advanced Weapon Training: Sword
desc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced swords. You gain proficiency with all advanced swords as if they were martial swords.
shortdesc: You've studied the art of wielding advanced swords.

name: Advantageous Assault
desc: When an enemy's movement is compromised, you deliver a more deadly blow.
shortdesc: When an enemy's movement is compromised, you deliver a more deadly blow.

name: Disarming Stance
desc: You adopt a fencing stance that improves your control over your weapon.
shortdesc: You adopt a fencing stance that improves your control over your weapon.

name: Furious Focus
desc: You've learned to maintain your balance even when swinging furiously. When you make a Power Attack with a melee weapon you're wielding in two hands, it counts as one attack toward your multiple attack penalty instead of two.

hints.desc: When you make a Power Attack with a melee weapon you're wielding in two hands, it counts as one attack toward your multiple attack penalty instead of two.

shortdesc: You've learned to maintain your balance even when swinging furiously.

name: Guardian's Deflection
desc: You use your weapon to deflect the attack against your ally.
shortdesc: You use your weapon to deflect the attack against your ally.

name: Reflexive Shield
desc: You can use your shield to fend off the worst of area effects and other damage. When you Raise your Shield, you gain your shield's circumstance bonus to Reflex saves. If you have the Shield Block reaction, damage you take as a result of a Reflex save can trigger that reaction, even if the damage isn't physical damage.

hints.desc: When you Raise your Shield, you gain your shield's circumstance bonus to Reflex saves. If you have the Shield Block reaction, damage you take as a result of a Reflex save can trigger that reaction, even if the damage isn't physical damage.

internalNote: The effect on Reflex saves is hardcoded.
shortdesc: You can use your shield to fend off the worst of area effects and other damage.

name: Revealing Stab
desc: You drive your piercing weapon into an imperceptible foe, revealing its location to your allies.
shortdesc: You drive your piercing weapon into an imperceptible foe, revealing its location to your allies.

name: Shatter Defenses
desc: Your offense exploits your enemy's fear. Make a melee Strike against a frightened creature.
shortdesc: Your offense exploits your enemy's fear. Make a melee Strike against a frightened creature.

name: Shield Warden (Fighter)
desc: You use your shield to protect your allies. When you have a shield raised, you can use your Shield Block reaction when an attack is made against an ally adjacent to you. If you do, the shield prevents that ally from taking damage instead of preventing you from taking damage, following the normal rules for Shield Block.

hints.desc: When you have a shield raised, you can use your Shield Block reaction when an attack is made against an ally adjacent to you. If you do, the shield prevents that ally from taking damage instead of preventing you from taking damage, following the normal rules for Shield Block.

shortdesc: You use your shield to protect your allies as well as yourself.

name: Triple Shot
desc: You can quickly fire multiple shots with greater control. When you use Double Shot, you can make the attacks against the same target. You can add an additional action to Double Shot to make three ranged Strikes instead of two. If you do, the penalty is -4. All attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after you've made all of them.

hints.desc: When you use Double Shot, you can make the attacks against the same target. You can add an additional action to Double Shot to make three ranged Strikes instead of two. If you do, the penalty is -4. All attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after you've made all of them.

shortdesc: You can quickly fire multiple shots with greater control.

name: Dueling Riposte
desc: You riposte against your flailing enemy.
shortdesc: You riposte against your flailing enemy.

name: Felling Strike
desc: Your attack can ground an airborne foe.
shortdesc: Your attack can ground an airborne foe.

name: Impassable Wall Stance
desc: You refuse to let foes past your guard.
specialdesc: This class feat is available to Knights of Lastwall. Those with the champion trait are champion class feats. Those with both the champion and fighter traits are both champion class feats and fighter class feats; when you take one of these feats, it loses the trait that doesn't apply to your class.
shortdesc: You refuse to let foes past your guard.

name: Incredible Aim
desc: By spending a moment to focus, you can ensure your attack strikes true.
shortdesc: By spending a moment to focus, you can ensure your attack strikes true.

name: Mobile Shot Stance
desc: Your shots become nimble and deadly.
shortdesc: Your shots become nimble and deadly.

name: Positioning Assault
desc: With punishing blows, you force your opponent into position.
shortdesc: With punishing blows, you force your opponent into position.

name: Quick Shield Block
desc: You can bring your shield into place with hardly a thought. At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to Shield Block.

hints.desc: At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to Shield Block.

shortdesc: You can bring your shield into place with hardly a thought.

name: Sudden Leap
desc: You swing at a foe while mid-leap.
shortdesc: You swing at a foe while mid-leap.

name: Agile Grace
desc: Your graceful moves with agile weapons are beyond compare. Your multiple attack penalty with agile weapons and agile unarmed attacks becomes -3 for your second attack and -6 for subsequent attacks (rather than -4 and -8).

hints.desc: Your multiple attack penalty with agile weapons and agile unarmed attacks becomes -3 for your second attack and -6 for subsequent attacks (rather than -4 and -8).

shortdesc: Your graceful moves with agile weapons are beyond compare.

name: Certain Strike
desc: Even when you don't hit squarely, you can still score a glancing blow.
shortdesc: Even when you don't hit squarely, you can still score a glancing blow.

name: Combat Reflexes
desc: You are particularly swift at punishing foes who leave you openings. At the start of each of your turns when you regain your actions, you gain an additional reaction that can be used only to make an Attack of Opportunity.

hints.desc: At the start of each of your turns when you regain your actions, you gain an additional reaction that can be used only to make an Attack of Opportunity.
hints.showon: Attacks, Attack of Opportunity, Attack of Opportunity (Fighter)

shortdesc: You are particularly swift at punishing foes who leave you openings.

name: Debilitating Shot
desc: Aiming for a weak point, you impede your foe with a precise shot.
shortdesc: Aiming for a weak point, you impede your foe with a precise shot.

name: Disarming Twist
desc: After your initial attack redirects your foe's defenses, your follow-up wrests their weapon from their grasp.
shortdesc: After your initial attack redirects your foe's defenses, your follow-up wrests their weapon from their grasp.

name: Disruptive Stance
desc: The slightest distraction can provoke your wrath, and you're prepared to foil enemies' actions.
shortdesc: The slightest distraction can provoke your wrath, and you're prepared to foil enemies' actions.

name: Fearsome Brute
desc:
Fear makes your foes weak and more vulnerable to your attacks. You gain a circumstance bonus to damage rolls for Strikes against frightened creatures. The bonus is equal to double the target's frightened value.

If you have master proficiency in Intimidation, increase the bonus to triple the target's frightened value.

hints.desc:
You gain a circumstance bonus to damage rolls for Strikes against frightened creatures. The bonus is equal to double the target's frightened value.

If you have master proficiency in Intimidation, increase the bonus to triple the target's frightened value.

shortdesc: Fear makes your foes weak and more vulnerable to your attacks.

name: Improved Knockdown
desc: You can dash your foe to the ground with a single blow. When you use Knockdown, instead of making a Strike followed by a Trip, you can attempt a single Strike. If you do and your Strike hits, you also apply the critical success effect of a Trip. If you used a two-handed melee weapon for the Strike, you can use the weapon's damage die size instead of the regular die size for the damage from a critical Trip.

hints.desc: When you use Knockdown, instead of making a Strike followed by a Trip, you can attempt a single Strike. If you do and your Strike hits, you also apply the critical success effect of a Trip. If you used a two-handed melee weapon for the Strike, you can use the weapon's damage die size instead of the regular die size for the damage from a critical Trip.

shortdesc: You can dash your foe to the ground with a single blow.

name: Mirror Shield
desc: You reflect the spell back against the triggering opponent.
shortdesc: You reflect the spell back against the triggering opponent.

name: Twin Riposte
desc: A clever parry with one weapon leaves your opponent open to an attack with the other weapon.
shortdesc: A clever parry with one weapon leaves your opponent open to an attack with the other weapon.

name: Brutal Finish
desc: Your final blow can make an impact even if it rebounds off a foe's defenses.
shortdesc: Your final blow can make an impact even if it rebounds off a foe's defenses.

name: Dueling Dance
desc: Using your free hand as pivot and balance, you both attack and defend with your weapon.
shortdesc: Using your free hand as pivot and balance, you both attack and defend with your weapon.

name: Flinging Shove
desc: Increase the distance you Shove your opponent with Aggressive Block or Brutish Shove to 10 feet on a success or 20 feet on a critical success. When you use Aggressive Block, you can choose whether the target is flat-footed or Shoved. When you make a Brutish Shove, you also Shove the target 5 feet on a failure.

hints.desc: Increase the distance you Shove your opponent with Aggressive Block to 10 feet on a success or 20 feet on a critical success. When you use Aggressive Block, you can choose whether the target is flat-footed or Shoved.

Increase the distance you Shove your opponent with Brutish Shove to 10 feet on a success or 20 feet on a critical success. When you make a Brutish Shove, you also Shove the target 5 feet on a failure.

shortdesc: Your opponets go even farther when push them around.

name: Improved Dueling Riposte
desc: Your weapon whirls and darts, striking foes whenever the opportunity presents itself. At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to make a Dueling Riposte. You can use this extra reaction even if you are not benefiting from Dueling Parry.

hints.desc: At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to make a Dueling Riposte. You can use this extra reaction even if you are not benefiting from Dueling Parry.

shortdesc: Your weapon whirls and darts, striking foes whenever the opportunity presents itself.

name: Incredible Ricochet
desc: After your first shot singles out your opponent's position, you direct another that ricochets around obstacles and strikes unerringly.
shortdesc: After your first shot singles out your opponent's position, you direct another that ricochets around obstacles and strikes unerringly.

name: Lunging Stance
desc: Your body coiled to strike, you can lash out at distant enemies.
shortdesc: Your body coiled to strike, you can lash out at distant enemies.

name: Paragon's Guard
desc: Once you've had a moment to set your stance, you always have your shield ready without a thought.
shortdesc: Once you've had a moment to set your stance, you always have your shield ready without a thought.

name: Spring Attack
desc: Springing away from one foe, you Strike at another.
shortdesc: Springing away from one foe, you Strike at another.

name: Desperate Finisher
desc: You throw everything into one last press.
shortdesc: You throw everything into one last press.

name: Determination
desc: Your training allows you to shrug off your foes' spells and conditions when the need is dire.
shortdesc: Your training allows you to shrug off your foes' spells and conditions when the need is dire.

name: Guiding Finish
desc: Using your weapon as a lever, you force your opponent to end up right where you want them.
shortdesc: Using your weapon as a lever, you force your opponent to end up right where you want them.

name: Guiding Riposte
desc: By shifting your weight and angling your weapon, you guide your opponent to a more favorable position. When you use Dueling Riposte to Strike and you hit, you can move the target up to 10 feet into a space in your reach. This follows the forced movement rules.

hints.desc: When you use Dueling Riposte to Strike and you hit, you can move the target up to 10 feet into a space in your reach. This follows the forced movement rules.

shortdesc: By shifting your weight and angling your weapon, you guide your opponent to a more favorable position.

name: Improved Twin Riposte (Fighter)
desc: Your weapons are a blur, blocking and biting at your foes. At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to perform a Twin Riposte. You can use this extra reaction even if you are not benefiting from Twin Parry.

hints.desc: At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to perform a Twin Riposte. You can use this extra reaction even if you are not benefiting from Twin Parry.

shortdesc: Your weapons are a blur, blocking and biting at your foes.

name: Stance Savant (Fighter)
desc: When there's imminent danger, you drop into a stance with a mere thought.
shortdesc: When there's imminent danger, you drop into a stance with a mere thought.

name: Two-Weapon Flurry
desc: You lash out with both your weapons in a sudden frenzy.
shortdesc: You lash out with both your weapons in a sudden frenzy.

name: Whirlwind Strike
desc: You attack all nearby adversaries.
shortdesc: You attack all nearby adversaries.

name: Graceful Poise
desc: With the right positioning, your off-hand weapon can strike like a scorpion's stinger.
shortdesc: With the right positioning, your off-hand weapon can strike like a scorpion's stinger.

name: Improved Reflexive Shield
desc: Your shield can help save nearby allies. When you use Shield Block against damage resulting from a Reflex save, adjacent allies who would take damage due to Reflex saves against the same effect also benefit from the damage reduction.

hints.desc: When you use Shield Block against damage resulting from a Reflex save, adjacent allies who would take damage due to Reflex saves against the same effect also benefit from the damage reduction.

shortdesc: Your shield can help save nearby allies.

name: Multishot Stance
desc: You lock yourself in a stable position so you can fire swiftly and accurately.
shortdesc: You lock yourself in a stable position so you can fire swiftly and accurately.

name: Twinned Defense
desc: You're always ready to use your off-hand weapon to interfere with attacks against you.
shortdesc: You're always ready to use your off-hand weapon to interfere with attacks against you.

name: Impossible Volley (Fighter)
desc: You fire a volley at all foes in an area.
shortdesc: You fire a volley at all foes in an area.

name: Savage Critical
desc: The wounds you inflict are grievous. When you Strike with a weapon or unarmed attack for which you have legendary proficiency, you critically succeed if you roll a 19 on the die as long as that result is a success. This has no effect on a 19 if the result would be a failure.

hints.desc: When you Strike with a weapon or unarmed attack for which you have legendary proficiency, you critically succeed if you roll a 19 on the die as long as that result is a success. This has no effect on a 19 if the result would be a failure.

shortdesc: The wounds you inflict are grievous.

name: Boundless Reprisals
desc: With a sixth sense for the flow of combat, you can quickly react to any situation as required. At the start of each enemy's turn, you gain a reaction you can use only during that turn.

hints.desc: At the start of each enemy's turn, you gain a reaction you can use only during that turn.

shortdesc: With a sixth sense for the flow of combat, you can quickly react to any situation as required.

name: Ultimate Flexibility
desc: Your experience keeps you on your toes, allowing you to adapt to even the most dangerous challenges. When you gain a fighter feat using combat flexibility, you gain three fighter feats instead of one. The first feat must still be 8th level or lower, the second feat can be up to 14th level, and the third feat can be up to 18th level. You can use the first feat to meet the prerequisites of the second or third feats and the second feat to meet the prerequisites of the third feat. You must meet all feats' prerequisites. In addition, you can adapt to the battlefield's challenges by spending 1 hour to train. If you do, you can reselect the feats chosen with combat flexibility as if you had made your daily preparations.
specialdesc: The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion - ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor's Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise's trainers and records unlock this uncommon class feat.

hints.desc: You can adapt to the battlefield's challenges by spending 1 hour to train. If you do, you can reselect the feats chosen with combat flexibility as if you had made your daily preparations.

shortdesc: Gain more feats through combat flexibility.

name: Weapon Supremacy
desc: Your skill with weapons lets you attack swiftly at all times. You're permanently quickened. You can use your extra action only to Strike.

hints.desc: You're permanently quickened. You can use your extra action only to Strike.

shortdesc: Your skill with weapons lets you attack swiftly at all times.

name: Fighter Dedication
desc: You become trained in simple weapons and martial weapons. You become trained in your choice of Acrobatics or Athletics; if you are already trained in both of these skills, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You become trained in fighter class DC.
specialdesc: You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the fighter archetype.
shortdesc: You have spent time learning the art of warfare, increasing your skill with martial arms and at wearing armor.

name: Basic Maneuver
desc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level fighter feat.
shortdesc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level fighter feat.

name: Fighter Resiliency
desc: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each fighter archetype class feat you have. As you continue selecting fighter archetype class feats, you continue to gain additional Hit Points in this way.
shortdesc: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each fighter archetype class feat you have.
specialreqdesc: class granting no more Hit Points per level than 8 + your Constitution modifier

name: Opportunist
desc: You gain the Attack of Opportunity reaction.
shortdesc: You gain the Attack of Opportunity reaction.

name: Advanced Maneuver
desc: You gain a fighter feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your fighter level is equal to half your character level.
specialdesc: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another fighter feat.
shortdesc: You gain a fighter feat.

name: Diverse Weapon Expert
desc: Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons and martial weapons increase to expert, and your proficiency rank for advanced weapons increases to trained.
shortdesc: Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons and martial weapons increase to expert, and your proficiency rank for advanced weapons increases to trained.
specialreqdesc: expert in any kind of weapon or unarmed attack

name: Monk Dedication
desc: You become trained in unarmed attacks and gain the powerful fist class feature. You become trained in your choice of Acrobatics or Athletics; if you are already trained in both of these skills, you become trained in a skill of your choice. You become trained in monk class DC.
specialdesc: You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the monk archetype.
shortdesc: Monastic training has taught you martial arts and allowed you to hone your mind, body, and spirit to new heights.

name: Basic Kata
desc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level monk feat.
shortdesc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level monk feat.

name: Monk Resiliency
desc: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each monk archetype class feat you have. As you continue selecting monk archetype class feats, you continue to gain additional Hit Points in this way.
shortdesc: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each monk archetype class feat you have.
specialreqdesc: class granting no more Hit Points per level than 8 + your Constitution modifier

name: Advanced Kata
desc: You gain one monk feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your monk level is equal to half your character level.
specialdesc: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another monk feat.
shortdesc: You gain a monk feat.

name: Monk Moves
desc: You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your Speed when you're not wearing armor.
shortdesc: You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your Speed when you're not wearing armor.

name: Monk's Flurry
desc: You gain the Flurry of Blows action.
shortdesc: You gain the Flurry of Blows action.

name: Perfection's Path
desc: Choose one saving throw (Fortitude, Reflex, or Will) in which you are an expert. Your proficiency rank in the chosen saving throw increases to master.
shortdesc: Your proficiency rank in one saving throw increases to master.
specialreqdesc: expert in at least one saving throw

name: Perfection's Path: Fortitude
desc: Your proficiency rank in Fortitude saving throws increases to master.
shortdesc: Your proficiency rank in Fortitude saving throws increases to master.

name: Perfection's Path: Reflex
desc: Your proficiency rank in Reflex saving throws increases to master.
shortdesc: Your proficiency rank in Reflex saving throws increases to master.

name: Perfection's Path: Will
desc: Your proficiency rank in Will saving throws increases to master.
shortdesc: Your proficiency rank in Will saving throws increases to master.

name: Animal Companion (Ranger)
desc:
You gain the service of a young animal companion that travels with you on your adventures and obeys any simple commands you give it to the best of its abilities. See Animal Companions on page 214 for more information.

When you Hunt Prey, your animal companion gains the action's benefits and your hunter's edge benefit if you have one.

hints.desc: When you Hunt Prey, your animal companion gains the action's benefits and your hunter's edge benefit if you have one.

shortdesc: You gain the service of a young animal companion that travels with you.
specialreqdesc: no animal companion

name: Crossbow Ace
desc: You have a deep understanding of the crossbow. When you're wielding a crossbow and use Hunt Prey or use Interact to reload your crossbow, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the damage roll on your next Strike with that crossbow. If the crossbow is a simple crossbow, also increase the damage die size for that attack by one step (page 279). You must make the attack before the end of your next turn or these benefits are lost.

hints.desc: When you're wielding a crossbow and use Hunt Prey or use Interact to reload your crossbow, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the damage roll on your next Strike with that crossbow. If the crossbow is a simple crossbow, also increase the damage die size for that attack by one step (page 279). You must make the attack before the end of your next turn or these benefits are lost.
hints.showon: Attacks, Crossbow, Hand Crossbow, Heavy Crossbow

shortdesc: You have a deep understanding of the crossbow.

name: Hunted Shot
desc: You take two quick shots against the one you hunt.
shortdesc: You take two quick shots against the one you hunt.

name: Monster Hunter
desc: You swiftly assess your prey and apply what you know. As part of the action used to Hunt your Prey, you can attempt a check to Recall Knowledge about your prey. When you critically succeed at identifying your hunted prey with Recall Knowledge, you note a weakness in the creature's defenses. You and allies you tell gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your next attack roll against that prey. You can give bonuses from Monster Hunter only once per day against a particular creature.

hints.desc: As part of the action used to Hunt your Prey, you can attempt a check to Recall Knowledge about your prey. When you critically succeed at identifying your hunted prey with Recall Knowledge, you note a weakness in the creature's defenses. You and allies you tell gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your next attack roll against that prey. You can give bonuses from Monster Hunter only once per day against a particular creature.
hints.showon: Hunt Prey, Hunt Prey: Flurry, Hunt Prey: Outwit, Hunt Prey: Precision, Attacks

shortdesc: You swiftly assess your prey and apply what you know.

name: Twin Takedown
desc: You swiftly attack your hunted prey with both weapons.
shortdesc: You swiftly attack your hunted prey with both weapons.

name: Favored Terrain
desc: You have studied a specific terrain to overcome its challenges. Choose aquatic, arctic, desert, forest, mountain, plains, sky, swamp, or underground as your favored terrain. When in that terrain, you can ignore the effects of non-magical difficult terrain. If you have the wild stride class feature, you gain a second benefit while in your favored terrain, depending on your choice. Aquatic You gain a swim Speed equal to your Speed. If you already had a swim Speed, you gain a +10-foot status bonus to your swim Speed. Arctic You need to eat and drink only one-tenth as much as usual, you aren't affected by severe or extreme cold, and you can walk across ice and snow at full Speed without needing to Balance. Desert You need to eat and drink only one-tenth as much as usual, you aren't affected by severe or extreme heat, and you can walk along sand at full Speed without needing to Balance. Forest, Mountain, or Underground You gain a climb Speed equal to your Speed. If you already had a climb Speed, you gain a +10-foot status bonus to your climb Speed. Plains You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your land Speed. Sky You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your fly Speed, if you have one. Swamp You can move across bogs at full Speed, even if they are deep enough to be greater difficult terrain or to normally require you to Swim.
shortdesc: You have studied a specific terrain to overcome its challenges.

name: Favored Terrain: Aquatic
desc: You have studied aquatic terrain to overcome its challenges. When in that terrain, you can ignore the effects of non-magical difficult terrain. If you have the wild stride class feature, while you are in aquatic terrain, you gain a swim Speed equal to your Speed. If you already had a swim Speed, you gain a +10-foot status bonus to your swim Speed.

hints.desc:
When in aquatic terrain, you can ignore the effects of non-magical difficult terrain.

If you have the wild stride class feature, while you are in aquatic terrain, you gain a swim Speed equal to your Speed. If you already had a swim Speed, you gain a +10-foot status bonus to your swim Speed.

effects.setValue: (Has_Feat(Creature.type, 'Wild Stride') && !effectsService.get_AbsolutesOnThis(creature, 'Swim Speed').concat(effectsService.get_RelativesOnThis(creature, 'Swim Speed')).find(effect => effect.source != name && !effect.penalty)) ? Speed('Land Speed') : null

shortdesc: You have studied aquatic terrain to overcome its challenges.

name: Favored Terrain: Arctic
desc: You have studied arctic terrain to overcome its challenges. When in that terrain, you can ignore the effects of non-magical difficult terrain. If you have the wild stride class feature, while you are in arctic terrain, you need to eat and drink only one-tenth as much as usual, you aren't affected by severe or extreme cold, and you can walk across ice and snow at full Speed without needing to Balance.

hints.desc:
When in arctic terrain, you can ignore the effects of non-magical difficult terrain.

If you have the wild stride class feature, you can walk across ice and snow at full Speed without needing to Balance while in arctic terrain.
If you have the wild stride class feature, you need to eat and drink only one-tenth as much as usual while in arctic terrain.
If you have the wild stride class feature, you aren't affected by severe or extreme cold while in arctic terrain.

shortdesc: You have studied arctic terrain to overcome its challenges.

If you already had a climb Speed, you gain a +10-foot status bonus to your climb Speed.

name: Hunter's Aim
desc: When you focus on aiming, your attack becomes particularly accurate.
shortdesc: When you focus on aiming, your attack becomes particularly accurate.

name: Monster Warden
desc: You understand how to defend yourself and others against your prey. When you grant bonuses from Monster Hunter, you and your allies also each gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your next saving throw against that particular creature and to your AC against that creature's next attack against you.

hints.desc: When you grant bonuses from Monster Hunter, you and your allies also each gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your next saving throw against that particular creature and to your AC against that creature's next attack against you.
hints.showon: Hunt Prey, Hunt Prey: Flurry, Hunt Prey: Outwit, Hunt Prey: Precision, Defense, Saving Throws

shortdesc: You understand how to defend yourself and others against your prey.

name: Relentless Stalker
desc: Stay adjacent to your prey when they attempt to move away.
specialdesc: By aiding an NPC from The Fall of Plaguestone, the PCs can learn some special woodland survival techniques.
shortdesc: Stay adjacent to your prey when they attempt to move away.

name: Wild Empathy
desc: You have a connection to the creatures of the natural world that allows you to communicate with them on a rudimentary level. You can use Diplomacy to Make an Impression on animals and to make very simple Requests of them. In most cases, wild animals will give you time to make your case.

hints.desc: You can use Diplomacy to Make an Impression on animals and to make very simple Requests of them. In most cases, wild animals will give you time to make your case.

shortdesc: You have a connection to the creatures of the natural world.

name: Companion's Cry
desc: You can urge your companion to do its utmost. You can spend 2 actions to Command an Animal instead of 1 when commanding your animal companion. If you do, your animal companion uses an additional action.

hints.desc: You can spend 2 actions to Command an Animal instead of 1 when commanding your animal companion. If you do, your animal companion uses an additional action.

shortdesc: You can urge your companion to do its utmost.

name: Disrupt Prey
desc: Make a melee Strike against your prey.
shortdesc: Make a melee Strike against your prey.

name: Far Shot
desc: Your experience in the field has taught you how to focus your aim at a distance, increasing your accuracy. Double your weapons' range increments.

hints.desc: Double your weapons' range increments.

shortdesc: Your experience in the field has taught you how to focus your aim at a distance.

name: Favored Enemy
desc:
You have studied a specific type of wild creature and can hunt it more easily. When you gain this feat, choose animals, beasts, dragons, or both fungi and plants as your favored enemy. When you roll initiative and can see an enemy that belongs to the chosen category, you can Hunt Prey as a free action, designating that enemy.

You can use this free action even if you haven't identified the creature yet with Recall Knowledge. The benefit doesn't apply against favored enemies disguised as other creatures, and the GM determines whether it applies against a creature disguised as a favored enemy.
shortdesc: You have studied a specific type of wild creature and can hunt it more easily.

name: Favored Enemy: Animals
desc:
You have studied animals and can hunt them more easily. When you roll initiative and can see an enemy that belongs to the animal category, you can Hunt Prey as a free action, designating that enemy.

You can use this free action even if you haven't identified the creature yet with Recall Knowledge. The benefit doesn't apply against animals disguised as other creatures, and the GM determines whether it applies against a creature disguised as an animal.

hints.desc:
When you roll initiative and can see an enemy that belongs to the animal category, you can Hunt Prey as a free action, designating that enemy.

You can use this free action even if you haven't identified the creature yet with Recall Knowledge. The benefit doesn't apply against animals disguised as other creatures, and the GM determines whether it applies against a creature disguised as an animal.

shortdesc: You have studied animals and can hunt them more easily.

name: Favored Enemy: Beasts
desc:
You have studied beasts and can hunt them more easily. When you roll initiative and can see an enemy that belongs to the beast category, you can Hunt Prey as a free action, designating that enemy.

You can use this free action even if you haven't identified the creature yet with Recall Knowledge. The benefit doesn't apply against beasts disguised as other creatures, and the GM determines whether it applies against a creature disguised as a beast.

hints.desc:
When you roll initiative and can see an enemy that belongs to the beast category, you can Hunt Prey as a free action, designating that enemy.

You can use this free action even if you haven't identified the creature yet with Recall Knowledge. The benefit doesn't apply against beasts disguised as other creatures, and the GM determines whether it applies against a creature disguised as a beast.

shortdesc: You have studied beasts and can hunt them more easily.

name: Favored Enemy: Dragons
desc:
You have studied dragons and can hunt them more easily. When you roll initiative and can see an enemy that belongs to the dragon category, you can Hunt Prey as a free action, designating that enemy.

You can use this free action even if you haven't identified the creature yet with Recall Knowledge. The benefit doesn't apply against dragons disguised as other creatures, and the GM determines whether it applies against a creature disguised as a dragon.

hints.desc:
When you roll initiative and can see an enemy that belongs to the dragon category, you can Hunt Prey as a free action, designating that enemy.

You can use this free action even if you haven't identified the creature yet with Recall Knowledge. The benefit doesn't apply against dragons disguised as other creatures, and the GM determines whether it applies against a creature disguised as a dragon.

shortdesc: You have studied dragons and can hunt them more easily.

name: Favored Enemy: Fungi and Plants
desc:
You have studied fungi and plants and can hunt them more easily. When you roll initiative and can see an enemy that belongs to the fungus or plant category, you can Hunt Prey as a free action, designating that enemy.

You can use this free action even if you haven't identified the creature yet with Recall Knowledge. The benefit doesn't apply against fungi and plants disguised as other creatures, and the GM determines whether it applies against a creature disguised as a fungus or plant.

hints.desc:
When you roll initiative and can see an enemy that belongs to the fungus or plant category, you can Hunt Prey as a free action, designating that enemy.

You can use this free action even if you haven't identified the creature yet with Recall Knowledge. The benefit doesn't apply against fungi and plants disguised as other creatures, and the GM determines whether it applies against a creature disguised as a fungus or plant.

shortdesc: You have studied fungi and plants and can hunt them more easily.

name: Running Reload
desc: You can reload your weapon on the move.
shortdesc: You can reload your weapon on the move.

name: Snare Specialist
desc:
You specialize in creating quick traps to obstruct your enemies on the battlefield. If your proficiency rank in Crafting is expert, you gain the formulas for three common or uncommon snares (page 589). If your rank is master, you gain 6. If your rank is legendary, you gain 9.

Each day during your daily preparations, you can prepare four snares from your formula book for quick deployment; if they normally take 1 minute to Craft, you can Craft them with 3 Interact actions. The number of snares increases to six if you have master proficiency in Crafting and eight if you have legendary proficiency in Crafting. Snares prepared in this way don't cost you any resources to Craft.

hints.desc: Snares prepared via Snare Specialist way don't cost you any resources to Craft.

internalNote: The quick deployment allowance is hardcoded.
shortdesc: You specialize in creating quick traps to obstruct your enemies on the battlefield.

name: Mature Animal Companion (Ranger)
desc: Your animal companion grows up, becoming a mature animal companion and gaining additional capabilities (page 214). If you have the Hunt Prey action, your animal companion assaults the prey even without your orders. During an encounter, even if you don't use the Command an Animal action, your animal companion can still use 1 action that round on your turn to Stride toward or Strike your prey.

hints.desc: If you have the Hunt Prey action, your animal companion assaults the prey even without your orders. During an encounter, even if you don't use the Command an Animal action, your animal companion can still use 1 action that round on your turn to Stride toward or Strike your prey.
hints.showon: Hunt Prey, Hunt Prey: Flurry, Hunt Prey: Outwit, Hunt Prey: Precision, Animal Companion

shortdesc: Your animal companion grows up, gaining additional capabilities.

name: Quick Snares
desc: You can rig a snare in only moments. You can Craft snares that normally take 1 minute to Craft with 3 Interact actions, even if you haven't prepared them.

hints.desc: You can Craft snares that normally take 1 minute to Craft with 3 Interact actions, even if you haven't prepared them.

shortdesc: You can rig a snare in only moments.

name: Snap Shot
desc: You've learned to react with ranged weapons when a creature is in close quarters. You can use a reaction that normally allows you to make a melee weapon Strike to instead make a ranged weapon Strike. You must be Striking an adjacent target. If necessary for the reaction's trigger, you treat your ranged weapon as if it had a reach of 5 feet. If the reaction has other requirements, such as wielding a specific kind of weapon, Snap Shot doesn't allow you to ignore them; it allows you only to replace a melee weapon Strike with a ranged weapon Strike.

hints.desc: You can use a reaction that normally allows you to make a melee weapon Strike to instead make a ranged weapon Strike. You must be Striking an adjacent target. If necessary for the reaction's trigger, you treat your ranged weapon as if it had a reach of 5 feet. If the reaction has other requirements, such as wielding a specific kind of weapon, Snap Shot doesn't allow you to ignore them; it allows you only to replace a melee weapon Strike with a ranged weapon Strike.

shortdesc: You've learned to react with ranged weapons when a creature is in close quarters.

name: Swift Tracker
desc:
Your keen eyes catch signs of passage even when you're moving. You can move at your full Speed while you Track. If you have master proficiency in Survival, you don't need to attempt a new Survival check every hour while Tracking. If you have legendary proficiency in Survival, you can use another exploration activity while Tracking.

If you roll Survival for initiative while tracking your hunted prey, when you start your first turn of the encounter, you can Stride toward your hunted prey as a free action.

hints.desc:
You can move at your full Speed while you Track. If you have master proficiency in Survival, you don't need to attempt a new Survival check every hour while Tracking. If you have legendary proficiency in Survival, you can use another exploration activity while Tracking.

If you roll Survival for initiative while tracking your hunted prey, when you start your first turn of the encounter, you can Stride toward your hunted prey as a free action.

shortdesc: Your keen eyes catch signs of passage even when you're moving.

name: Deadly Aim
desc: You aim for your prey's weak spots, making your shot more challenging but dealing more damage if you hit.
shortdesc: You aim for your prey's weak spots, making your shot more challenging but dealing more damage if you hit.

name: Hazard Finder
desc: You have an intuitive ability to sense hazards. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to find traps and hazards, to AC against their attacks, and to saves against their effects. You can find hazards that would normally require you to Search even if you aren't Searching.

hints.desc: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to find traps and hazards, to AC against their attacks, and to saves against their effects. You can find hazards that would normally require you to Search even if you aren't Searching.

shortdesc: You have an intuitive ability to sense hazards.

name: Powerful Snares
desc: Your snares are particularly difficult for enemies to avoid. When you set a snare, the saving throw DC for that snare is equal to its normal DC or your class DC, whichever is higher.

hints.desc: When you set a snare, the saving throw DC for that snare is equal to its normal DC or your class DC, whichever is higher.

shortdesc: Your snares are particularly dif cult for enemies to avoid.

name: Terrain Master
desc: You adapt to your surroundings in any natural terrain. You can spend 1 hour practicing in your current terrain in order to make it your favored terrain, replacing your current favored terrain temporarily. If you spend a full day out of the new favored terrain, your favored terrain reverts back to your original choice when you took the Favored Terrain feat.

hints.desc: You can spend 1 hour practicing in your current terrain in order to make it your favored terrain, replacing your current favored terrain temporarily. If you spend a full day out of the new favored terrain, your favored terrain reverts back to your original choice when you took the Favored Terrain feat.

shortdesc: You adapt to your surroundings in any natural terrain.

name: Warden's Boon
desc: By pointing out vulnerabilities, you grant an ally benefits from your hunting abilities.
shortdesc: By pointing out vulnerabilities, you grant an ally benefits from your hunting abilities.

name: Camouflage
desc: You alter your appearance to blend in to the wilderness. In natural terrain, you can Sneak even if you're observed.

hints.desc: In natural terrain, you can Sneak even if you're observed.

shortdesc: You alter your appearance to blend in to the wilderness.

name: Incredible Companion (Ranger)
desc:
Your animal companion continues to grow and develop. It becomes a nimble or savage animal companion (your choice), gaining additional capabilities determined by the type of companion (page 214).

To advance a mature animal companion to a nimble animal companion, increase its Dexterity modifier by 2 and its Strength, Constitution, and Wisdom modifiers by 1. It deals 2 additional damage with its unarmed attacks. Increase its proficiency ranks in Acrobatics and unarmored defense to expert. It also learns the advanced maneuver for its type. Its attacks become magical for the purpose of ignoring resistances.

To advance a mature animal companion to a savage animal companion, increase its Strength modifier by 2 and its Dexterity, Constitution, and Wisdom modifiers by 1. It deals 3 additional damage with its unarmed attacks. Increase its proficiency rank in Athletics to expert. It also learns the advanced maneuver for its type. If your companion is Medium or smaller, it grows by one size. Its attacks become magical for the purpose of ignoring resistances.
shortdesc: Your animal companion continues to grow and develop.

name: Incredible Companion (Ranger): Nimble
desc:
Your animal companion continues to grow and develop. It becomes a nimble animal companion (your choice), gaining additional capabilities determined by the type of companion (page 214).

To advance a mature animal companion to a nimble animal companion, increase its Dexterity modifier by 2 and its Strength, Constitution, and Wisdom modifiers by 1. It deals 2 additional damage with its unarmed attacks. Increase its proficiency ranks in Acrobatics and unarmored defense to expert. It also learns the advanced maneuver for its type. Its attacks become magical for the purpose of ignoring resistances.
shortdesc: Your animal companion continues to grow and develop.
specialreqdesc: no advanced animal companion

name: Incredible Companion (Ranger): Savage
desc:
Your animal companion continues to grow and develop. It becomes a savage animal companion (your choice), gaining additional capabilities determined by the type of companion (page 214).

To advance a mature animal companion to a savage animal companion, increase its Strength modifier by 2 and its Dexterity, Constitution, and Wisdom modifiers by 1. It deals 3 additional damage with its unarmed attacks. Increase its proficiency rank in Athletics to expert. It also learns the advanced maneuver for its type. If your companion is Medium or smaller, it grows by one size. Its attacks become magical for the purpose of ignoring resistances.
shortdesc: Your animal companion continues to grow and develop.
specialreqdesc: no advanced animal companion

name: Master Monster Hunter
desc: You have a nearly encyclopedic knowledge of all creatures of the world. You can use Nature to Recall Knowledge to identify any creature. In addition, you gain the benefits of Monster Hunter (and Monster Warden, if you have it) on a success as well as a critical success.

hints.desc: You can use Nature to Recall Knowledge to identify any creature. In addition, you gain the benefits of Monster Hunter (and Monster Warden, if you have it) on a success as well as a critical success.
hints.showon: Nature, Hunt Prey, Hunt Prey: Flurry, Hunt Prey: Outwit, Hunt Prey: Precision

shortdesc: You have a nearly encyclopedic knowledge of all creatures of the world.

name: Penetrating Shot
desc: You shoot clear through an intervening creature to hit your prey.
shortdesc: You shoot clear through an intervening creature to hit your prey.

name: Warden's Step
desc: You can guide your allies to move quietly through the wilderness. When you Sneak during exploration in natural terrain, you can designate any number of your allies to gain the benefits as if they were using that activity during that exploration. This requires no action on their part.

hints.desc: When you Sneak during exploration in natural terrain, you can designate any number of your allies to gain the benefits as if they were using that activity during that exploration. This requires no action on their part.

shortdesc: You can guide your allies to move quietly through the wilderness.

name: Distracting Shot
desc: The sheer power of your attacks, or the overwhelming number of them, leaves an enemy flustered. If you critically hit your hunted prey with a ranged weapon, or hit it at least twice on the same turn with a ranged weapon, it's flat-footed until the start of your next turn.

hints.desc: If you critically hit your hunted prey with a ranged weapon, or hit it at least twice on the same turn with a ranged weapon, it's flat-footed until the start of your next turn.

shortdesc: The sheer power of your attacks, or the overwhelming number of them, leaves an enemy flustered.

name: Double Prey
desc: You can focus on two foes at once, hunting both of them down. When you use the Hunt Prey action, you can pick two creatures as your prey.

hints.desc: When you use the Hunt Prey action, you can pick two creatures as your prey.
hints.showon: Hunt Prey, Hunt Prey: Flurry, Hunt Prey: Outwit, Hunt Prey: Precision

shortdesc: You can focus on two foes at once, hunting both of them down.

name: Lightning Snares
desc: You can rig a trap with incredible speed. When you create a snare that normally takes 1 minute to Craft, you can Craft it using a single Interact action instead.

hints.desc: When you create a snare that normally takes 1 minute to Craft, you can Craft it using a single Interact action instead.

internalNote: The effect is hardcoded.
shortdesc: You can rig a trap with incredible speed.

name: Second Sting
desc: You read your prey's movements and transform them into openings, so failures with one weapon set up glancing blows with the other.
shortdesc: You read your prey's movements and transform them into openings, so failures with one weapon set up glancing blows with the other.

name: Side by Side (Ranger)
desc: You and your animal companion fight in tandem, distracting your foes and keeping them off balance. Whenever you and your animal companion are adjacent to the same foe, you are both flanking that foe with each other, regardless of your actual positions.

hints.desc: Whenever you and your animal companion are adjacent to the same foe, you are both flanking that foe with each other, regardless of your actual positions.

shortdesc: You and your animal companion fight in tandem, distracting your foes and keeping them of balance.

name: Shared Prey
desc: Hunting as a duo, you and your ally both single out your prey. When you use Hunt Prey and select only one prey, you can grant your Hunt Prey benefits and hunter's edge to an ally in addition to gaining them yourself. The ally retains these benefits until you use Hunt Prey again.

hints.desc: When you use Hunt Prey and select only one prey, you can grant your Hunt Prey benefits and hunter's edge to an ally in addition to gaining them yourself. The ally retains these benefits until you use Hunt Prey again.
hints.showon: Hunt Prey, Hunt Prey: Flurry, Hunt Prey: Outwit, Hunt Prey: Precision

shortdesc: Hunting as a duo, you and your ally both single out your prey.

name: Stealthy Companion
desc: You've trained your animal companion to blend in to its surroundings. Your animal companion gains the benefit of the Camouflage feat. If your companion is a specialized ambusher, its proficiency rank for Stealth increases to master (or legendary if it was already master).

hints.desc: In natural terrain, your companion can Sneak even if it's observed.

shortdesc: You've trained your animal companion to blend in to its surroundings.

name: Targeting Shot
desc: You carefully track your prey's position and defenses.
shortdesc: You carefully track your prey's position and defenses.

name: Warden's Guidance
desc: You can convey your prey's location to your allies, no matter how well hidden it is. As long as your hunted prey is observed by you, all your allies who roll failures and critical failures when Seeking it get a success instead. Your allies need to be able to see or hear you to gain this benefit. You have to be able to call out or use gestures for your allies to get this benefit.

hints.desc: As long as your hunted prey is observed by you, all your allies who roll failures and critical failures when Seeking it get a success instead. Your allies need to be able to see or hear you to gain this benefit. You have to be able to call out or use gestures for your allies to get this benefit.

shortdesc: You can convey your prey's location to your allies, no matter how well hidden it is.

name: Greater Distracting Shot
desc: Even a single missile can throw off your enemy's balance, and more powerful attacks leave it flustered for longer. If you hit your hunted prey with a ranged weapon, it's flat-footed until the start of your next turn. If you critically hit your prey or hit it twice on the same turn with a ranged weapon, it's flat-footed until the end of your next turn instead.

hints.desc: If you hit your hunted prey with a ranged weapon, it's flat-footed until the start of your next turn. If you critically hit your prey or hit it twice on the same turn with a ranged weapon, it's flat-footed until the end of your next turn instead.

shortdesc: Even a single missile can throw of your enemy's balance, and more powerful attacks leave it flustered for longer.

name: Improved Twin Riposte (Ranger)
desc: At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to perform a Twin Riposte against your hunted prey. You can use this extra reaction even if you are not benefiting from Twin Parry.

hints.desc: At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to perform a Twin Riposte against your hunted prey. You can use this extra reaction even if you are not benefiting from Twin Parry.

shortdesc: You are able to riposte an additional time per turn.

name: Legendary Monster Hunter
desc: Your knowledge of monsters is so incredible that it reveals glaring flaws in your prey. Your bonus from Monster Hunter (and the bonus from Monster Warden if you have it) increases from +1 to +2 for you and any allies who benefit.

hints.desc: Your bonus from Monster Hunter (and the bonus from Monster Warden if you have it) increases from +1 to +2 for you and any allies who benefit.
hints.showon: Hunt Prey, Hunt Prey: Flurry, Hunt Prey: Outwit, Hunt Prey: Precision

shortdesc: Your knowledge of monsters is so incredible that it reveals glaring flaws in your prey.

name: Specialized Companion (Ranger)
desc:
Your animal companion has become cunning enough to become specialized. Your animal companion gains one specialization of your choice. (See the Animal Companion section on page 214.)

Specialized animal companions are more intelligent and engage in more complex behaviors. The first time an animal gains a specialization, it gains the following: Its proficiency rank for unarmed attacks increases to expert. Its proficiency ranks for saving throws and Perception increase to master. Increase its Dexterity modifier by 1 and its Intelligence modifier by 2. Its unarmed attack damage increases from two dice to three dice, and it increases its additional damage with unarmed attacks from 2 to 4 or from 3 to 6.
shortdesc: Your animal companion has become cunning enough to become specialized.

name: Ubiquitous Snares
desc: You can prepare a seemingly impossible number of snares in advance, and you're ready to spring them on unsuspecting foes. Double the number of prepared snares from Snare Specialist.
internalNote: The effect is hardcoded.
shortdesc: You can prepare a seemingly impossible number of snares in advance, and you're ready to spring them on unsuspecting foes.

name: Impossible Flurry
desc: You forgo precision to attack at an impossible speed.
shortdesc: You forgo precision to attack at an impossible speed.

name: Impossible Volley
desc: You fire a volley at all foes in an area.
shortdesc: You fire a volley at all foes in an area.

name: Manifold Edge
desc: You've learned every possible edge to use against your foes. When you use Hunt Prey, you can gain a hunter's edge benefit other than the one you selected at 1st level. If you do, you don't gain the additional benefit from masterful hunter.

hints.desc: You've learned every possible edge to use against your foes. When you use Hunt Prey, you can gain a hunter's edge benefit other than the one you selected at 1st level. If you do, you don't gain the additional benefit from masterful hunter.

shortdesc: You've learned every possible edge to use against your foes.

name: Masterful Companion
desc: Your animal companion shares your incredible hunting skills, allowing it to take down your shared prey with ease. When you Hunt Prey, your animal companion gains the masterful hunter benefit associated with your hunter's edge, rather than just your original hunter's edge benefit.

hints.desc: When you Hunt Prey, your animal companion gains the masterful hunter benefit associated with your hunter's edge, rather than just your original hunter's edge benefit.

shortdesc: Your animal companion shares your incredible hunting skills, allowing it to take down your shared prey with ease.

name: Perfect Shot
desc: After watching the motions of combat with incredible intensity and precision, you fire at your prey at the perfect moment to deliver maximum pain.
shortdesc: After watching the motions of combat with incredible intensity and precision, you fire at your prey at the perfect moment to deliver maximum pain.

name: Shadow Hunter
desc: You blend in to your surroundings so well that others have trouble telling you apart from the terrain. While in natural terrain, you're always concealed from all foes if you choose to be, except for your hunted prey.

hints.desc: While in natural terrain, you're always concealed from all foes if you choose to be, except for your hunted prey.

shortdesc: You blend in to your surroundings so well that others have trouble telling you apart from the terrain.

name: Legendary Shot
desc: You focus on your hunted prey, perceiving angles, air resistance, and every variable that would affect your ranged attack. If you have master proficiency with your ranged weapon, you can ignore the penalty for attacking up to five range increments away when attacking your hunted prey.

hints.desc: If you have master proficiency with your ranged weapon, you can ignore the penalty for attacking up to five range increments away when attacking your hunted prey.

shortdesc: You focus on your hunted prey, perceiving angles, air resistance, and every variable that would af ect your ranged attack.

name: Superior Sight
desc: Your senses are peerless. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks, and you gain low-light vision. If you already have low-light vision, gain darkvision instead. Furthermore, when you target an enemy, you automatically succeed at the flat check if that enemy is concealed, hidden, or undetected.
specialdesc: The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion - ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor's Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise's trainers and records unlock this uncommon class feat.

hints.desc: When you target an enemy, you automatically succeed at the flat check if that enemy is concealed, hidden, or undetected.

shortdesc: Increase your visual acuity.

name: Superior Sight: Low-Light Vision
desc: Your senses are peerless. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks, and you gain low-light vision. Furthermore, when you target an enemy, you automatically succeed at the flat check if that enemy is concealed, hidden, or undetected.
specialdesc: The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion - ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor's Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise's trainers and records unlock this uncommon class feat.

hints.desc: When you target an enemy, you automatically succeed at the flat check if that enemy is concealed, hidden, or undetected.

shortdesc: Increase your visual acuity.
specialreqdesc: no low-light vision

name: Superior Sight: Darkvision
desc: Your senses are peerless. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks, and you gain darkvision. Furthermore, when you target an enemy, you automatically succeed at the flat check if that enemy is concealed, hidden, or undetected.
specialdesc: The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion - ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor's Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise's trainers and records unlock this uncommon class feat.

hints.desc: When you target an enemy, you automatically succeed at the flat check if that enemy is concealed, hidden, or undetected.

shortdesc: Increase your visual acuity.
specialreqdesc: low-light vision

name: To the Ends of the Earth
desc: Your ability to track your prey has surpassed explanation, allowing you to trace your prey's movements and predict its location with ease. When you use Hunt Prey on a creature within 100 feet, you can follow that creature's movements, allowing you to know the creature's exact location no matter how far away it becomes, as long as it remains your prey. You must be legendary in Nature to track your prey's location across teleportation or planar travel. This feat gains the detection, divination, and primal traits if you're legendary in Nature.

hints.desc: When you use Hunt Prey on a creature within 100 feet, you can follow that creature's movements, allowing you to know the creature's exact location no matter how far away it becomes, as long as it remains your prey. You must be legendary in Nature to track your prey's location across teleportation or planar travel. This feat gains the detection, divination, and primal traits if you're legendary in Nature.

shortdesc: Your ability to track your prey has surpassed explanation, allowing you to trace your prey's movements and predict its location with ease.

name: Triple Threat
desc: You can divide your attention three ways when hunting. When you use Hunt Prey, you can designate three creatures as prey, designate two creatures as prey and share the effect with one ally (as Shared Prey), or designate one creature as prey and share the effect with two allies.

hints.desc: When you use Hunt Prey, you can designate three creatures as prey, designate two creatures as prey and share the effect with one ally (as Shared Prey), or designate one creature as prey and share the effect with two allies.

shortdesc: You can divide your attention three ways when hunting.

name: Ultimate Skirmisher
desc: You are so skilled at navigating the wild, your movement is completely unaffected by terrain. You ignore the effects of all difficult terrain, greater difficult terrain, and hazardous terrain, and you don't trigger traps and hazards that are triggered by moving into an area (such as trip wires and pressure plates), unless you want to.

hints.desc: You ignore the effects of all difficult terrain, greater difficult terrain, and hazardous terrain, and you don't trigger traps and hazards that are triggered by moving into an area (such as trip wires and pressure plates), unless you want to.

shortdesc: You are so skilled at navigating the wild, your movement is completely unaffected by terrain.

name: Ranger Dedication
desc:
You become trained in Survival; if you were already trained in Survival, you instead become trained in another skill of your choice. You become trained in ranger class DC.

You can use the Hunt Prey action.
specialdesc: You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the ranger archetype.
shortdesc: You have studied hunting, tracking, and wilderness survival, adding a ranger's tools to your skill set.

name: Basic Hunter's Trick
desc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level ranger feat.
shortdesc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level ranger feat.

name: Ranger Resiliency
desc: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each ranger archetype class feat you have. As you continue selecting ranger archetype class feats, you continue to gain additional Hit Points in this way.
shortdesc: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each ranger archetype class feat you have.
specialreqdesc: class granting no more Hit Points per level than 8 + your Constitution modifier

name: Advanced Hunter's Trick
desc: You gain one ranger feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your ranger level is equal to half your character level.
specialdesc: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another ranger feat.
shortdesc: You gain one ranger feat.

name: Master Spotter
desc: Your proficiency rank in Perception increases to master.
shortdesc: Your proficiency rank in Perception increases to master.

name: Abjuration School
desc: As an abjurer, you master the art of protection, strengthening defenses, preventing attacks, and even turning magic against itself. You understand that an ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure. You add one 1st-level abjuration spell (such as feather fall) to your spellbook. You learn the protective ward school spell.
shortdesc: As an abjurer, you master the art of protection, strengthening defenses, preventing attacks, and even turning magic against itself.

name: Conjuration School
desc: As a conjurer, you summon creatures and objects from places beyond, and use magic to transport to distant locales. You understand that the true key to victory is strength in numbers. You add one 1st-level conjuration spell (such as summon animal) to your spellbook. You learn the augment summoning school spell.
shortdesc: As a conjurer, you summon creatures and objects from places beyond, and use magic to transport to distant locales.

name: Divination School
desc: As a diviner, you master remote viewing and prescience, learning information that can transform investigations, research, and battle strategies. You understand that knowledge is power. You add one 1st-level divination spell (such as true strike) to your spellbook. You learn the diviner's sight school spell.
shortdesc: As a diviner, you master remote viewing and prescience, learning information that can transform investigations, research, and battle strategies.

name: Enchantment School
desc: As an enchanter, you use magic to manipulate others' minds. You might use your abilities to subtly influence others or seize control over them. You understand that the mind surpasses matter. You add one 1st-level enchantment spell (such as charm) to your spellbook. You learn the charming words school spell.
shortdesc: As an enchanter, you use magic to manipulate others' minds.

name: Evocation School
desc: As an evoker, you revel in the raw power of magic, using it to create and destroy with ease. You can call forth elements, forces, and energy to devastate your foes or to assist you in other ways. You understand that the most direct approach is the most elegant. You add one 1st-level evocation spell (such as shocking grasp) to your spellbook. You learn the force bolt school spell.
shortdesc: As an evoker, you revel in the raw power of magic, using it to create and destroy with ease.

name: Illusion School
desc: As an illusionist, you use magic to create images, figments, and phantasms to baffle your enemies. You understand that perception is reality. You add one 1st-level illusion spell (such as illusory object) to your spellbook. You learn the warped terrain school spell.
shortdesc: As an illusionist, you use magic to create images, figments, and phantasms to baffle your enemies.

name: Necromancy School
desc: As a necromancer, you call upon the powers of life and death. While your school is often vilified for its association with raising the undead, you understand that control over life also means control over healing. You add one 1st-level necromancy spell (such as grim tendrils) to your spellbook. You learn the call of the grave school spell.
shortdesc: As a necromancer, you call upon the powers of life and death.

name: Transmutation School
desc: As a transmuter, you alter the physical properties of things, transforming creatures, objects, the natural world, and even yourself at your whim. You understand that change is inevitable. You add one 1st-level transmutation spell (such as magic weapon) to your spellbook. You learn the physical boost school spell.
shortdesc: As a transmuter, you alter the physical properties of things, transforming creatures, objects, the natural world, and even yourself at your whim.

name: Universalist Wizard
desc: Instead of specializing narrowly in an arcane school, you can become a universalist wizard-by studying all the schools equally, you devote yourself to understanding the full breadth of the arcane arts.
