For each level of spell you can cast, you can use Drain Bonded item once per day to recall a spell of that level (instead of using it only once per day in total). You gain an extra wizard class feat, and you add one 1st-level spell of your choice to your spellbook.

hints.desc: For each level of spell you can cast, you can use Drain Bonded item once per day to recall a spell of that level (instead of using it only once per day in total).

internalNote: The effect on Drain Bonded Item is hardcoded.
shortdesc: Instead of specializing narrowly in an arcane school, you can become a universalist wizard-by studying all the schools equally, you devote yourself to understanding the full breadth of the arcane arts.

name: Improved Familiar Attunement
desc: You've long held that fine-tuning the magic that bonds wizard and familiar can improve the mystic connection, compared to the safe yet generic bond most wizards currently use. You've formed such a pact with your familiar, gaining more advantages from it than most wizards. You gain the Familiar wizard feat as a bonus feat. Your familiar gains an extra ability, and it gains an additional extra ability when you reach 6th, 12th, and 18th levels. Your connection with your familiar alters your arcane bond class feature so that you store your magical energy in your familiar, rather than an item you own; you also gain the Drain Familiar free action instead of Drain Bonded Item. Drain Familiar can be used any time an ability would allow you to use Drain Bonded Item and functions identically, except that you draw magic from your familiar instead of an item.
shortdesc: You've long held that fine-tuning the magic that bonds wizard and familiar can improve the mystic connection, compared to the safe yet generic bond most wizards currently use.

name: Metamagical Experimentation
desc: You've realized that the practice known as metamagic is a holdover from a time long ago, when wizards had to work out their own spells and variations rather than rely on spells recorded by others and passed down over the years. This allows you efficient access to various metamagic effects. You gain a 1st-level metamagic wizard feat as a bonus feat. Starting at 4th level, during your daily preparations, you can gain a metamagic wizard feat of your choice that has a level requirement of no more than half your level, which you can use until your next daily preparations.
shortdesc: You've realized that the practice known as metamagic is a holdover from a time long ago, when wizards had to work out their own spells and variations rather than rely on spells recorded by others and passed down over the years.

name: Spell Blending
desc: You theorize that spell slots are a shorthand for an underlying energy that powers all spellcasting, and you've found a way to tinker with the hierarchy of spell slots, combining them to fuel more powerful spells. When you make your daily preparations, you can trade two spell slots of the same level for a bonus spell slot of up to 2 levels higher than the traded spell slots. You can exchange as many spell slots as you have available. Bonus spell slots must be of a level you can normally cast, and each bonus spell slot must be of a different spell level. You can also trade any spell slot for two additional cantrips, though you cannot trade more than one spell slot at a time for additional cantrips in this way.

hints.desc: When you make your daily preparations, you can trade two spell slots of the same level for a bonus spell slot of up to 2 levels higher than the traded spell slots. You can exchange as many spell slots as you have available. Bonus spell slots must be of a level you can normally cast, and each bonus spell slot must be of a different spell level. You can also trade any spell slot for two additional cantrips, though you cannot trade more than one spell slot at a time for additional cantrips in this way. You can make this selection in the spellbook menu.

internalNote: Spell Blending is hardcoded.
shortdesc: You theorize that spell slots are a shorthand for an underlying energy that powers all spellcasting, and you've found a way to tinker with the hierarchy of spell slots, combining them to fuel more powerful spells.

name: Spell Substitution
desc: You don't accept the fact that once spells are prepared, they can't be changed until your next daily preparation, and you have uncovered a shortcut allowing you to substitute new spells for those you originally prepared. You can spend 10 minutes to empty one of your prepared spell slots and prepare a different spell from your spellbook in its place. If you are interrupted during such a swap, the original spell remains prepared and can still be cast. You can try again to swap out the spell later, but you must start the process over again.

hints.desc:
You can spend 10 minutes to empty one of your prepared spell slots and prepare a different spell from your spellbook in its place. If you are interrupted during such a swap, the original spell remains prepared and can still be cast. You can try again to swap out the spell later, but you must start the process over again.

You can make this change in the spellbook menu. When this hint's effect is activated, selected spells are immediately prepared, as if you had used Spell Substitution to replace a currently prepared spell.

shortdesc: You don't accept the fact that once spells are prepared, they can't be changed until your next daily preparation, and you have uncovered a shortcut allowing you to substitute new spells for those you originally prepared.

name: Counterspell (Prepared)
desc: When a foe Casts a Spell and you can see its manifestations, you can use your own magic to disrupt it.
internalNote: Using a spell to counterspell is hardcoded.
shortdesc: When a foe Casts a Spell and you can see its manifestations, you can use your own magic to disrupt it.

name: Eschew Materials
desc: You can use clever workarounds to replicate the arcane essence of certain materials. When Casting a Spell that requires material components, you can provide these material components without a spell component pouch by drawing intricate replacement sigils in the air. Unlike when providing somatic components, you still must have a hand completely free. This doesn't remove the need for any materials listed in the spell's cost entry.

hints.desc: When Casting a Spell that requires material components, you can provide these material components without a spell component pouch by drawing intricate replacement sigils in the air. Unlike when providing somatic components, you still must have a hand completely free. This doesn't remove the need for any materials listed in the spell's cost entry.

shortdesc: You can use clever workarounds to replicate the arcane essence of certain materials.

name: Familiar
desc: You make a pact with creature that serves you and assists your spellcasting. You gain a familiar (page 217).
shortdesc: An animal serves you and assists your spellcasting.
specialreqdesc: no familiar

name: Hand of the Apprentice
desc: You can magically hurl your weapon at your foe. You gain the hand of the apprentice universalist spell. Universalist spells are a type of focus spell, much like school spells. You start with a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. See Arcane Schools on page 207 for more information about focus spells.
shortdesc: You can magically hurl your weapon at your foe.

name: Reach Spell
desc: You can extend the range of your spells. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell that has a range, increase that spell's range by 30 feet. As is standard for increasing spell ranges, if the spell normally has a range of touch, you extend its range to 30 feet.
shortdesc: You can extend the range of your spells.

name: Widen Spell
desc: You manipulate the energy of your spell, causing it to spread out and affect a wider area. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and does not have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.
shortdesc: You manipulate the energy of your spell, causing it to spread out and affect a wider area.

name: Cantrip Expansion (Prepared)
desc: A greater understanding of your magic broadens your range of simple spells. You can prepare two additional cantrips each day.
shortdesc: Study broadens your range of simple spells.

name: Conceal Spell
desc: Hiding your gestures and incantations within other speech and movement, you attempt to conceal the fact that you are casting a spell.
shortdesc: Hiding your gestures and incantations within other speech and movement, you attempt to conceal the fact that you are casting a spell.

name: Enhanced Familiar
desc: You infuse your familiar with additional magical energy. You can select four familiar or master abilities each day, instead of two.
specialdesc: (Wizard) If your arcane thesis is improved familiar attunement, your familiar's base number of familiar abilities, before adding any extra abilities from the arcane thesis, is four.
shortdesc: You infuse your familiar with additional primal energy, increasing its abilities.
specialreqdesc: a familiar

name: Bespell Weapon
desc: You siphon the residual energy from the last spell you cast into one weapon you're wielding.
shortdesc: You siphon the residual energy from the last spell you cast into one weapon you're wielding.

name: Linked Focus
desc: You have linked your bonded item to the well of energy that powers your school spells. When you Drain your Bonded Item to cast a spell of your arcane school, you also regain 1 Focus Point.

hints.desc: When you Drain your Bonded Item to cast a spell of your arcane school, you also regain 1 Focus Point.

internalNote: The effect is part of the Drain Bonded Item mechanism.
shortdesc: You have linked your bonded item to the well of energy that powers your school spells.
specialreq: Feats_Taken('Character').find(gain => ['Abjuration School', 'Conjuration School', 'Divination School', 'Enchantment School', 'Evocation School', 'Illusion School', 'Necromancy School', 'Transmutation School'].includes(gain.name))
specialreqdesc: arcane school

name: Silent Spell
desc: You've learned how to cast many of your spells without speaking the words of power you would normally need to provide.
shortdesc: You've learned how to cast many of your spells without speaking the words of power you would normally need to provide.

name: Spell Penetration
desc: You've studied ways of overcoming the innate magical resistance that dragons, otherworldly beings, and certain other powerful creatures have. Any creature that has a status bonus to saving throws against magic reduces that bonus by 1 against your spells.

hints.desc: Any creature that has a status bonus to saving throws against magic reduces that bonus by 1 against your spells.

shortdesc: You've studied ways of overcoming the innate magical resistance that certain powerful creatures have.

name: Steady Spellcasting
desc: Confident in your technique, you don't easily lose your concentration when you Cast a Spell. If a reaction would disrupt your spellcasting action, attempt a DC 15 flat check. If you succeed, your action isn't disrupted.

hints.desc: If a reaction would disrupt your spellcasting action, attempt a DC 15 flat check. If you succeed, your action isn't disrupted.

shortdesc: You don't lose spells easily.

name: Advanced School Spell
desc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school. If you're an abjurer, you gain energy absorption; if you're a conjurer, you gain dimensional steps; if you're a diviner, you gain vigilant eye; if you're an enchanter, you gain dread aura; if you're an evoker, you gain elemental tempest; if you're an illusionist, you gain invisibility cloak; if you're a necromancer, you gain life siphon; and if you're a transmuter, you gain shifting form. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school.
specialreq: Feats_Taken('Character').find(gain => ['Abjuration School', 'Conjuration School', 'Divination School', 'Enchantment School', 'Evocation School', 'Illusion School', 'Necromancy School', 'Transmutation School'].includes(gain.name))
specialreqdesc: arcane school

name: Advanced School Spell: Abjuration
desc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school. As an abjurer, you gain energy absorption. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school.

name: Advanced School Spell: Conjuration
desc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school. As a conjurer, you gain dimensional steps. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school.

name: Advanced School Spell: Divination
desc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school. As a diviner, you gain vigilant eye. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school.

name: Advanced School Spell: Enchantment
desc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school. As an enchanter, you gain dread aura. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school.

name: Advanced School Spell: Evocation
desc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school. As an evoker, you gain elemental tempest. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school.

name: Advanced School Spell: Illusion
desc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school. As an illusionist, you gain invisibility cloak. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school.

name: Advanced School Spell: Necromancy
desc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school. As a necromancer, you gain life siphon. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school.

name: Advanced School Spell: Transmutation
desc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school. As a transmuter, you gain shifting form. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You gain access to a powerful new school spell depending on your arcane school.

name: Bond Conservation
desc: By carefully manipulating the arcane energies stored in your bonded item as you drain it, you can conserve just enough power to cast another, slightly weaker spell.
shortdesc: By carefully manipulating the arcane energies stored in your bonded item as you drain it, you can conserve just enough power to cast another, slightly weaker spell.

name: Universal Versatility
desc: You can access the fundamental abilities of any school of magic. During your daily preparations, choose one of the eight school spells gained by 1st-level specialist wizards. You can use that school spell until your next daily preparations. When you Refocus, you can choose a different school spell from among those eight school spells, replacing the previous one. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

hints.desc: During your daily preparations, and when you refocus, you can choose one of the eight school spells gained by 1st-level specialist wizards to use until your next daily prepararations. You can make this selection in the spellbook menu.

shortdesc: You can access the fundamental abilities of any school of magic.

name: Overwhelming Energy
desc: You alter your spells to overcome resistances.
shortdesc: You alter your spells to overcome resistances.

name: Quickened Casting
desc: You are able to quickly cast a spell.
shortdesc: You are able to quickly cast a spell.

name: Scroll Savant
desc:
During your daily preparations, you can create two temporary scrolls containing arcane spells from your spellbook. These scrolls follow the normal rules for scrolls (page 564), with some additional restrictions. Each scroll must be of a different spell level, and both spell levels must be 2 or more levels lower than your highest-level spell. Any scrolls you create this way become non-magical the next time you make your daily preparations. A temporary scroll has no value.

If you have master proficiency in arcane spell DCs, you can create three temporary scrolls during your daily preparations, and if you have legendary proficiency, you can create four temporary scrolls.

hints.desc: During your daily preparations, you can create temporary scrolls containing arcane spells from your spellbook. You can select these scrolls in the items menu.

internalNote: Scroll Savant is hardcoded.
shortdesc: During your daily preparations, you can create two temporary scrolls containing arcane spells from your spellbook.

name: Clever Counterspell
desc: You creatively apply your prepared spells to Counterspell a much wider variety of your opponents' magic. Instead of being able to counter a foe's spell with Counterspell only if you have that same spell prepared, you can use Counterspell as long as you have the spell the foe is casting in your spellbook. When you use Counterspell in this way, the prepared spell you expend must share a trait other than its tradition with the triggering spell. At the GM's discretion, you can instead use a spell that has an opposing trait or that otherwise logically would counter the triggering spell (such as using a cold or water spell to counter fireball or using remove fear to counter a fear spell). Regardless of what spell you expend, you take a -2 penalty to your counteract check, though the GM can waive this penalty if the expended spell is especially appropriate.

hints.desc: You can use Counterspell as long as you have the spell the foe is casting in your spellbook. When you use Counterspell in this way, the prepared spell you expend must share a trait other than its tradition with the triggering spell. At the GM's discretion, you can instead use a spell that has an opposing trait or that otherwise logically would counter the triggering spell (such as using a cold or water spell to counter fireball or using remove fear to counter a fear spell). Regardless of what spell you expend, you take a -2 penalty to your counteract check, though the GM can waive this penalty if the expended spell is especially appropriate.

shortdesc: You creatively apply your prepared spells to counterspell a much wider variety of your opponents' magic.

name: Magic Sense
desc: You have a literal sixth sense for ambient magic in your vicinity. You can sense the presence of magic auras as though you were always using a 1st-level detect magic spell. This detects magic in your field of vision only. When you Seek, you gain the benefits of a 3rd-level detect magic spell on things you see (in addition to the normal benefits of Seeking). You can turn this sense off and on with a free action at the start or the end of your turn.
specialdesc: This feat has the trait corresponding to the tradition of spells you cast (arcane, divine, natural, or occult).
shortdesc: You have a literal sixth sense for magic.

name: Bonded Focus
desc: Your connection to your bonded item increases your focus pool. If you have spent at least 2 Focus Points since the last time you Refocused and your bonded item is in your possession, you recover 2 Focus Points when you Refocus instead of 1.

hints.desc: If you have spent at least 2 Focus Points since the last time you Refocused and your bonded item is in your possession, you recover 2 Focus Points when you Refocus instead of 1.

shortdesc: Your connection to your bonded item increases your focus pool.

name: Reflect Spell
desc: When you successfully use Counterspell to counteract a spell that affects targeted creatures or an area, you can turn that spell's effect back on its caster. When reflected, the spell affects only the original caster, even if it's an area spell or it would normally affect more than one creature. The original caster can attempt a save and use other defenses against the reflected spell as normal.

hints.desc: When you successfully use Counterspell to counteract a spell that affects targeted creatures or an area, you can turn that spell's effect back on its caster. When reflected, the spell affects only the original caster, even if it's an area spell or it would normally affect more than one creature. The original caster can attempt a save and use other defenses against the reflected spell as normal.

shortdesc: You cause a spell to fire back at its caster.

name: Superior Bond
desc: When you draw upon your bonded item, you can leave a bit of energy within it for later use. You can use Drain Bonded Item one additional time per day, but only to cast a spell 2 or more levels lower than your highest-level spell.

hints.desc: You can use Drain Bonded Item one additional time per day, but only to cast a spell 2 or more levels lower than your highest-level spell.

internalNote: The effect is hardcoded.
shortdesc: When you draw upon your bonded item, you can leave a bit of energy within it for later use.

name: Effortless Concentration
desc: You can maintain a spell with hardly a thought.
shortdesc: You can maintain a spell with hardly a thought.

name: Spell Tinker
desc: You've learned to alter choices you make when casting spells on yourself.
shortdesc: You've learned to alter choices you make when casting spells on yourself.

name: Infinite Possibilities
desc: You've found a way to prepare a spell slot that exists in your mind as many different possibilities at once. Once during your daily preparations, you can use a spell slot to hold that infinite potential, rather than using it to prepare a spell. You can use this spell slot to cast any spell from your spellbook that's at least 2 levels lower than the slot you designate; the spell acts in all ways as a spell of 2 levels lower. You don't have any particular spell prepared in that slot until you cast it.

hints.desc: Once during your daily preparations, you can trade in a spell slot for a bonus spell slot that holds infinite potential, rather than using it to prepare a spell. You make this choice in the spellbook menu. You can use this spell slot to cast any spell from your spellbook that's at least 2 levels lower than the slot you designate; the spell acts in all ways as a spell of 2 levels lower. You don't have any particular spell prepared in that slot until you cast it. You choose the spell to cast with this spell slot in the spells area instead of the spellbook menu.

internalNote: Designating a spell slot for Infinite Possibilities is hardcoded.
shortdesc: You've found a way to prepare a spell slot that exists in your mind as many different possibilities at once.

name: Reprepare Spell
desc: You've discovered how to reuse some of your spell slots over and over. You can spend 10 minutes to prepare a spell that you already cast today, regaining access to that spell slot. The spell must be of 4th level or lower and one that does not have a duration. You can reprepare a spell in this way even if you've already reprepared that spell previously in the same day. If you have the spell substitution arcane thesis, you can instead prepare a different spell in an expended slot, as long as the new spell doesn't have a duration. Once you've reprepared a spell in that slot even once, you can use your arcane thesis to substitute only spells without durations into that spell slot.

hints.desc: You can spend 10 minutes to prepare a spell that you already cast today, regaining access to that spell slot. The spell must be of 4th level or lower and one that does not have a duration. You can reprepare a spell in this way even if you've already reprepared that spell previously in the same day. If you have the spell substitution arcane thesis, you can instead prepare a different spell in an expended slot (in the spellbook menu), as long as the new spell doesn't have a duration. Once you've reprepared a spell in that slot even once, you can use your arcane thesis to substitute only spells without durations into that spell slot.

internalNote: Repreparing Spells is hardcoded.
shortdesc: You've discovered how to reuse some of your spell slots over and over.

name: Archwizard's Might
desc: You have mastered the greatest secrets of arcane magic. You gain an additional 10th-level spell slot.
shortdesc: You have mastered the greatest secrets of arcane magic.

name: Metamagic Mastery
desc: Altering your spells doesn't take any longer than casting them normally. You can use metamagic single actions as free actions.

hints.desc: You can use metamagic single actions as free actions.
hints.showon: Activities, Bloodline Conduit, Bond Conservation, Cast Down, Command Undead, Conceal Spell, Defensive Recovery, Dualistic Synergy, Echoing Channel, Form Control, Harmonize, Healing Transformation, Heroic Recovery, Interweave Dispel, Leyline Conduit, Melodious Spell, Mercy, Necrotic Infusion, Overwhelming Energy, Reach Spell, Silent Spell, Synergistic Spell, Tempest-Sun Redirection, Unusual Composition, Widen Spell

shortdesc: Altering your spells doesn't take any longer than casting them normally.

name: Spell Combination
desc:
You can merge spells, producing multiple effects with a single casting. One slot of each level of spell you can cast, except 2nd level and 1st level, becomes a spell combination slot (this doesn't apply to cantrips). When you prepare your spells, you can fill a combination slot with a combination of two spells. Each spell in the combination must be 2 or more spell levels below the slot's level, and both must target only one creature or object or have the option to target only one creature or object. Each spell in the combination must also have the same means of determining whether it has an effect - both spells must require a ranged spell attack roll, require the same type of saving throw, or automatically affect the target.

When you cast a combined spell, it affects only one target, even if the component spells normally affect more than one. If any spell in the combination has further restrictions (such as targeting only living creatures), you must abide by all restrictions. The combined spell uses the shorter of the component spells' ranges. Resolve a combined spell as if were a single spell, but apply the effects of both component spells. For example, if the spell's target succeeded at the save against a combined spell, it would apply the success effect of each spell, and if it critically failed, it would apply the critical failure effect of both spells.

hints.desc:
One slot of each level of spell you can cast, except 2nd level and 1st level, becomes a spell combination slot (this doesn't apply to cantrips). When you prepare your spells, you can fill a combination slot with a combination of two spells. Each spell in the combination must be 2 or more spell levels below the slot's level, and both must target only one creature or object or have the option to target only one creature or object. Each spell in the combination must also have the same means of determining whether it has an effect - both spells must require a ranged spell attack roll, require the same type of saving throw, or automatically affect the target.

When you cast a combined spell, it affects only one target, even if the component spells normally affect more than one. If any spell in the combination has further restrictions (such as targeting only living creatures), you must abide by all restrictions. The combined spell uses the shorter of the component spells' ranges. Resolve a combined spell as if were a single spell, but apply the effects of both component spells. For example, if the spell's target succeeded at the save against a combined spell, it would apply the success effect of each spell, and if it critically failed, it would apply the critical failure effect of both spells.

internalNote: Very much hardcoded.
shortdesc: You can merge spells, producing multiple effects with a single casting.

name: Spell Mastery
desc: You have mastered a handful of spells to such a degree that you can cast them even if you haven't prepared them. Select any four spells of 9th level or lower that you have access to. Each spell you select must be of a different level. These spells are automatically prepared when you make your daily preparations and have their own spell slots. You can select a different array of spells by spending 1 week of downtime retraining your mastered spells.
specialdesc: The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion - ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor's Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise's trainers and records unlock this uncommon class feat.

hints.desc: You can select any four spells of 9th level or lower that you have access to. Each spell you select must be of a different level. These spells are automatically prepared when you make your daily preparations and have their own spell slots. You can select these spells in the spell library, and you can select a different array of spells by spending 1 week of downtime retraining your mastered spells.

internalNote: Selecting Spell Mastery spells is hardcoded.
shortdesc: Master 4 spells.

name: Wizard Dedication
desc: You cast spells like a wizard, gaining a spellbook with four common arcane cantrips of your choice. You gain the Cast a Spell activity. You can prepare two cantrips each day from your spellbook. You're trained in arcane spell attack rolls and spell DCs. Your key spellcasting ability for wizard archetype spells is Intelligence, and they are arcane wizard spells. You become trained in Arcana; if you were already trained in Arcana, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.
specialdesc: You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the wizard archetype.
shortdesc: You have dabbled in the arcane arts and, through discipline and academic study, learned how to cast a few spells.

name: Arcane School Spell
desc: Select one arcane school of magic. You gain the school's initial school spell. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by studying.
shortdesc: Select one arcane school of magic. You gain the school's initial school spell.

name: Arcane School Spell: Abjuration
desc: You gain the abjurations school's protective ward spell. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by studying.
shortdesc: You gain the abjurations school's protective ward spell.

name: Arcane School Spell: Conjuration
desc: You gain the conjurations school's augment summoning spell. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by studying.
shortdesc: You gain the conjurations school's augment summoning spell.

name: Arcane School Spell: Divination
desc: You gain the divinations school's diviner's sight spell. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by studying.
shortdesc: You gain the divinations school's diviner's sight spell.

name: Arcane School Spell: Enchantment
desc: You gain the enchantment school's charming words spell. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by studying.
shortdesc: You gain the enchantment school's charming words spell.

name: Arcane School Spell: Evocation
desc: You gain the evocations school's force bolt spell. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by studying.
shortdesc: You gain the evocations school's force bolt spell.

name: Arcane School Spell: Illusion
desc: You gain the illusion school's protective warped terrain. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by studying.
shortdesc: You gain the illusion school's protective warped terrain.

name: Arcane School Spell: Necromancy
desc: You gain the necromancy school's call of the grave spell. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by studying.
shortdesc: You gain the necromancy school's call of the grave spell.

name: Arcane School Spell: Transmutation
desc: You gain the transmutations school's physical boost spell. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by studying.
shortdesc: You gain the transmutations school's physical boost spell.

name: Basic Arcana
desc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level wizard feat of your choice.
shortdesc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level wizard feat of your choice.

name: Basic Wizard Spellcasting
desc:
You gain the basic spellcasting benefits:

At 4th level, you gain a 1st-level spell slot. At 6th level, you gain a 2nd-level spell slot. At 8th level, you gain a 3rd-level spell slot.

Each time you gain a spell slot of a new level from the wizard archetype, add two common spells of that level to your spellbook.
shortdesc: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.

name: Advanced Arcana
desc: You gain one wizard feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your wizard level is equal to half your character level.
specialdesc: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another wizard feat.
shortdesc: You gain one wizard feat.

name: Arcane Breadth
desc: You can cast more arcane spells each day. Increase the spell slots you gain from wizard archetype feats by 1 for each spell level other than your two highest wizard spell slots.
shortdesc: You can cast more arcane spells each day.

name: Expert Wizard Spellcasting
desc:
You gain the expert spellcasting benefits:

You become an expert in spell attack rolls and spell DCs for arcane spells. At 12th level, you gain a 4th-level spell slot. At 14th level, you gain a 5th-level spell slot. At 16th level, you gain a 6th-level spell slot.
shortdesc: You gain the expert spellcasting benefits.

name: Master Wizard Spellcasting
desc:
You gain the master spellcasting benefits:

You become a master in spell attack rolls and spell DCs for arcane spells. At 18th level, you gain a 7th-level spell slot. At 20th level, you gain a 8th-level spell slot.
shortdesc: You gain the master spellcasting benefits.

name: Ruffian Racket
desc:
You prefer to strong-arm or intimidate others rather than rely on finesse or fancy tricks. You might be an enforcer for organized crime, a highway bandit, or a noble who bullies others with threats of your family's power. Or, you might use your skills on the up and up, in a private security detail or as a guard in a city with the right temperament.

You use whatever tools you have at hand to get the job done. You can deal sneak attack damage with any simple weapon, in addition to the weapons listed in the sneak attack class feature. When you critically succeed at an attack roll using a simple weapon and the target has the flat-footed condition (unable to focus on defending itself), you also apply the critical specialization effect for the weapon you're wielding (page 283). You don't gain these benefits if the weapon has a damage die larger than d8 (after applying any abilities that alter its damage die size).

You're trained in Intimidation and medium armor. You can choose Strength as your key ability score. When you gain light armor expertise, you also gain expert proficiency in medium armor, and when you gain light armor mastery, you also gain master proficiency in medium armor.

hints.desc: You can deal sneak attack damage with any simple weapon, in addition to the weapons listed in the sneak attack class feature. When you critically succeed at an attack roll using a simple weapon and the target has the flat-footed condition (unable to focus on defending itself), you also apply the critical specialization effect for the weapon you're wielding (page 283). You don't gain these benefits if the weapon has a damage die larger than d8 (after applying any abilities that alter its damage die size).

shortdesc: You prefer to strong-arm or intimidate others rather than rely on finesse or fancy tricks.

gainSpecialization.condition: against flat-footed creature, damage die up to d8

name: Scoundrel Racket
desc:
You use fast-talking, flattery, and a silver tongue to avoid danger and escape tricky situations. You might be a grifter or con artist, traveling from place to place with a new story or scheme. Your racket is also ideal for certain reputable professions, like barrister, diplomat, or politician.

When you successfully Feint, the target is flat-footed against melee attacks you attempt against it until the end of your next turn. On a critical success, the target is flat-footed against all melee attacks until the end of your next turn, not just yours.

You're trained in Deception and Diplomacy. You can choose Charisma as your key ability score.

hints.desc: When you successfully Feint, the target is flat-footed against melee attacks you attempt against it until the end of your next turn. On a critical success, the target is flat-footed against all melee attacks until the end of your next turn, not just yours.

shortdesc: You use fast-talking, flattery, and a silver tongue to avoid danger and escape tricky situations.

name: Thief Racket
desc:
Nothing beats the thrill of taking something that belongs to someone else, especially if you can do so completely unnoticed. You might be a pickpocket working the streets, a cat burglar sneaking through windows and escaping via rooftops, or a safecracker breaking into carefully guarded vaults. You might even work as a consultant, testing clients' defenses by trying to steal something precious.

When a fight breaks out, you prefer swift, lightweight weapons, and you strike where it hurts. When you attack with a finesse melee weapon, you can add your Dexterity modifier to damage rolls instead of your Strength modifier.

You are trained in Thievery.

hints.desc: When you attack with a finesse melee weapon, you can add your Dexterity modifier to damage rolls instead of your Strength modifier.

shortdesc: Nothing beats the thrill of taking something that belongs to someone else, especially if you can do so completely unnoticed.

name: Nimble Dodge
desc: You deftly dodge out of the way.
shortdesc: You deftly dodge out of the way.

name: Trap Finder
desc:
You have an intuitive sense that alerts you to the dangers and presence of traps. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to find traps, to AC against attacks made by traps, and to saves against traps. Even if you aren't Searching, you get a check to find traps that normally require you to be Searching. You still need to meet any other requirements to find the trap.

You can disable traps that require a proficiency rank of master in Thievery. If you have master proficiency in Thievery, you can disable traps that require a proficiency rank of legendary instead, and your circumstance bonuses against traps increase to +2.

hints.desc:
You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to find traps, to AC against attacks made by traps, and to saves against traps. If you have master proficiency in Thievery, your circumstance bonuses against traps increase to +2.

Even if you aren't Searching, you get a check to find traps that normally require you to be Searching. You still need to meet any other requirements to find the trap.
You can disable traps that require a proficiency rank of master in Thievery. If you have master proficiency in Thievery, you can disable traps that require a proficiency rank of legendary instead.

shortdesc: You have an intuitive sense that alerts you to the dangers and presence of traps.

name: Twin Feint
desc: You make a dazzling series of attacks with both weapons, using the first attack to throw your foe of guard against a second attack at a different angle.
shortdesc: You make a dazzling series of attacks with both weapons, using the first attack to throw your foe of guard against a second attack at a different angle.

name: You're Next
desc: After downing a foe, you menacingly remind another foe that you're coming after them next.
shortdesc: After downing a foe, you menacingly remind another foe that you're coming after them next.

name: Brutal Beating
desc: The brutality of your critical hits shakes your foes' confidence. Whenever your Strike is a critical hit and deals damage, the target is frightened 1.

hints.desc: Whenever your Strike is a critical hit and deals damage, the target is frightened 1.

shortdesc: The brutality of your critical hits shakes your foes' confidence.

name: Distracting Feint
desc: Your Feints are far more distracting than normal, drawing your foes' attention and allowing you and your allies to take greater advantage. While a creature is flat-footed by your Feint, it also takes a -2 circumstance penalty to Perception checks and Reflex saves.

hints.desc: While a creature is flat-footed by your Feint, it also takes a -2 circumstance penalty to Perception checks and Reflex saves.

shortdesc: Your Feints are far more distracting than normal, drawing your foes' attention and allowing you and your allies to take greater advantage.

name: Minor Magic
desc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining minor magical abilities from a particular tradition. Choose arcane, divine, occult, or primal magic, and gain two cantrips from the common cantrips available to that tradition. Your key spellcasting ability is Charisma, and you're trained in spell attack rolls and DCs for the tradition of your chosen cantrips.
shortdesc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining minor magical abilities from a particular tradition.

name: Minor Magic: Arcane
desc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining minor magical abilities. You gain two common arcane cantrips. Your key spellcasting ability is Charisma, and you're trained in arcane spell attack rolls and DCs.
shortdesc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining two common arcane cantrips.

name: Minor Magic: Divine
desc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining minor magical abilities. You gain two common divine cantrips. Your key spellcasting ability is Charisma, and you're trained in divine spell attack rolls and DCs.
shortdesc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining two common divine cantrips.

name: Minor Magic: Occult
desc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining minor magical abilities. You gain two common occult cantrips. Your key spellcasting ability is Charisma, and you're trained in occult spell attack rolls and DCs.
shortdesc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining two common occult cantrips.

name: Minor Magic: Primal
desc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining minor magical abilities. You gain two common primal cantrips. Your key spellcasting ability is Charisma, and you're trained in primal spell attack rolls and DCs.
shortdesc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining two common primal cantrips.

name: Mobility
desc: You move in a way that denies your enemies the opportunity to retaliate. When you take a Stride action to move half your Speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions. You can use Mobility when Climbing, Flying, or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

hints.desc: When you take a Stride action to move half your Speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions. You can use Mobility when Climbing, Flying, or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

shortdesc: You move in a way that denies your enemies the opportunity to retaliate.

name: Quick Draw
desc: You draw your weapon and attack with the same motion.
shortdesc: You draw your weapon and attack with the same motion.

name: Unbalancing Blow
desc: Interweaving your most powerful attacks in a graceful flow, you temporarily unbalance your foes. Whenever your Strike is a critical hit and deals damage, the target is flat-footed against your attacks until the end of your next turn.

hints.desc: Whenever your Strike is a critical hit and deals damage, the target is flat-footed against your attacks until the end of your next turn.

shortdesc: Interweaving your most powerful attacks in a graceful flow, you temporarily unbalance your foes. Whenever your Strike is a critical hit and deals damage, the target is flat-footed against your attacks until the end of your next turn.

name: Battle Assessment
desc: With careful observation during battle, you identify an enemy's strengths and weaknesses.
shortdesc: With careful observation during battle, you identify an enemy's strengths and weaknesses.

name: Dread Striker
desc: You capitalize on your enemies' fear to slip past their defenses. Any creature that has the frightened condition is also flat-footed against your attacks.

hints.desc: Any creature that has the frightened condition is also flat-footed against your attacks.

shortdesc: You capitalize on your enemies' fear to slip past their defenses.

name: Magical Trickster
desc: Whether you're using magic items, wielding innate magic, or dabbling in spellcasting, you can sneak spells past your foes' defenses as easily as any blade. When you succeed at a spell attack roll against a flat-footed foe's AC and the spell deals damage, you can add your sneak attack damage to the damage roll. If your single spell leads to multiple separate damage rolls, apply your sneak attack damage only once per target.

hints.desc: When you succeed at a spell attack roll against a flat-footed foe's AC and the spell deals damage, you can add your sneak attack damage to the damage roll. If your single spell leads to multiple separate damage rolls, apply your sneak attack damage only once per target.

shortdesc: You can sneak spells past your foes' defenses as easily as any blade.

name: Poison Weapon
desc: You apply poison to a weapon.
specialdesc: During your daily preparations, you can prepare a number of simple injury poisons equal to your rogue level. These poisons deal 1d4 poison damage. Only you can apply these poisons properly, and they expire the next time you prepare.
shortdesc: You apply poison to a weapon.

name: Reactive Pursuit
desc: You keep pace with a retreating foe.
shortdesc: You keep pace with a retreating foe.

name: Sabotage
desc: You subtly damage others' equipment.
shortdesc: You subtly damage others' equipment.

name: Scout's Warning
desc: You visually or audibly warn your allies of danger.
shortdesc: You visually or audibly warn your allies of danger.

name: Gang Up
desc: You and your allies harry an opponent in concert. Any enemy is flat-footed against your melee attacks due to flanking as long as the enemy is within both your reach and your ally's. Your allies must still flank an enemy for it to be flat-footed to them.

hints.desc: Any enemy is flat-footed against your melee attacks due to flanking as long as the enemy is within both your reach and your ally's. Your allies must still flank an enemy for it to be flat-footed to them.

shortdesc: You and your allies harry an opponent in concert.

name: Light Step
desc: You aren't bothered by tricky footing. When you Stride or Step, you can ignore difficult terrain.

hints.desc: When you Stride or Step, you can ignore difficult terrain.

shortdesc: You aren't bothered by tricky footing.

name: Skirmish Strike
desc: Your feet and weapon move in tandem.
shortdesc: Your feet and weapon move in tandem.

name: Twist the Knife
desc: After stabbing your opponent in a weak spot, you tear the wound open.
shortdesc: After stabbing your opponent in a weak spot, you tear the wound open.

name: Blind-Fight
desc:
Your battle instincts make you more aware of concealed and invisible opponents. You don't need to succeed at a flat check to target concealed creatures. You're not flat-footed to creatures that are hidden from you (unless you're flat-footed to them for reasons other than the hidden condition), and you need only a successful DC 5 flat check to target a hidden creature.

While you're adjacent to an undetected creature of your level or lower, it is instead only hidden from you.

hints.desc:
You don't need to succeed at a flat check to target concealed creatures. You're not flat-footed to creatures that are hidden from you (unless you're flat-footed to them for reasons other than the hidden condition), and you need only a successful DC 5 flat check to target a hidden creature.

While you're adjacent to an undetected creature of your level or lower, it is instead only hidden from you.

shortdesc: Your battle instincts make you more aware of concealed and invisible opponents.

name: Delay Trap
desc: You can jam the workings of a trap to delay its effects.
shortdesc: You can jam the workings of a trap to delay its effects.

name: Improved Poison Weapon
desc: You deliver poisons in ways that maximize their harmful effects. When you apply a simple poison with Poison Weapon, the poison deals 2d4 poison damage instead of 1d4 poison damage. You don't waste a poison you apply with Poison Weapon on a critically failed attack roll.

hints.desc: When you apply a simple poison with Poison Weapon, the poison deals |dice=2d4 Poison| 2d4 poison damage instead of 1d4 poison damage. You don't waste a poison you apply with Poison Weapon on a critically failed attack roll.

shortdesc: You deliver poisons in ways that maximize their harmful effects.

name: Nimble Roll
desc:
You throw yourself into a roll to escape imminent danger. You can use Nimble Dodge before attempting a Reflex save in addition to its original trigger. If you do, the circumstance bonus applies to your Reflex save against the triggering effect.

When you use Nimble Dodge and the triggering attack fails or critically fails, or when you succeed or critically succeed at the saving throw, you can also Stride up to 10 feet as part of the reaction. If you do, the reaction gains the move trait. You can use Nimble Roll while Flying or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

hints.desc:
You can use Nimble Dodge before attempting a Reflex save in addition to its original trigger. If you do, the circumstance bonus applies to your Reflex save against the triggering effect.

When you use Nimble Dodge and the triggering attack fails or critically fails, or when you succeed or critically succeed at the saving throw, you can also Stride up to 10 feet as part of the reaction. If you do, the reaction gains the move trait. You can use Nimble Roll while Flying or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

shortdesc: You throw yourself into a roll to escape imminent danger.

name: Opportune Backstab
desc: When your enemy is hit by your ally, you capitalize upon the distraction.
shortdesc: When your enemy is hit by your ally, you capitalize upon the distraction.

name: Sidestep
desc: You deftly step out of the way of an attack, letting the blow continue to the creature next to you.
shortdesc: You deftly step out of the way of an attack, letting the blow continue to the creature next to you.

name: Sly Striker
desc: Your attacks deal more damage, even against creatures that aren't flat-footed. When you succeed or critically succeed at a Strike against a creature that isn't flat-footed, you also deal 1d6 precision damage. This applies only if you're using a weapon or unarmed attack you could deal sneak attack damage with. At 14th level, if you would normally deal 3d6 or more sneak attack damage to flat-footed creatures, you deal 2d6 precision damage to creatures that aren't flat-footed.

hints.desc: When you succeed or critically succeed at a Strike against a creature that isn't flat-footed, you also deal |dice=1d6 Precision| 1d6 precision damage. This applies only if you're using a weapon or unarmed attack you could deal sneak attack damage with. At 14th level, if you would normally deal 3d6 or more sneak attack damage to flat-footed creatures, you deal |dice=2d6 Precision| 2d6 precision damage to creatures that aren't flat-footed.

shortdesc: Your attacks deal more damage, even against creatures that aren't flat-footed.

name: Precise Debilitation
desc: You carefully aim and gracefully deliver your debilitations. Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use Debilitating Strike. Debilitation The target takes an additional 2d6 precision damage from your attacks. Debilitation The target becomes flat-footed.

hints.desc:
Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use Debilitating Strike.

Debilitation: The target takes an additional |dice=2d6 Precision| 2d6 precision damage from your attacks.
Debilitation: The target becomes flat-footed.

shortdesc: You carefully aim and gracefully deliver your debilitations.

name: Sneak Savant
desc: It is almost impossible to spot you without taking effort to look. When you roll a failure on a Sneak action, you get a success instead. You can still critically fail.

hints.desc: When you roll a failure on a Sneak action, you get a success instead. You can still critically fail.

shortdesc: It is almost impossible to spot you without taking effort to look.

name: Tactical Debilitations
desc: You learn new debilitations that grant you tactical advantages against your foes. Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use Debilitating Strike. Debilitation The target can't use reactions. Debilitation The target can't flank or contribute to allies' flanking.

hints.desc:
Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use Debilitating Strike.

Debilitation: The target can't use reactions.
Debilitation: The target can't flank or contribute to allies' flanking.

shortdesc: You learn new debilitations that grant you tactical advantages against your foes.

name: Vicious Debilitations
desc: The debilitations you dish out seriously impair your foes. Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use Debilitating Strike. Debilitation The target gains weakness 5 to your choice of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. Debilitation The target becomes clumsy 1.

hints.desc:
Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use Debilitating Strike.

Debilitation: The target gains weakness 5 to your choice of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage.
Debilitation: The target becomes clumsy 1.

shortdesc: The debilitations you dish out seriously impair your foes.

name: Critical Debilitations
desc: Your debilitations are especially effective on your most powerful attacks. Whenever you critically succeed at an attack roll against an enemy and use Debilitating Strike, add the following debilitation to the list you can choose from. Debilitation The target attempts a Fortitude save against your class DC with the following effects. Critical Success The target is unaffected. Success The target is slowed 1 until the end of your next turn. Failure The target is slowed 2 until the end of your next turn. Critical Failure The target is paralyzed until the end of your next turn.

hints.desc:
Whenever you critically succeed at an attack roll against an enemy and use Debilitating Strike, add the following debilitation to the list you can choose from.

Debilitation: The target attempts a Fortitude save against your class DC with the following effects.
Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The target is slowed 1 until the end of your next turn.
Failure The target is slowed 2 until the end of your next turn.
Critical Failure The target is paralyzed until the end of your next turn.

shortdesc: Your debilitations are especially effective on your most powerful attacks.

name: Deadly Poison Weapon
desc: Your poisons are devastatingly potent. When you apply a simple poison with Poison Weapon, the poison deals 4d4 poison damage instead of 1d4 poison damage. When you apply an injury poison to your weapon, the DC to resist that poison increases by 2, to a maximum of your class DC.

hints.desc: When you apply a simple poison with Poison Weapon, the poison deals |dice=4d4 Poison| 4d4 poison damage instead of 1d4 poison damage. When you apply an injury poison to your weapon, the DC to resist that poison increases by 2, to a maximum of your class DC.

shortdesc: Your poisons are devastatingly potent.

name: Fantastic Leap
desc: You launch yourself through the air at a foe.
shortdesc: You launch yourself through the air at a foe.

name: Felling Shot
desc: Your ranged attacks can shoot an unprepared foe right out of the air.
shortdesc: Your ranged attacks can shoot an unprepared foe right out of the air.

name: Reactive Interference
desc: You reflexively foil an enemy's response.
shortdesc: You reflexively foil an enemy's response.

name: Spring from the Shadows
desc: Leaping out from hiding, you assail your target when they least expect it.
shortdesc: Leaping out from hiding, you assail your target when they least expect it.

name: Defensive Roll
desc: Dropping into a roll to disperse the force of the blow, you can partially evade a lethal attack and stay conscious.
shortdesc: Dropping into a roll to disperse the force of the blow, you can partially evade a lethal attack and stay conscious.

name: Instant Opening
desc: You distract your opponent with a few choice words or a rude gesture.
shortdesc: You distract your opponent with a few choice words or a rude gesture.

name: Leave an Opening
desc: When you hit hard enough, you leave an opening so your ally can jump in on the action. Whenever you critically hit a flat-footed opponent with a melee attack and deal damage, the target triggers an Attack of Opportunity reaction from one ally of your choice who has that reaction, as if the enemy had used a manipulate action.

hints.desc: Whenever you critically hit a flat-footed opponent with a melee attack and deal damage, the target triggers an Attack of Opportunity reaction from one ally of your choice who has that reaction, as if the enemy had used a manipulate action.

shortdesc: When you hit hard enough, you leave an opening so your ally can jump in on the action.

name: Sense the Unseen
desc: When you look for foes, you can catch even the slightest cues.
shortdesc: When you look for foes, you can catch even the slightest cues.

name: Blank Slate
desc: Your deceptions confound even the most powerful mortal divinations. Detection, revelation, and scrying effects pass right over you, your possessions, and your auras, detecting nothing unless the detecting effect has a counteract level of 10 or higher. For example, detect magic would still detect other magic in the area but not any magic on you, true seeing wouldn't reveal you, locate or scrying wouldn't find you, and so on.

hints.desc: Detection, revelation, and scrying effects pass right over you, your possessions, and your auras, detecting nothing unless the detecting effect has a counteract level of 10 or higher. For example, detect magic would still detect other magic in the area but not any magic on you, true seeing wouldn't reveal you, locate or scrying wouldn't find you, and so on.

shortdesc: Your deceptions confound even the most powerful mortal divinations.

name: Cloud Step
desc: Using fantastic acrobatic skill, you can walk for brief stretches across insubstantial surfaces. When you Stride, you can move across water, air, and solid surfaces that can hold only limited weight as if they were normal ground. If you Stride over a trap with a weight-sensitive pressure plate, you don't trigger it. At the end of your turn, you sink, fall, break fragile surfaces, or trigger traps as normal for your current location.

hints.desc: When you Stride, you can move across water, air, and solid surfaces that can hold only limited weight as if they were normal ground. If you Stride over a trap with a weight-sensitive pressure plate, you don't trigger it. At the end of your turn, you sink, fall, break fragile surfaces, or trigger traps as normal for your current location.

shortdesc: Using fantastic acrobatic skill, you can walk for brief stretches across insubstantial surfaces.

name: Cognitive Loophole
desc: You can find a loophole in a mental effect to temporarily overcome it.
shortdesc: You can find a loophole in a mental effect to temporarily overcome it.

name: Dispelling Slice
desc: Your sneak attack slices through the threads binding magic to a target.
shortdesc: Your sneak attack slices through the threads binding magic to a target.

name: Perfect Distraction
desc: You use clever tactics to mislead your foes as you sneak away. You Sneak while leaving a decoy behind.
shortdesc: You use clever tactics to mislead your foes as you sneak away. You Sneak while leaving a decoy behind.

name: Implausible Infiltration
desc: You find tiny holes or imperfections that no one else could see and try to somehow fit yourself through them.
shortdesc: You find tiny holes or imperfections that no one else could see and try to somehow fit yourself through them.

name: Powerful Sneak
desc: You have learned to exploit your enemies' lowered defenses. When you succeed or critically succeed at a Strike using your Strength modifier on the attack roll and you would deal sneak attack damage, you can change the additional damage from sneak attack into ordinary damage of the same type as your Strike, rather than precision damage.

hints.desc: When you succeed or critically succeed at a Strike using your Strength modifier on the attack roll and you would deal sneak attack damage, you can change the additional damage from sneak attack into ordinary damage of the same type as your Strike, rather than precision damage.

shortdesc: You have learned to exploit your enemies' lowered defenses.

name: Trickster's Ace
desc: You have a contingency in your back pocket for desperate situations.
shortdesc: You have a contingency in your back pocket for desperate situations.

name: Enduring Debilitation
desc: Your debilitations last for 1 minute.
specialdesc: The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion - ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor's Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise's trainers and records unlock this uncommon class feat.
shortdesc: Your debilitations last for 1 minute.

name: Hidden Paragon
desc: When you put your mind to slipping out of sight, you disappear completely.
shortdesc: When you put your mind to slipping out of sight, you disappear completely.

name: Impossible Striker
desc: Your attacks are swift and deadly beyond explanation. Nothing can prevent you from making a sneak attack, even if your opponent can see every blow coming. Instead of dealing the damage from Sly Striker, you can deal your full sneak attack damage to a target even if the target isn't flat-footed.

hints.desc: Nothing can prevent you from making a sneak attack, even if your opponent can see every blow coming. Instead of dealing the damage from Sly Striker, you can deal your full sneak attack damage to a target even if the target isn't flat-footed.

shortdesc: Your attacks are swift and deadly beyond explanation.

name: Reactive Distraction
desc: You reactively switch with your decoy to foil your foe.
shortdesc: You reactively switch with your decoy to foil your foe.

name: Rogue Dedication
desc: You gain a skill feat and the rogue's surprise attack class feature. You become trained in light armor. In addition, you become trained in Stealth or Thievery plus one skill of your choice; if you are already trained in both Stealth and Thievery, you become trained in an additional skill of your choice. You become trained in rogue class DC.
specialdesc: You cannot gain another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the rogue archetype.
shortdesc: You've learned to sneak, steal, and disable traps. With time and luck, you'll become capable of moving through the shadows, striking unseen, and escaping without notice.

name: Basic Trickery
desc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level rogue feat.
shortdesc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level rogue feat.

name: Sneak Attacker
desc: You gain the sneak attack class feature, except it deals 1d4 damage, increasing to 1d6 at 6th level. You don't increase the number of dice as you gain levels.

hints.desc: If you Strike a creature that has the flat-footed condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, you deal an extra |dice=1d4 Precision| 1d4 precision damage. Increase the damage to |dice=1d6 Precision| 1d6 at 6th level. For a ranged attack with a thrown melee weapon, that weapon must also be agile or finesse.

shortdesc: You gain the sneak attack class feature, except it deals 1d4 damage.

name: Advanced Trickery
desc: You gain one rogue feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your rogue level is equal to half your character level.
specialdesc: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another rogue feat.
shortdesc: You gain one rogue feat.

name: Skill Mastery
desc: Increase your proficiency rank in one of your skills from expert to master and in another of your skills from trained to expert. You gain a skill feat associated with one of the skills you chose.
specialdesc: You can select this feat up to five times.
shortdesc: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each ranger archetype class feat you have.
specialreq: ((characterService.get_Skills(character, '', 'Skill').find(skill => Skill_Level('Character', skill.name) == 2) && characterService.get_Skills(character, '', 'Skill').find(skill => Skill_Level('Character', skill.name) == 4))) || (this.have(character, characterService, charLevel) && (characterService.get_Skills(character, '', 'Skill').find(skill => Skill_Level('Character', skill.name) >= 2) && characterService.get_Skills(character, '', 'Skill').find(skill => Skill_Level('Character', skill.name) >= 4)))
specialreqdesc: trained in at least one skill and expert in at least one skill

name: Uncanny Dodge
desc: You gain the deny advantage class feature.
shortdesc: You gain the deny advantage class feature.

name: Evasiveness
desc: Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to master.
shortdesc: Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to master.

name: Enigma Muse
desc: Your muse is a mystery, driving you to uncover the hidden secrets of the multiverse. If your muse is a creature, it might be a dragon or otherworldly being; if a deity, it might be Irori or Nethys. You gain the Bardic Lore feat and add true strike to your spell repertoire.
shortdesc: Your muse is a mystery, driving you to uncover the hidden secrets of the multiverse.

name: Maestro Muse
desc: Your muse is a virtuoso, inspiring you to greater heights. If it's a creature, it might be a performance-loving creature such as a choral angel or lillend azata; if a deity, it might be Shelyn. As a bard with a Maestro Muse, you are an inspiration to your allies and confident of your musical and oratorical abilities. You gain the Lingering Composition feat and add soothe to your spell repertoire.
shortdesc: Your muse is a virtuoso, inspiring you to greater heights.

name: Polymath Muse
desc: Your muse is a jack of all trades, flitting between skills and pursuits. If it's is a creature, it might be an eclectic creature like a fey; if a deity, it might be Desna or Calistria. As a bard with a polymath muse, you are interested in a wide array of topics but rarely dedicated to any one, and you rarely make up your mind - you want to try everything. You gain the Versatile Performance feat and add unseen servant to your spell repertoire.
shortdesc: Your muse is a jack of all trades, flitting between skills and pursuits.

name: Bardic Lore
desc: Your studies make you informed on every subject. You are trained in Bardic Lore, a special Lore skill that can be used only to Recall Knowledge, but on any topic. If you have legendary proficiency in Occultism, you gain expert proficiency in Bardic Lore, but you can't increase your proficiency rank in Bardic Lore by any other means.

hints.desc: Bardic Lore can be used only to Recall Knowledge, but on any topic.

internalNote: The inability to increase the skill is hardcoded in skill choices.
shortdesc: Your studies make you informed on every subject.

name: Lingering Composition
desc: By adding a flourish, you make your compositions last longer. You learn the lingering composition focus spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: By adding a flourish, you make your compositions last longer.

name: Versatile Performance
desc: You can rely on the grandeur of your performances rather than ordinary social skills. You can use Performance instead of Diplomacy to Make an Impression and instead of Intimidation to Demoralize. You can also use an acting Performance instead of Deception to Impersonate. You can use your proficiency rank in Performance to meet the requirements of skill feats that require a particular rank in Deception, Diplomacy, or Intimidation.

hints.desc: You can use Performance instead of Diplomacy to Make an Impression and instead of Intimidation to Demoralize. You can also use an acting Performance instead of Deception to Impersonate.

internalNote: Using Performance for skill requirements is hardcoded.
shortdesc: You can rely on the grandeur of your performances rather than ordinary social skills.

name: Cantrip Expansion (Spontaneous)
desc: A greater understanding of your magic broadens your range of simple spells. Add two additional cantrips from your spell list to your repertoire.
shortdesc: Study broadens your range of simple spells.

name: Esoteric Polymath
desc:
You keep a book of occult spells, similar to a wizard's spellbook, and can use its spells to supplement your spell repertoire. Add all the spells in your repertoire to this book for free. You can use the Occultism skill to Learn Spells (page 238) and add them to your spellbook by paying the appropriate cost, similar to a wizard.

During your daily preparations, choose any one spell from your book of occult spells. If that spell is already in your spell repertoire, you can treat it as an additional signature spell that day. If it isn't in your repertoire, treat it as though it were until your next daily preparations.

hints.desc: During your daily preparations, choose any one spell from your book of occult spells. If that spell is already in your spell repertoire, you can treat it as an additional signature spell that day. If it isn't in your repertoire, treat it as though it were until your next daily preparations.

internalNote: The mechanism is hardcoded to decide whether the spell is a signature spell.
shortdesc: You keep a book of occult spells, similar to a wizard's spellbook.

name: Inspire Competence
desc: You learn the inspire competence composition cantrip, which aids your allies' skills.
shortdesc: You learn the inspire competence composition cantrip, which aids your allies' skills.

name: Loremaster's Etude
desc: You magically unlock memories, making them easier to recall. You learn the loremaster's etude composition spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You magically unlock memories, making them easier to recall.

name: Multifarious Muse
desc: Your muse doesn't fall into a single label. Choose a type of muse other than that of your own. You gain a 1st-level feat that requires that muse, and your muse is now also a muse of that type, allowing you to take feats with the other muse as a prerequisite. You don't gain any of the other effects of the muse you chose.
specialdesc: You can take this feat multiple times. Each time you do, you must choose a different type of muse other than that of your own.
shortdesc: Your muse doesn't fall into a single label.

name: Multifarious Muse: Enigma Muse
desc: Your muse doesn't fall into a single label. You gain a 1st-level feat that requires the enigma muse, and your muse is now also an enigma muse, allowing you to take feats with it as a prerequisite. You don't gain any of the other effects of the enigma muse.
shortdesc: Your muse doesn't fall into a single label.
specialreqdesc: no enigma muse

name: Multifarious Muse: Maestro Muse
desc: Your muse doesn't fall into a single label. You gain a 1st-level feat that requires the maestro muse, and your muse is now also a maestro muse, allowing you to take feats with it as a prerequisite. You don't gain any of the other effects of the maestro muse.
shortdesc: Your muse doesn't fall into a single label.
specialreqdesc: no maestro muse

name: Multifarious Muse: Polymath Muse
desc: Your muse doesn't fall into a single label. You gain a 1st-level feat that requires the polymath muse, and your muse is now also a polymath muse, allowing you to take feats with it as a prerequisite. You don't gain any of the other effects of the polymath muse.
shortdesc: Your muse doesn't fall into a single label.
specialreqdesc: no polymath muse

name: Inspire Defense
desc: You learn the inspire defense composition cantrip, which protects you and allies.
shortdesc: You learn the inspire defense composition cantrip, which protects you and allies.

name: Melodious Spell
desc: You subtly weave your spellcasting into your performance.
shortdesc: You subtly weave your spellcasting into your performance.

name: Triple Time
desc: You learn the triple time composition cantrip, which speeds up you and your allies for a round.
shortdesc: You learn to speed up yourself and your allies with your performance.

name: Versatile Signature
desc: While most bards are known for certain signature performances and spells, you're always tweaking your available repertoire. When you make your daily preparations, you can change one of your signature spells to a different spell of that level from your repertoire.

hints.desc: When you make your daily preparations, you can change one of your signature spells to a different spell of that level from your repertoire.

usageNote: To perform this change, you can exchange spells between your signature spell slot and another spell slot of the same level.
internalNote: There is no mechanical difference. This feat gives you official permission to change your spells every day.
shortdesc: You're always tweaking your available repertoire.

name: Dirge of Doom
desc: You learn the dirge of doom composition cantrip, which frightens your enemies.
shortdesc: You learn to frighten your enemies with your performance.

name: Harmonize
desc: You can perform multiple compositions simultaneously.
shortdesc: You can perform multiple compositions simultaneously.

name: Eclectic Skill
desc: Your broad experiences translate to a range of skills. Your proficiency bonus to untrained skill checks is equal to your level. You can attempt any skill check that normally requires you to be trained, even if you are untrained. If you have legendary proficiency in Occultism, you can attempt any skill check that normally requires you to have expert proficiency, even if untrained or trained.

hints.desc: You can attempt any skill check that normally requires you to be trained, even if you are untrained. If you have legendary proficiency in Occultism, you can attempt any skill check that normally requires you to have expert proficiency, even if untrained or trained.

shortdesc: Your broad experiences translate to a range of skills.

name: Inspire Heroics
desc: Your performances inspire even greater deeds in your allies. You learn the inspire heroics metamagic focus spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: Your performances inspire even greater deeds in your allies.

name: Know-It-All
desc: When you succeed at a Knowledge check, you gain additional information or context. When you critically succeed at a Knowledge check, at the GM's discretion you might gain even more additional information or context than normal.

hints.desc: When you critically succeed at a Knowledge check, at the GM's discretion you might gain even more additional information or context than normal.
hints.showon: Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Medicine, Nature, Occultism, Religion, Society

shortdesc: Your knowledge of the world expands beyond what you have read.

name: House of Imaginary Walls
desc: You erect an imaginary barrier others believe to be real. You learn the house of imaginary walls composition cantrip.
shortdesc: You erect an imaginary barrier others believe to be real.

name: Unusual Composition
desc: You can translate the emotion and power of a composition to other mediums.
shortdesc: You can translate the emotion and power of a composition to other mediums.

name: Eclectic Polymath
desc: Your flexible mind can quickly shift spells. If you add a spell to your repertoire during your daily preparations using Esoteric Polymath, when you prepare again, you can choose to keep the new spell from Esoteric Polymath in your repertoire and instead lose access to another spell of the same level in your repertoire.

hints.desc: If you add a spell to your repertoire during your daily preparations using Esoteric Polymath, when you prepare again, you can choose to keep the new spell from Esoteric Polymath in your repertoire and instead lose access to another spell of the same level in your repertoire.

usageNote: To perform this change, you can change a spell slot in your repertoire to the spell you chose with Esoteric Polymath.
internalNote: There is no mechanical difference. This feat gives you official permission to change your spells every day.
shortdesc: Your flexible mind can quickly shift spells.

name: Inspirational Focus
desc: Your connection to your muse has granted you unusual focus. If you have spent at least 2 Focus Points since the last time you Refocused, you recover 2 Focus Points when you Refocus instead of 1.

hints.desc: If you have spent at least 2 Focus Points since the last time you Refocused, you recover 2 Focus Points when you Refocus instead of 1.

shortdesc: Your connection to your muse has granted you unusual focus.

name: Silver's Refrain
desc: You learn the silver's refrain composition cantrip, which aids you when fighting devils.
shortdesc: Learn the silver's refrain composition cantrip.

name: Allegro
desc: You can quicken your allies with a fast-paced performance. You learn the allegro composition cantrip.
shortdesc: You can quicken your allies with a fast-paced performance.

name: Soothing Ballad
desc: You soothe your allies' wounds with the power of your performance. You learn the soothing ballad composition spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You soothe your allies' wounds with the power of your performance.

name: True Hypercognition
