desc: Your mind works at an incredible pace.
shortdesc: Your mind works at an incredible pace.

name: Studious Capacity
desc: Your continued study of occult magic has increased your magical capacity, allowing you to cast spells even when it seems impossible. You can cast one spell each day even after you've run out of spell slots of the appropriate spell level, but you can't use this ability to cast a spell of your highest spell level.
internalNote: The effect is hardcoded.
shortdesc: Your continued study of occult magic has increased your magical capacity.

name: Deep Lore
desc: Your repertoire is vast, containing far more spells than usual. Add one spell to your repertoire of each level you can cast.
shortdesc: Your repertoire is vast, containing far more spells than usual.

name: Eternal Composition
desc: The world is a stage upon which you are always playing. You are permanently quickened; you can use your extra action only to cast a composition cantrip that requires 1 action to cast. While in exploration mode, you can declare that you are performing an eligible composition cantrip while using any exploration tactic. Even before your first turn in a combat encounter, that cantrip is active as if you had cast it on your previous turn.

hints.desc: You are permanently quickened; you can use your extra action only to cast a composition cantrip that requires 1 action to cast. While in exploration mode, you can declare that you are performing an eligible composition cantrip while using any exploration tactic. Even before your first turn in a combat encounter, that cantrip is active as if you had cast it on your previous turn.

shortdesc: The world is a stage upon which you are always playing.

name: Impossible Polymath
desc:
Your esoteric formulas are so unusual that they allow you to dabble in magic from diverse traditions that other bards don't understand. As long as you're trained in Arcana, you can add arcane spells to your book from Esoteric Polymath; as long as you're trained in Nature, you can add primal spells to your book; and as long as you are trained in Religion, you can add divine spells to your book.

Like your other spells in your book, you can add one of these spells from another tradition to your repertoire as an occult spell each day using Esoteric Polymath, but you can't retain any spells from another tradition when you prepare again, even if you have Eclectic Polymath.

hints.desc:
As long as you're trained in Arcana, you can add arcane spells to your book from Esoteric Polymath; as long as you're trained in Nature, you can add primal spells to your book; and as long as you are trained in Religion, you can add divine spells to your book.

Like your other spells in your book, you can add one of these spells from another tradition to your repertoire as an occult spell each day using Esoteric Polymath, but you can't retain any spells from another tradition when you prepare again, even if you have Eclectic Polymath.

internalNote: The effect is hardcoded.
shortdesc: Your esoteric formulas are so unusual that they allow you to dabble in magic from diverse traditions.

name: Fatal Aria
desc: Your songs overwhelm the target with unbearable emotion, potentially striking them dead on the spot. You learn the fatal aria composition spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: Your songs overwhelm the target with unbearable emotion.

name: Perfect Encore
desc: You develop another incredible creation. You gain an additional 10th-level spell slot.
shortdesc: You develop another incredible creation.

name: Ringmaster's Introduction
desc: You announce the triggering ally with a litany of their legendary achievements, spurring them to action.
shortdesc: You announce the triggering ally with a litany of their legendary achievements, spurring them to action.

name: Song of the Fallen
desc: The moving power of your songs can stir the spirits of the dead to rise once more and fight alongside you. You learn the song of the fallen composition spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
specialdesc: The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion - ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor's Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise's trainers and records unlock this uncommon class feat.
shortdesc: Gain the song of the fallen focus spell.

name: Symphony of the Muses
desc: You are able to weave countless performances together into a solo symphony. You are no longer limited to a single composition each turn or a single composition at a time; when you use a new composition, all previous compositions' effects continue for their remaining duration.

hints.desc: You are no longer limited to a single composition each turn or a single composition at a time; when you use a new composition, all previous compositions' effects continue for their remaining duration.

shortdesc: You are able to weave countless performances together into a solo symphony.

name: Bard Dedication
desc:
You cast spells like a bard and gain the Cast a Spell activity. You gain a spell repertoire with two common cantrips from the occult spell list, or any other cantrips you learn or discover. You can add to your repertoire common cantrips of your spellcasting tradition, whether from this book or other cantrips of that tradition you learn or discover. You're trained in spell attack rolls and spell DCs for occult spells. Your key spellcasting ability for bard archetype spells is Charisma, and they are occult bard spells. You become trained in Occultism and Performance; for each of these skills in which you were already trained, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

Choose a muse as you would if you were a bard. You have that muse for all purposes, allowing you to take that muse's feats, but you don't gain any of the other abilities it grants.
specialdesc: You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the bard archetype.
shortdesc: A muse has called you to dabble in occult lore, allowing you to cast a few spells. The deeper you delve, the more powerful your performances become.

name: Basic Bard Spellcasting
desc:
You gain the basic spellcasting benefits:

At 4th level, you gain a 1st-level spell slot. At 6th level, you gain a 2nd-level spell slot and can select one spell from your repertoire as a signature spell. At 8th level, you gain a 3rd-level spell slot.

Each time you gain a spell slot of a new level from the bard archetype, add a common occult spell or another spell you learned or discovered to your repertoire, of the appropriate spell level.

hints.desc: You can select one spell from your repertoire as a signature spell. You don't need to learn heightened versions of signature spells separately; instead, you can heighten these spells freely. If you've learned a signature spell at a higher level than its minimum, you can also cast all its lower-level versions without learning those separately. If you swap out a signature spell, you can choose a replacement signature spell of the same spell level at which you learned the previous spell. You can also retrain specifically to change a signature spell to a different spell of that level without swapping any spells; this takes as much time as retraining a spell normally does.

shortdesc: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.

name: Basic Muse's Whispers
desc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level bard feat.
shortdesc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level bard feat.

name: Advanced Muse's Whispers
desc: You gain one bard feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your bard level is equal to half your character level.
specialdesc: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another bard feat.
shortdesc: You gain one wizard feat.

name: Counter Perform
desc: You gain the counter performance composition spell. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by engaging your muse.
shortdesc: You gain the counter performance composition spell.

name: Inspirational Performance
desc: You gain the inspire courage composition cantrip.
shortdesc: You gain the inspire courage composition cantrip.

name: Occult Breadth
desc: Your repertoire expands, and you can cast more occult spells each day. Increase the number of spells in your repertoire and the number of spell slots you gain from bard archetype feats by 1 for each spell level other than your two highest bard spell slots.
internalNote: The effect is hardcoded in the spellbook component.
shortdesc: Your repertoire expands, and you can cast more occult spells each day.

name: Expert Bard Spellcasting
desc:
You gain the expert spellcasting benefits:

You become an expert in spell attack rolls and spell DCs for occult spells, and you can select a second spell from your repertoire as a signature spell. At 12th level, you gain a 4th-level spell slot. At 14th level, you gain a 5th-level spell slot. At 16th level, you gain a 6th-level spell slot.

hints.desc: You can select a second spell from your repertoire as a signature spell.

shortdesc: You gain the expert spellcasting benefits.

name: Master Bard Spellcasting
desc:
You gain the master spellcasting benefits:

You become a master in spell attack rolls and spell DCs for occult spells, and you can select a third spell from your repertoire as a signature spell. At 18th level, you gain a 7th-level spell slot. At 20th level, you gain a 8th-level spell slot.

hints.desc: You can select a third spell from your repertoire as a signature spell.

shortdesc: You gain the master spellcasting benefits.

name: Bouncy Goblin
desc: You have a particular elasticity that makes it easy for you to bounce and squish. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Acrobatics (or another skill of your choice, if you were already trained in Acrobatics). You also gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Acrobatics checks to Tumble Through a foe's space.

hints.desc: You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Acrobatics checks to Tumble Through a foe's space.

shortdesc: You have a particular elasticity that makes it easy for you to bounce and squish.

name: Burn It!
desc: Fire fascinates you. Your spells and alchemical items that deal fire damage gain a status bonus to damage equal to half the spell's level or one-quarter the item's level (minimum 1). You also gain a +1 status bonus to any persistent fire damage you deal.

hints.desc: Your spells and alchemical items that deal fire damage gain a status bonus to damage equal to half the spell's level or one-quarter the item's level (minimum 1). You also gain a +1 status bonus to any persistent fire damage you deal.

shortdesc: Fire fascinates you.

name: City Scavenger
desc:
You know that the greatest treasures often look like refuse, and you scoff at those who throw away perfectly good scraps. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to checks to Subsist, and you can use Society or Survival when you Subsist in a settlement.

When you Subsist in a city, you also gather valuable junk that silly longshanks threw away. You can Earn Income using Society or Survival in the same time as you Subsist, without spending any additional days of downtime. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus to this check.

hints.desc:
You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to checks to Subsist, and you can use Society or Survival when you Subsist in a settlement.

You can Earn Income using Society or Survival in the same time as you Subsist, without spending any additional days of downtime. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus to this check.

If you have the irongut goblin heritage, increase both bonuses to +2.

shortdesc: You know that the greatest treasures often look like refuse, and you scoff at those who throw away perfectly good scraps.

name: Fang Sharpener
desc: You have filed your teeth into jagged points and have an unusually powerful jaw, making your mouth a dangerous weapon. If you're an irongut goblin, you gain a jaws unarmed attack that deals 1d4 piercing damage, and if you're a razortooth goblin, your jaws unarmed attack deals 1d8 piercing damage and loses the finesse trait. Whenever you score a critical hit with your jaws unarmed attack, your target takes 1 persistent bleed damage per weapon damage die.
shortdesc: You have filed your teeth into jagged points and have an unusually powerful jaw, making your mouth a dangerous weapon.

name: Fang Sharpener: Irongut Goblin
desc: You have filed your teeth into jagged points and have an unusually powerful jaw, making your mouth a dangerous weapon. You gain a jaws unarmed attack that deals 1d4 piercing damage. Whenever you score a critical hit with your jaws unarmed attack, your target takes 1 persistent bleed damage per weapon damage die.
shortdesc: You have filed your teeth into jagged points and have an unusually powerful jaw, making your mouth a dangerous weapon.

name: Fang Sharpener: Razortooth Goblin
desc: You have filed your teeth into jagged points and have an unusually powerful jaw, making your mouth a dangerous weapon. Your jaws unarmed attack deals 1d8 piercing damage and loses the finesse trait. Whenever you score a critical hit with your jaws unarmed attack, your target takes 1 persistent bleed damage per weapon damage die.

hints.desc: Your jaws unarmed attack deals 1d8 piercing damage and loses the finesse trait. Whenever you score a critical hit with your jaws unarmed attack, your target takes 1 persistent bleed damage per weapon damage die.

internalNote: Losing the finesse trait is hardcoded in the Weapon class.
shortdesc: You have filed your teeth into jagged points and have an unusually powerful jaw, making your mouth a dangerous weapon.

name: Goblin Lore
desc: You've picked up skills and tales from your goblin community. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Nature and Stealth. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in Goblin Lore.
shortdesc: You've picked up skills and tales from your goblin community.

name: Goblin Scuttle
desc: You take advantage of your ally's movement to adjust your position.
shortdesc: You take advantage of your ally's movement to adjust your position.

name: Goblin Song
desc: You sing annoying goblin songs, distracting your foes with silly and repetitive lyrics.
shortdesc: You sing annoying goblin songs, distracting your foes with silly and repetitive lyrics.

name: Goblin Weapon Familiarity
desc:
Others might look upon them with disdain, but you know that the weapons of your people are as effective as they are sharp. You are trained with the dogslicer and horsechopper.

In addition, you gain access to all uncommon goblin weapons. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial goblin weapons are simple weapons and advanced goblin weapons are martial weapons.

hints.desc: You gain access to all uncommon goblin weapons. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial goblin weapons are simple weapons and advanced goblin weapons are martial weapons.

shortdesc: Others might look upon them with disdain, but you know that the weapons of your people are as effective as they are sharp.

name: Hard Tail
desc: Your tail is much stronger than most, and you can lash out with it with the strength of a whip. You gain a tail unarmed attack that deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage.
shortdesc: Your tail is much stronger than most, and you can lash out with it with the strength of a whip.

name: Junk Tinker
desc:
You can make useful tools out of even twisted or rusted scraps. When using the Crafting skill to Craft, you can make level 0 items, including weapons but not armor, out of junk. This reduces the Price to one-quarter the usual amount but always results in a shoddy item. Shoddy items normally give a penalty, but you don't take this penalty when using shoddy items you made.

You can also incorporate junk to save money while you Craft any item. This grants you a discount on the item as if you had spent 1 additional day working to reduce the cost, but the item is obviously made of junk. At the GM's discretion, this might affect the item's resale value depending on the buyer's tastes.

hints.desc:
When using the Crafting skill to Craft, you can make level 0 items, including weapons but not armor, out of junk. This reduces the Price to one-quarter the usual amount but always results in a shoddy item. Shoddy items normally give a penalty, but you don't take this penalty when using shoddy items you made.

You can also incorporate junk to save money while you Craft any item. This grants you a discount on the item as if you had spent 1 additional day working to reduce the cost, but the item is obviously made of junk. At the GM's discretion, this might affect the item's resale value depending on the buyer's tastes.

internalNote: Ignoring the shoddy status is hardcoded in the Weapon, Armor and Shield classes.
shortdesc: You can make useful tools out of even twisted or rusted scraps.

name: Rough Rider
desc: You are especially good at riding traditional goblin mounts. You gain the Ride feat, even if you don't meet the prerequisites. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Nature checks to use Command an Animal on a goblin dog or wolf mount. You can always select a wolf as your animal companion, even if you would usually select an animal companion with the mount special ability, such as for a champion's steed ally.

hints.desc: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Nature checks to use Command an Animal on a goblin dog or wolf mount.

shortdesc: You are especially good at riding traditional goblin mounts.

name: Very Sneaky
desc: Taller folk rarely pay attention to the shadows at their feet, and you take full advantage of this. You can move 5 feet farther when you take the Sneak action, up to your Speed. In addition, as long as you continue to use Sneak actions and succeed at your Stealth check, you don't become observed if you don't have cover or greater cover and aren't concealed at the end of the Sneak action, as long as you have cover or greater cover or are concealed at the end of your turn.

hints.desc: You can move 5 feet farther when you take the Sneak action, up to your Speed. In addition, as long as you continue to use Sneak actions and succeed at your Stealth check, you don't become observed if you don't have cover or greater cover and aren't concealed at the end of the Sneak action, as long as you have cover or greater cover or are concealed at the end of your turn.

shortdesc: Taller folk rarely pay attention to the shadows at their feet, and you take full advantage of this.

name: Ankle Bite
desc: Whenever someone grabs onto you, you instinctively bite down hard.
shortdesc: Whenever someone grabs onto you, you instinctively bite down hard.
specialreq: character.class.heritage.name == 'Razortooth Goblin' || Has_Feat('Character', 'Fang Sharpener: Irongut Goblin')
specialreqdesc: Fang Sharpener or razortooth goblin heritage

name: Chosen of Lamashtu
desc: You bear the favor and blessings of Lamashtu, the Mother of Monsters. She has bestowed a mutation upon you, granting you the benefits of another heritage. Choose one goblin heritage that you do not already have; you gain that heritage and its benefits.
shortdesc: You bear the favor and blessings of Lamashtu, the Mother of Monsters.
specialreqdesc: worshipper of Lamashtu, a heritage

name: Fey Influence
desc: You have been exposed to powerful fey magic. You become trained in primal DCs and spell attack rolls. You gain the fey trait and one of the following features which grant an innate primal spell that can be used once per day. Anteater You can launch your tongue forward as a deadly attack, gaining grim tendrils. Dryad Your body is covered in elegant vines, granting you summon plants and fungi. Gremlin You have long, bat-like ears and gain bane. Monarch You have vestigial, insectile features and gain spider sting. This feat gains the trait appropriate for your ancestry (human for human, goblin for goblin, etc.)
shortdesc: Your exposure to fey influence has given you some primal magic
sourceBook: Pathfinder Society Scenario #1-17: The Perennial Crown Part 2, The Thorned Monarch

name: Fey Influence: Anteater
desc:
You have been exposed to powerful fey magic. You become trained in primal DCs and spell attack rolls. You gain the fey trait and gain grim tendrils as an innate primal spell that can be used once per day by launching your tongue forward as a deadly attack.

This feat gains the trait appropriate for your ancestry (human for human, goblin for goblin, etc.)
shortdesc: Your exposure to fey influence has given you some primal magic
sourceBook: Pathfinder Society Scenario #1-17: The Perennial Crown Part 2, The Thorned Monarch

name: Fey Influence: Dryad
desc:
You have been exposed to powerful fey magic. You become trained in primal DCs and spell attack rolls. You gain the fey trait, and your body is covered in elegant vines, granting you summon plants and fungi as an innate primal spell that can be used once per day.

This feat gains the trait appropriate for your ancestry (human for human, goblin for goblin, etc.)
shortdesc: Your exposure to fey influence has given you some primal magic
sourceBook: Pathfinder Society Scenario #1-17: The Perennial Crown Part 2, The Thorned Monarch

name: Fey Influence: Gremlin
desc:
You have been exposed to powerful fey magic. You become trained in primal DCs and spell attack rolls. You gain the fey trait, and you have long, bat-like ears, granting you bane as an innate primal spell that can be used once per day.

This feat gains the trait appropriate for your ancestry (human for human, goblin for goblin, etc.)
shortdesc: Your exposure to fey influence has given you some primal magic
sourceBook: Pathfinder Society Scenario #1-17: The Perennial Crown Part 2, The Thorned Monarch

name: Fey Influence: Monarch
desc:
You have been exposed to powerful fey magic. You become trained in primal DCs and spell attack rolls. You gain the fey trait, and you have vestigial, insectile features, granting you spider sting as an innate primal spell that can be used once per day.

This feat gains the trait appropriate for your ancestry (human for human, goblin for goblin, etc.)
shortdesc: Your exposure to fey influence has given you some primal magic
sourceBook: Pathfinder Society Scenario #1-17: The Perennial Crown Part 2, The Thorned Monarch

name: Goblin Weapon Frenzy
desc: You know how to wield your people's vicious weapons. Whenever you score a critical hit using a goblin weapon, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect.
shortdesc: You know how to wield your people's vicious weapons.

name: Tail Spin
desc: You excel at using your tail as a weapon to upend your foes.
shortdesc: You excel at using your tail as a weapon to upend your foes.

name: Torch Goblin
desc: You've spent enough time on fire that you know how to use it to your advantage.
shortdesc: You've spent enough time on fire that you know how to use it to your advantage.

name: Tree Climber (Goblin)
desc: Your time in forest or jungle canopies has taught you how to scramble across branches with sure feet. You gain a climb Speed of 10 feet. If you also have the Cave Climber ancestry feat, your total climb Speed increases to your land Speed when climbing trees.

hints.desc: If you have the Cave Climber ancestry feat, your total climb Speed increases to your land Speed when climbing trees.

shortdesc: Your time in forest or jungle canopies has taught you how to scramble across branches with sure feet.

name: Cave Climber
desc: After years of crawling and climbing through caverns, you can climb easily anywhere you go. You gain a climb Speed of 10 feet.
shortdesc: After years of crawling and climbing through caverns, you can climb easily anywhere you go.

name: Freeze It!
desc: You are no rime hag or Jadwiga, but the magic of the north has still left a mark on you.
shortdesc: You are no rime hag or Jadwiga, but the magic of the north has still left a mark on you.

name: Hungry Goblin
desc: You'll eat anything and anyone. Whenever you inflict persistent bleed damage with your jaws unarmed attack, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to half your level for 1 minute.

hints.desc: Whenever you inflict persistent bleed damage with your jaws unarmed attack, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to half your level for 1 minute. You can activate this effect in your activities.

shortdesc: You'll eat anything and anyone.

name: Roll with It
desc: When you take a big hit, your foe bounces you around like a rubber ball, but you escape the worst of the blow.
shortdesc: When you take a big hit, your foe bounces you around like a rubber ball, but you escape the worst of the blow.

name: Scalding Spit
desc: Your bodily fluids burn with surprising volatility, as if you ran on oil instead of blood. As long as you are taking persistent fire damage, you gain a boiling spit ranged unarmed attack with a range of 30 feet that deals 1d6 fire damage.

hints.desc: As long as you are taking persistent fire damage, you gain a boiling spit ranged unarmed attack with a range of 30 feet that deals 1d6 fire damage.

shortdesc: Your bodily fluids burn with surprising volatility, as if you ran on oil instead of blood.

name: Skittering Scuttle
desc: You can scuttle farther and faster when maneuvering alongside allies. When you use Goblin Scuttle, you can Stride up to half your Speed instead of Stepping.

hints.desc: When you use Goblin Scuttle, you can Stride up to half your Speed instead of Stepping.

shortdesc: You can scuttle farther and faster when maneuvering alongside allies.

name: Goblin Weapon Expertise
desc: Your goblin affinity blends with your class training, granting you great skill with goblin weapons. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in a given weapon or weapons, you also gain that proficiency in the dogslicer, horsechopper, and all goblin weapons in which you are trained.
shortdesc: Your goblin affinity blends with your class training, granting you great skill with goblin weapons.

name: Unbreakable-er Goblin
desc: As hard as most unbreakable goblins are to break, you are that much harder to break. You gain 20 Hit Points from your ancestry instead of 10. When you fall, you take no falling damage. If you have the Bouncy Goblin feat, after falling or jumping from a height of at least 20 feet, you can bounce back into the air, up to half the distance you fell (and half as far forward if you jumped). These bounces continue until you bounce less than 20 feet.

hints.desc: When you fall, you take no falling damage. If you have the Bouncy Goblin feat, after falling or jumping from a height of at least 20 feet, you can bounce back into the air, up to half the distance you fell (and half as far forward if you jumped). These bounces continue until you bounce less than 20 feet.

shortdesc: As hard as most unbreakable goblins are to break, you are that much harder to break.

name: Very, Very Sneaky
desc: You can move up to your Speed when you use the Sneak action, and you no longer need to have cover or greater cover or be concealed to Hide or Sneak.

hints.desc: You can move up to your Speed when you use the Sneak action, and you no longer need to have cover or greater cover or be concealed to Hide or Sneak.

shortdesc: Your ability to hide is so great, you can disappear straight from vision.

name: Adroit Manipulation
desc: You've fiddled with knots, locks, and blacksmith's puzzles since you were a child to give your hands something to do. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Thievery (or another skill of your choice, if you're already trained in Thievery). If you roll a success on a Thievery check to Pick a Lock, you get a critical success instead.

hints.desc: If you roll a success on a Thievery check to Pick a Lock, you get a critical success instead.

shortdesc: You've fiddled with knots, locks, and blacksmith's puzzles since you were a child to give your hands something to do.

name: Distracting Shadows
desc: You have learned to remain hidden by using larger folk as a distraction to avoid drawing attention to yourself. You can use creatures that are at least one size larger than you (usually Medium or larger) as cover for the Hide and Sneak actions, though you still can't use such creatures as cover for other uses, such as the Take Cover action.

hints.desc: You can use creatures that are at least one size larger than you (usually Medium or larger) as cover for the Hide and Sneak actions, though you still can't use such creatures as cover for other uses, such as the Take Cover action.

shortdesc: You have learned to remain hidden by using larger folk as a distraction to avoid drawing attention to yourself.

name: Halfling Lore
desc: You've dutifully learned how to keep your balance and how to stick to the shadows where it's safe, important skills passed down through generations of halfling tradition. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Acrobatics and Stealth. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in Halfling Lore.
shortdesc: You've dutifully learned important skills passed down through generations of halfling tradition.

name: Halfling Luck
desc: Your happy-go-lucky nature makes it seem like misfortune avoids you, and to an extent, that might even be true.
shortdesc: Your happy-go-lucky nature makes it seem like misfortune avoids you, and to an extent, that might even be true.

name: Halfling Weapon Familiarity
desc: You favor traditional halfling weapons, so you've learned how to use them more effectively. You have the trained proficiency with the sling, halfling sling staff, and shortsword. You gain access to all uncommon halfling weapons. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial halfling weapons are simple weapons and advanced halfling weapons are martial weapons.

hints.desc: You gain access to all uncommon halfling weapons. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial halfling weapons are simple weapons and advanced halfling weapons are martial weapons.

shortdesc: You favor traditional halfling weapons, so you've learned how to use them more effectively.

name: Innocuous
desc: Halflings have been unobtrusive assistants of larger folk for untold ages, and your people count on this assumption of innocence. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Deception (or another skill of your choice, if you're already trained in Deception). If you fail a Deception check to Create a Diversion, humanoid creatures aren't aware that you were trying to trick them unless you get a critical failure on your roll.

hints.desc: If you fail a Deception check to Create a Diversion, humanoid creatures aren't aware that you were trying to trick them unless you get a critical failure on your roll.

shortdesc: Halflings have been unobtrusive assistants of larger folk for untold ages, and your people count on this assumption of innocence.

name: Intuitive Cooperation
desc: You are accustomed to working alongside others, relying on each other to get by. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to Aid, and your allies gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to Aid you.

hints.desc: You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to Aid, and your allies gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to Aid you.

shortdesc: You are accustomed to working alongside others, relying on each other to get by.

name: Sure Feet
desc: Whether keeping your balance or scrambling up a tricky climb, your hairy, calloused feet easily find purchase. If you roll a success on an Acrobatics check to Balance or an Athletics check to Climb, you get a critical success instead. You're not flat-footed when you attempt to Balance or Climb.

hints.desc: You're not flat-footed when you attempt to Balance or Climb. If you roll a success on an Acrobatics check to Balance or an Athletics check to Climb, you get a critical success instead.

shortdesc: Whether keeping your balance or scrambling up a tricky climb, your hairy, calloused feet easily find purchase.

name: Titan Slinger
desc: You have learned how to use your sling to fell enormous creatures. When you hit on an attack with a sling against a Large or larger creature, increase the size of the weapon damage die by one step (details on increasing weapon damage die sizes can be found here).

hints.desc: When you hit on an attack with a sling against a Large or larger creature, increase the size of the weapon damage die by one step (details on increasing weapon damage die sizes can be found on page 279 of the core rulebook).

shortdesc: You have learned how to use your sling to fell enormous creatures.

name: Unassuming Dedication
desc: Your family instilled the values of care and patience into you from a young age. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to checks to perform a downtime activity.

hints.desc: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to checks to perform a downtime activity.

shortdesc: Your family instilled the values of care and patience into you from a young age.

name: Unfettered Halfling
desc: You were forced into service as a laborer, either pressed into indentured servitude or shackled by the evils of slavery, but you've since escaped and have trained to ensure you'll never be caught again. Whenever you roll a success on a check to Escape or a saving throw against an effect that would impose the grabbed or restrained condition on you, you get a critical success instead. Whenever a creature rolls a failure on a check to Grapple you, they get a critical failure instead. If a creature uses the Grab ability on you, it must succeed at an Athletics check to grab you instead of automatically grabbing you.

hints.desc: Whenever you roll a success on a check to Escape, you get a critical success instead.
Whenever you roll a success on a saving throw against an effect that would impose the grabbed or restrained condition on you, you get a critical success instead.

Whenever a creature rolls a failure on a check to Grapple you, they get a critical failure instead. If a creature uses the Grab ability on you, it must succeed at an Athletics check to grab you instead of automatically grabbing you.

shortdesc: You were forced into service as a laborer, but you've since escaped and have trained to ensure you'll never be caught again.

name: Watchful Halfling
desc:
Your communal lifestyle causes you to pay close attention to the people around you, allowing you to more easily notice when they act out of character. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when using the Sense Motive basic action to notice enchanted or possessed characters. If you aren't actively using Sense Motive on an enchanted or possessed character, the GM rolls a secret check, without the usual circumstance and with a -2 circumstance penalty, for you to potentially notice the enchantment or possession anyway.

In addition to using it for skill checks, you can use the Aid basic action to grant a bonus to another creature's saving throw or other check to overcome enchantment or possession.

As usual for Aid, you need to prepare by using an action on your turn to encourage the creature to fight against the effect.

hints.desc:
You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when using the Sense Motive basic action to notice enchanted or possessed characters.

(Second Activation) If you aren't actively using Sense Motive on an enchanted or possessed character, the GM rolls a secret check, without the usual circumstance and with a -2 circumstance penalty, for you to potentially notice the enchantment or possession anyway.

In addition to using it for skill checks, you can use the Aid basic action to grant a bonus to another creature's saving throw or other check to overcome enchantment or possession. As usual for Aid, you need to prepare by using an action on your turn to encourage the creature to fight against the effect.

shortdesc: Your communal lifestyle causes you to pay close attention to the people around you.

name: Cultural Adaptability
desc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you. You gain the Adopted Ancestry general feat, and you also gain one 1st-level ancestry feat from the ancestry you chose for the Adopted Ancestry feat.
shortdesc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you.

name: Cultural Adaptability: Dwarf
desc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you. You gain the Adopted Ancestry general feat for the Dwarf ancestry, and you also gain one 1st-level ancestry feat from the Dwarf ancestry.
shortdesc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you.
specialreqdesc: Any Ancestry except Dwarf

name: Cultural Adaptability: Elf
desc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you. You gain the Adopted Ancestry general feat for the Elf ancestry, and you also gain one 1st-level ancestry feat from the Elf ancestry.
shortdesc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you.
specialreqdesc: Any Ancestry except Elf

name: Cultural Adaptability: Gnome
desc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you. You gain the Adopted Ancestry general feat for the Gnome ancestry, and you also gain one 1st-level ancestry feat from the Gnome ancestry.
shortdesc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you.
specialreqdesc: Any Ancestry except Gnome

name: Cultural Adaptability: Goblin
desc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you. You gain the Adopted Ancestry general feat for the Goblin ancestry, and you also gain one 1st-level ancestry feat from the Goblin ancestry.
shortdesc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you.
specialreqdesc: Any Ancestry except Goblin

name: Cultural Adaptability: Human
desc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you. You gain the Adopted Ancestry general feat for the Human ancestry, and you also gain one 1st-level ancestry feat from the Human ancestry.
shortdesc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you.
specialreqdesc: Any Ancestry except Human

name: Cultural Adaptability: Hobgoblin
desc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you. You gain the Adopted Ancestry general feat for the Hobgoblin ancestry, and you also gain one 1st-level ancestry feat from the Hobgoblin ancestry.
shortdesc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you.
specialreqdesc: Any Ancestry except Hobgoblin

name: Cultural Adaptability: Leshy
desc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you. You gain the Adopted Ancestry general feat for the Leshy ancestry, and you also gain one 1st-level ancestry feat from the Leshy ancestry.
shortdesc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you.
specialreqdesc: Any Ancestry except Leshy

name: Cultural Adaptability: Lizardfolk
desc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you. You gain the Adopted Ancestry general feat for the Lizardfolk ancestry, and you also gain one 1st-level ancestry feat from the Lizardfolk ancestry.
shortdesc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you.
specialreqdesc: Any Ancestry except Lizardfolk

name: Cultural Adaptability: Shoony
desc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you. You gain the Adopted Ancestry general feat for the Shoony ancestry, and you also gain one 1st-level ancestry feat from the Shoony ancestry.
shortdesc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you.
specialreqdesc: Any Ancestry except Shoony

name: Easily Dismissed
desc: You are practiced at blending into the background of the streets and halls of larger folk to ensure that you are overlooked. When you are in a crowd or well trafficked urban area, you can attempt to Hide and Sneak, even when observed. On a success, you aren't hidden or undetected, but other creatures simply don't take particular notice of you, even though they can see you. You can't use this ability on observers who have already seen you perform obtrusive or notable actions. If you perform any action other than to Hide or Sneak or otherwise take particularly salient actions (GM's discretion), observers notice you right away.

hints.desc: When you are in a crowd or well trafficked urban area, you can attempt to Hide and Sneak, even when observed. On a success, you aren't hidden or undetected, but other creatures simply don't take particular notice of you, even though they can see you. You can't use this ability on observers who have already seen you perform obtrusive or notable actions. If you perform any action other than to Hide or Sneak or otherwise take particularly salient actions (GM's discretion), observers notice you right away.

shortdesc: You are practiced at blending into the background of the streets and halls of larger folk to ensure that you are overlooked.

name: Halfling Ingenuity
desc: While your willingness to dig into a task you know little about might get you into trouble, your incredible luck often saves you from danger. You can attempt skill actions that normally require you to be trained even if you aren't trained in that skill. If you use Halfling Luck when you fail a check for a skill with which you are untrained, you can add a proficiency bonus equal to your level, rather than 0, when you reroll the triggering skill check. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to this rerolled skill check.

hints.desc: You can attempt skill actions that normally require you to be trained even if you aren't trained in that skill. If you use Halfling Luck when you fail a check for a skill with which you are untrained, you can add a proficiency bonus equal to your level, rather than 0, when you reroll the triggering skill check. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to this rerolled skill check.

shortdesc: While your willingness to dig into a task you know little about might get you into trouble, your incredible luck often saves you from danger.

name: Halfling Weapon Trickster
desc: You are particularly adept at fighting with your people's favored weapons. Whenever you critically succeed at an attack roll using a shortsword, a sling, or a halfling weapon, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect.
shortdesc: You are particularly adept at fighting with your people's favored weapons.

name: Shared Luck (Halfling)
desc: You are evidence that it's lucky to travel with a halfling. You can use Halfling Luck when an ally within 30 feet fails a skill check or a saving throw to allow the ally to reroll the triggering check instead of you rerolling your own failed check. As usual, your ally must use the new result, even if it's worse than their first roll. If you have Guiding Luck, you can't use Guiding Luck's effect that applies to attack rolls and Perception checks to use Shared Luck to benefit an ally.

hints.desc: You can use Halfling Luck when an ally within 30 feet fails a skill check or a saving throw to allow the ally to reroll the triggering check instead of you rerolling your own failed check. As usual, your ally must use the new result, even if it's worse than their first roll. If you have Guiding Luck, you can't use Guiding Luck's effect that applies to attack rolls and Perception checks to use Shared Luck to benefit an ally.

shortdesc: You are evidence that it's lucky to travel with a halfling.

name: Cunning Climber
desc: Whether you are climbing a ship's rigging, a jungle tree, or a clock tower, you have an uncanny knack for finding footholds and handholds where larger creatures can't. You gain a climb Speed of 10 feet. You can take the Legendary Climber feat even if you don't have the Quick Climb feat, provided you meet its other prerequisites.
specialdesc: Note: The Legendary Climber feat does not exist.
internalNote: There is no feat called Legendary Climber, and there is no climbing feat that requires legendary Athletics.
shortdesc: Whether you are climbing a ship's rigging, a jungle tree, or a clock tower, you have an uncanny knack for finding footholds and handholds where larger creatures can't.

name: Fade Away
desc: Your ability to blend into the background allows you to fade away entirely or appear innocuous even to magical effects. You gain invisibility and misdirection as 2nd-level innate occult spells. You can target only yourself with invisibility, and you must be the primary target of misdirection. You can cast each spell once per day.

hints.desc: When casting invisibility as an innate spell gained from the Fade Away feat, you can target only yourself.
When casting misdirection as an innate spell gained from the Fade Away feat, you must be the primary target.

shortdesc: Your ability to blend into the background allows you to fade away entirely or appear innocuous even to magical effects.

name: Guiding Luck
desc: Your luck guides you to look the right way and aim your blows unerringly. You can use Halfling Luck twice per day: once in response to its normal trigger, and once when you fail a Perception check or attack roll instead of the normal trigger.

hints.desc: You can use Halfling Luck twice per day: once in response to its normal trigger, and once when you fail a Perception check or attack roll instead of the normal trigger.

shortdesc: Your luck guides you to look the right way and aim your blows unerringly.

name: Helpful Halfling
desc: When you aid a friend with a task, you find many ways to help and avoid interfering. On a critical success to Aid, you grant your ally a +3 circumstance bonus if you have expert proficiency in the skill (rather than +2), and you grant your ally a +4 circumstance bonus if you have master proficiency (rather than +3). If you roll a critical failure on a check to Aid, you don't give your ally a -1 circumstance penalty to their check.

hints.desc: On a critical success to Aid, you grant your ally a +3 circumstance bonus if you have expert proficiency in the skill (rather than +2), and you grant your ally a +4 circumstance bonus if you have master proficiency (rather than +3). If you roll a critical failure on a check to Aid, you don't give your ally a -1 circumstance penalty to their check.

shortdesc: When you aid a friend with a task, you find many ways to help and avoid interfering.

name: Irrepressible
desc: You are easily able to ward off attempts to play on your fears and emotions. When you roll a success on a saving throw against an emotion effect, you get a critical success instead. If your heritage is gutsy halfling, when you roll a critical failure on a saving throw against an emotion effect, you get a failure instead.

hints.desc: When you roll a success on a saving throw against an emotion effect, you get a critical success instead. If your heritage is gutsy halfling, when you roll a critical failure on a saving throw against an emotion effect, you get a failure instead.

shortdesc: You are easily able to ward off attempts to play on your fears and emotions.

name: Ceaseless Shadows
desc: You excel at going unnoticed, especially among a crowd. You no longer need to have cover or be concealed to Hide or Sneak. If you would have lesser cover from creatures, you gain cover and can Take Cover, and if you would have cover from creatures, you gain greater cover.

hints.desc: You no longer need to have cover or be concealed to Hide or Sneak.
If you would have lesser cover from creatures, you gain cover and can Take Cover, and if you would have cover from creatures, you gain greater cover.

shortdesc: You excel at going unnoticed, especially among a crowd.

name: Cobble Dancer
desc: You know how to take advantage of foes thrown off-balance by unstable flooring, loose cobblestones, or similar impediments. While in an outdoor urban environment, you can Step into difficult terrain and enemies in difficult terrain are flat-footed to you.

hints.desc: While in an outdoor urban environment, you can Step into difficult terrain.
While in an outdoor urban environment, enemies in difficult terrain are flat-footed to you.

shortdesc: You know how to take advantage of foes thrown off-balance by unstable flooring, loose cobblestones, or similar impediments.

name: Halfling Weapon Expertise
desc: Your halfling affinity blends with your class training, granting you great skill with halfling weapons. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in a given weapon or weapons, you also gain that proficiency in the sling, halfling sling staff, shortsword, and all halfling weapons in which you are trained.
shortdesc: Your halfling affinity blends with your class training, granting you great skill with halfling weapons.

name: Incredible Luck (Halfling)
desc: Even other halflings consider you to be particularly lucky. You can use Halfling Luck once per hour, rather than once per day. If you have Guiding Luck, you can still use Halfling Luck when you fail a Perception check or attack roll only once per day (though you can use it within the same hour that you used Halfling Luck), and if you have Helpful Halfling, you can still use Halfling Luck on an ally instead of yourself only once per day.

hints.desc: You can use Halfling Luck once per hour, rather than once per day. If you have Guiding Luck, you can still use Halfling Luck when you fail a Perception check or attack roll only once per day (though you can use it within the same hour that you used Halfling Luck), and if you have Shared Luck, you can still use Halfling Luck on an ally instead of yourself only once per day.

shortdesc: Even other halflings consider you to be particularly lucky.

name: Adapted Cantrip
desc:
Through study of multiple magical traditions, you've altered a spell to suit your spellcasting style. Choose one cantrip from a magical tradition other than your own. If you have a spell repertoire or a spellbook, replace one of the cantrips you know or have in your spellbook with the chosen spell. If you prepare spells without a spellbook (if you're a cleric or druid, for example), one of your cantrips must always be the chosen spell, and you prepare the rest normally. You can cast this cantrip as a spell of your class's tradition.

If you swap or retrain this cantrip later, you can choose its replacement from the same alternate tradition or a different one.

hints.desc:
Through study of multiple magical traditions, you've altered a spell to suit your spellcasting style. Choose one cantrip from a magical tradition other than your own. If you have a spell repertoire or a spellbook, replace one of the cantrips you know or have in your spellbook with the chosen spell. If you prepare spells without a spellbook (if you're a cleric or druid, for example), one of your cantrips must always be the chosen spell, and you prepare the rest normally. You can cast this cantrip as a spell of your class's tradition.

If you swap or retrain this cantrip later, you can choose its replacement from the same alternate tradition or a different one.

internalNote: Choosing from another tradition as well as losing a cantrip is hardcoded.
shortdesc: Through study of multiple magical traditions, you've altered a spell to suit your spellcasting style.
specialreqdesc: spellcasting class feature

name: Arcane Tattoos
desc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic. Choose one of the following schools of magic: abjuration (shield), conjuration (tanglefoot), enchantment (daze), evocation (electric arc), illusion (ghost sound), necromancy (chill touch), or transmutation (sigil). You can cast the associated cantrip (listed in parentheses) as an innate arcane spell at will.
access: Varisian ethnicity or New Thassilon nationality
shortdesc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic.

name: Arcane Tattoos: Abjuration
desc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to the ancient Thassilonian school of abjuration. You can cast shield as an innate arcane spell at will.
access: Varisian ethnicity or New Thassilon nationality
shortdesc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic.

name: Arcane Tattoos: Conjuration
desc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to the ancient Thassilonian school of conjuration. You can cast tanglefoot as an innate arcane spell at will.
access: Varisian ethnicity or New Thassilon nationality
shortdesc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic.

name: Arcane Tattoos: Enchantment
desc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to the ancient Thassilonian school of enchantment. You can cast daze as an innate arcane spell at will.
access: Varisian ethnicity or New Thassilon nationality
shortdesc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic.

name: Arcane Tattoos: Evocation
desc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to the ancient Thassilonian school of evocation. You can cast electric arc as an innate arcane spell at will.
access: Varisian ethnicity or New Thassilon nationality
shortdesc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic.

name: Arcane Tattoos: Illusion
desc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to the ancient Thassilonian school of illusion. You can cast ghost sound as an innate arcane spell at will.
access: Varisian ethnicity or New Thassilon nationality
shortdesc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic.

name: Arcane Tattoos: Necromancy
desc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to the ancient Thassilonian school of necromancy. You can cast chill touch as an innate arcane spell at will.
access: Varisian ethnicity or New Thassilon nationality
shortdesc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic.

name: Arcane Tattoos: Transmutation
desc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to the ancient Thassilonian school of transmutation. You can cast sigil as an innate arcane spell at will.
access: Varisian ethnicity or New Thassilon nationality
shortdesc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic.

name: Cooperative Nature
desc: The short human life span lends perspective and has taught you from a young age to set aside differences and work with others to achieve greatness. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus on checks to Aid.

hints.desc: You gain a +4 circumstance bonus on checks to Aid.

shortdesc: The short human life span lends perspective and has taught you from a young age to set aside differences and work with others to achieve greatness.

name: Courteous Comeback
desc: You grew up in the proud Padishah Empire, where even insults have a certain poetic wit.
shortdesc: You grew up in the proud Padishah Empire, where even insults have a certain poetic wit.

name: Devil's Advocate
desc: You know more about the habits of devils than is entirely safe. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks against devils and saving throws against their abilities. In addition, whenever you meet a devil in a social situation, you can immediately attempt a Diplomacy check to Make an Impression on that creature rather than needing to converse for 1 minute. You take a -5 penalty to the check. If you fail, you can engage in 1 minute of conversation and attempt a new check at the end of that time rather than accepting the failure or critical failure result.
specialdesc: If you have the Glad-Hand skill feat, you don't take the penalty to your immediate Diplomacy check if the target is a devil.

hints.desc: You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks against devils and saving throws against their abilities.

Whenever you meet a devil in a social situation, you can immediately attempt a Diplomacy check to Make an Impression on that creature rather than needing to converse for 1 minute. You take a -5 penalty to the check. If you have the Glad-Hand skill feat, you don't take the penalty to your immediate Diplomacy check if the target is a devil. If you fail, you can engage in 1 minute of conversation and attempt a new check at the end of that time rather than accepting the failure or critical failure result.

shortdesc: You know more about the habits of devils than is entirely safe.

name: Dragon Spit
desc: Many Tian-Dan claim to have dragon blood in their veins, and in your case, this is true - you can spit energy, and you might have an especially visible sign of your draconic heritage. Choose one of the following cantrips: acid splash, electric arc, produce flame, or ray of frost. You can cast this spell as an innate arcane spell at will, and when you cast it, the spell's energy emerges from your mouth.
shortdesc: Many Tian-Dan claim to have dragon blood in their veins, and in your case, this is true - you can spit energy, and you might have an especially visible sign of your draconic heritage.
specialreqdesc: Tian-Dan ethnicity

name: Dragon Spit: Acid Splash
desc: Many Tian-Dan claim to have dragon blood in their veins, and in your case, this is true - you can spit energy, and you might have an especially visible sign of your draconic heritage. You can cast acid splash as an innate arcane spell at will, and when you cast it, the spell's energy emerges from your mouth.

hints.desc: When you cast acid splash as an innate spell gained through the Dragon Spit feat, the spell's energy emerges from your mouth.

shortdesc: Many Tian-Dan claim to have dragon blood in their veins, and in your case, this is true - you can spit energy, and you might have an especially visible sign of your draconic heritage.

You can cast electric arc as an innate arcane spell at will, and when you cast it, the spell's energy emerges from your mouth.

hints.desc: When you cast electric arc as an innate spell gained through the Dragon Spit feat, the spell's energy emerges from your mouth.

shortdesc: Many Tian-Dan claim to have dragon blood in their veins, and in your case, this is true - you can spit energy, and you might have an especially visible sign of your draconic heritage.

desc: Many Tian-Dan claim to have dragon blood in their veins, and in your case, this is true - you can spit energy, and you might have an especially visible sign of your draconic heritage. You can cast produce flame as an innate arcane spell at will, and when you cast it, the spell's energy emerges from your mouth.

hints.desc: When you cast produce flame as an innate spell gained through the Dragon Spit feat, the spell's energy emerges from your mouth.

shortdesc: Many Tian-Dan claim to have dragon blood in their veins, and in your case, this is true - you can spit energy, and you might have an especially visible sign of your draconic heritage.

name: Dragon Spit: Ray of Frost
desc: Many Tian-Dan claim to have dragon blood in their veins, and in your case, this is true - you can spit energy, and you might have an especially visible sign of your draconic heritage. You can cast ray of frost as an innate arcane spell at will, and when you cast it, the spell's energy emerges from your mouth.

hints.desc: When you cast ray of frost as an innate spell gained through the Dragon Spit feat, the spell's energy emerges from your mouth.

shortdesc: Many Tian-Dan claim to have dragon blood in their veins, and in your case, this is true - you can spit energy, and you might have an especially visible sign of your draconic heritage.

gainSpellChoice.source: Feat: Dragon Spit: Ray of Frost

name: General Training
desc: Your adaptability manifests in your mastery of a range of useful abilities. You gain a 1st-level general feat. You must meet the feat's prerequisites, but if you select this feat during character creation, you can select the feat later in the process in order to determine which prerequisites you meet.
specialdesc: You can select this feat multiple times, choosing a different feat each time.
shortdesc: Your adaptability manifests in your mastery of a range of useful abilities.

name: Gloomseer
desc: Gloom holds few terrors for you, and the pall of darkness over Nidal has made you comfortable in dim light. You gain low-light vision.
shortdesc: Gloom holds few terrors for you, and the pall of darkness over Nidal has made you comfortable in dim light.
specialreqdesc: Nidalese ethnicity

name: Haughty Obstinacy
desc: Your powerful ego makes it harder for others to order you around. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a mental effect that attempts to directly control your actions, you critically succeed instead. If a creature rolls a failure on a check to Coerce you using Intimidation, it gets a critical failure instead (so it can't try to Coerce you again for 1 week).

hints.desc: If you roll a success on a saving throw against a mental effect that attempts to directly control your actions, you critically succeed instead. If a creature rolls a failure on a check to Coerce you using Intimidation, it gets a critical failure instead (so it can't try to Coerce you again for 1 week).

shortdesc: Your powerful ego makes it harder for others to order you around.

name: Keep Up Appearances
desc: Taldan pride means you never show weakness.
shortdesc: Taldan pride means you never show weakness.

name: Know Oneself
desc: You center yourself and call to mind the Vudrani monastic ideals of mindfulness and self-knowledge.
shortdesc: You center yourself and call to mind the Vudrani monastic ideals of mindfulness and self-knowledge.

name: Natural Ambition
desc: You were raised to be ambitious and always reach for the stars, leading you to progress quickly in your chosen field. You gain a 1st-level class feat for your class. You must meet the prerequisites, but you can select the feat later in the character creation process in order to determine which prerequisites you meet.
shortdesc: You were raised to be ambitious and always reach for the stars, leading you to progress quickly in your chosen field.

name: Natural Skill
desc: Your ingenuity allows you to learn a wide variety of skills. You gain the trained proficiency rank in two skills of your choice.
shortdesc: Your ingenuity allows you to learn a wide variety of skills.

name: Quah Bond
desc: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance. You gain the trained proficiency rank in the skill listed for your quah (or another skill of your choice, if you're already trained in that skill). You gain the Assurance skill feat in that skill, as the spirits' help guides your actions. Lyrune-Quah Religion Shadde-Quah Athletics Shriikirri-Quah Nature Shundar-Quah Diplomacy Sklar-Quah Intimidation Skoan-Quah Medicine Tamiir-Quah Acrobatics
shortdesc: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance.

name: Quah Bond: Lyrune-Quah
desc: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Religion (or another skill of your choice, if you're already trained in that skill). You gain the Assurance skill feat in Religion, as the spirits' help guides your actions.
shortdesc: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance.

name: Quah Bond: Shadde-Quah
desc: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Athletics (or another skill of your choice, if you're already trained in that skill). You gain the Assurance skill feat in Athletics, as the spirits' help guides your actions.
shortdesc: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance.

name: Quah Bond: Shriikirri-Quah
desc: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Nature (or another skill of your choice, if you're already trained in that skill). You gain the Assurance skill feat in Nature, as the spirits' help guides your actions.
shortdesc: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance.

name: Quah Bond: Shundar-Quah
desc: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Diplomacy (or another skill of your choice, if you're already trained in that skill). You gain the Assurance skill feat in Diplomacy, as the spirits' help guides your actions.
shortdesc: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance.

name: Quah Bond: Sklar-Quah
desc: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Intimidation (or another skill of your choice, if you're already trained in that skill). You gain the Assurance skill feat in Intimidation, as the spirits' help guides your actions.
shortdesc: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance.

name: Quah Bond: Skoan-Quah
desc: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Medicine (or another skill of your choice, if you're already trained in that skill). You gain the Assurance skill feat in Medicine, as the spirits' help guides your actions.
shortdesc: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance.

name: Quah Bond: Tamiir-Quah
desc: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Acrobatics (or another skill of your choice, if you're already trained in that skill). You gain the Assurance skill feat in Acrobatics, as the spirits' help guides your actions.
shortdesc: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance.

name: Saoc Astrology
desc: The ancient Saoc Brethren were the masters of astrology, and while your knowledge may be but a pale shadow of their wisdom, it still comes in handy.
shortdesc: The ancient Saoc Brethren were the masters of astrology, and while your knowledge may be but a pale shadow of their wisdom, it still comes in handy.

name: Tupilaq Carver
desc: You know the truth behind old stories that tell of sending a fetish of bone and sinew to seek vengeance. These old magics allow you to conjure constructs with ease. Add the summon construct spell to your spell list. The constructs you summon have a distinct ivory scrimshaw appearance, and if you include a drop of blood, lock of hair, or other portion of a creature's body as part of the spell's material component, the summoned construct gains a +4 status bonus to Perception checks to sense or locate that creature.

hints.desc: The constructs you summon have a distinct ivory scrimshaw appearance, and if you include a drop of blood, lock of hair, or other portion of a creature's body as part of the spell's material component, the summoned construct gains a +4 status bonus to Perception checks to sense or locate that creature.

shortdesc: You know the truth behind old stories that tell of sending a fetish of bone and sinew to seek vengeance.
specialreqdesc: You have a spellcasting class feature with the divine or primal tradition

name: Unconventional Weaponry
desc:
You've familiarized yourself with a particular weapon, potentially from another ancestry or culture. Choose an uncommon simple or martial weapon with a trait corresponding to an ancestry (such as dwarf, goblin, or orc) or that is common in another culture. You gain access to that weapon, and for the purpose of determining your proficiency, that weapon is a simple weapon.

If you are trained in all martial weapons, you can choose an uncommon advanced weapon with such a trait. You gain access to that weapon, and for the purpose of determining your proficiency, that weapon is a martial weapon.
shortdesc: You've familiarized yourself with a particular weapon, potentially from another ancestry or culture.

name: Unconventional Weaponry: Uncommon Ancestry Simple Weapon
desc: You've familiarized yourself with a particular weapon, potentially from another ancestry or culture. You gain access to the Uncommon Ancestry Simple Weapon, and for the purpose of determining your proficiency, that weapon is a simple weapon.

hints.desc: You gain access to the Uncommon Ancestry Simple Weapon, and for the purpose of determining your proficiency, that weapon is a simple weapon.

shortdesc: You've familiarized yourself with a particular weapon, potentially from another ancestry or culture.

name: Unconventional Weaponry: Uncommon Ancestry Martial Weapon
desc: You've familiarized yourself with a particular weapon, potentially from another ancestry or culture. You gain access to the Uncommon Ancestry Martial Weapon, and for the purpose of determining your proficiency, that weapon is a simple weapon.

hints.desc: You gain access to the Uncommon Ancestry Martial Weapon, and for the purpose of determining your proficiency, that weapon is a simple weapon.

shortdesc: You've familiarized yourself with a particular weapon, potentially from another ancestry or culture.

name: Unconventional Weaponry: Uncommon Ancestry Advanced Weapon
desc: You've familiarized yourself with a particular weapon, potentially from another ancestry or culture. You gain access to the Uncommon Ancestry Advanced Weapon, and for the purpose of determining your proficiency, that weapon is a martial weapon.

hints.desc: You gain access to the Uncommon Ancestry Advanced Weapon, and for the purpose of determining your proficiency, that weapon is a martial weapon.

shortdesc: You've familiarized yourself with a particular weapon, potentially from another ancestry or culture.

name: Viking Shieldbearer
desc: You trained with shields and weapons as soon as you were old enough to hold them, eager to win honor and glory for yourself. You gain the Shield Block reaction and are trained in your choice of the battle axe or longsword.
shortdesc: You trained with shields and weapons as soon as you were old enough to hold them, eager to win honor and glory for yourself.

name: Viking Shieldbearer: Battle Axe
desc: You trained with shields and weapons as soon as you were old enough to hold them, eager to win honor and glory for yourself. You gain the Shield Block reaction and are trained in the battle axe.
shortdesc: You trained with shields and weapons as soon as you were old enough to hold them, eager to win honor and glory for yourself.

name: Viking Shieldbearer: Longsword
desc: You trained with shields and weapons as soon as you were old enough to hold them, eager to win honor and glory for yourself. You gain the Shield Block reaction and are trained in the longsword.
shortdesc: You trained with shields and weapons as soon as you were old enough to hold them, eager to win honor and glory for yourself.

name: Witch Warden
desc: You and your family have fought long and hard against witches, particularly the winter witches of Irrisen, and you've learned to be wary of their curses and the otherworldly powers their patrons grant. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against curses, and to saving throws against spells cast by a witch or hag. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a curse or a spell cast by a witch or hag, you get a critical success instead.

hints.desc: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against curses, and to saving throws against spells cast by a witch or hag. If you roll a success on a saving throw against a curse or a spell cast by a witch or hag, you get a critical success instead.

shortdesc: You and your family have fought long and hard against witches, particularly the winter witches of Irrisen, and you've learned to be wary of their curses and the otherworldly powers their patrons grant.

name: Adaptive Adept
desc: You've continued adapting your magic to blend your class's tradition with your adapted tradition. Choose a cantrip or 1st-level spell from the same magical tradition as your cantrip from Adapted Cantrip. You gain that spell, adding it to your spell repertoire, spellbook, or prepared spells just like the cantrip from Adapted Cantrip. You can cast this spell as a spell of your class's magical tradition. If you choose a 1st-level spell, you don't gain access to the heightened versions of that spell, meaning you can't prepare them if you prepare spells and you can't learn them or select the spell as a signature spell if you have a spell repertoire.
shortdesc: You've continued adapting your magic to blend your class's tradition with your adapted tradition.
specialreqdesc: can cast 3rd-level spells

name: Adaptive Adept: Cantrip
desc: You've continued adapting your magic to blend your class's tradition with your adapted tradition. Choose a cantrip from the same magical tradition as your cantrip from Adapted Cantrip. You gain that spell, adding it to your spell repertoire, spellbook, or prepared spells just like the cantrip from Adapted Cantrip. You can cast this spell as a spell of your class's magical tradition.
internalNote: Choosing from the same tradition as well as losing another spell is hardcoded.
shortdesc: You've continued adapting your magic to blend your class's tradition with your adapted tradition.
specialreqdesc: can cast 3rd-level spells

name: Adaptive Adept: 1st-Level Spell
desc: You've continued adapting your magic to blend your class's tradition with your adapted tradition. Choose a 1st-level spell from the same magical tradition as your cantrip from Adapted Cantrip. You gain that spell, adding it to your spell repertoire, spellbook, or prepared spells just like the cantrip from Adapted Cantrip. You can cast this spell as a spell of your class's magical tradition. You don't gain access to the heightened versions of that spell, meaning you can't prepare them if you prepare spells and you can't learn them or select the spell as a signature spell if you have a spell repertoire.
internalNote: Choosing from the same tradition as well as losing another spell is hardcoded.
shortdesc: You've continued adapting your magic to blend your class's tradition with your adapted tradition.
specialreqdesc: can cast 3rd-level spells

name: Clever Improviser
desc: You've learned how to handle situations when you're out of your depth. You gain the Untrained Improvisation general feat. In addition, you can attempt skill actions that normally require you to be trained, even if you are untrained.

hints.desc: You can attempt skill actions that normally require you to be trained, even if you are untrained.

shortdesc: You've learned how to handle situations when you're out of your depth.

name: Darkseer
desc: Zon-Kuthon smiles upon you - even if you curse his name - granting you pitch-black eyes that allow you to see in shadows and darkness. You gain darkvision.
shortdesc: Zon-Kuthon smiles upon you - even if you curse his name - granting you pitch-black eyes that allow you to see in shadows and darkness.

name: Ornate Tattoo
desc: You expand your tattoos to encompass greater magic. Choose a 1st-level arcane spell from the same school as your Arcane Tattoos, either a common spell or another to which you have access. You can cast that spell once per day as an innate arcane spell.
shortdesc: You expand your tattoos to encompass greater magic.

name: Ornate Tattoo: Abjuration
desc: You expand your tattoos to encompass greater magic. Choose a 1st-level arcane spell from the Abjuration school, either a common spell or another to which you have access. You can cast that spell once per day as an innate arcane spell.
shortdesc: You expand your tattoos to encompass greater magic.

desc: You expand your tattoos to encompass greater magic. Choose a 1st-level arcane spell from the Conjuration school, either a common spell or another to which you have access. You can cast that spell once per day as an innate arcane spell.
shortdesc: You expand your tattoos to encompass greater magic.

desc: You expand your tattoos to encompass greater magic. Choose a 1st-level arcane spell from the Enchantment school, either a common spell or another to which you have access. You can cast that spell once per day as an innate arcane spell.
shortdesc: You expand your tattoos to encompass greater magic.

desc: You expand your tattoos to encompass greater magic. Choose a 1st-level arcane spell from the Evocation school, either a common spell or another to which you have access. You can cast that spell once per day as an innate arcane spell.
shortdesc: You expand your tattoos to encompass greater magic.
