name: Deity's Domain: Wyrmkin
desc: You embody an aspect of your deity. You gain the Wyrmkin domain's Draconic Barrage spell as a devotion spell.
shortdesc: You embody an aspect of your deity.
specialreqdesc: deity who grants the wyrmkin domain

name: Deity's Domain: Zeal
desc: You embody an aspect of your deity. You gain the Zeal domain's Weapon Surge spell as a devotion spell.
shortdesc: You embody an aspect of your deity.
specialreqdesc: deity who grants the zeal domain

name: Avenge in Glory
desc: You honor your ally's life, gaining temporary Hit Points equal to your level for 1 minute.
shortdesc: You honor your ally's life, gaining temporary Hit Points equal to your level for 1 minute.

name: Clan's Edge
desc: By moving your clan dagger with rapid precision, you can protect yourself more effectively.
shortdesc: By moving your clan dagger with rapid precision, you can protect yourself more effectively.
specialreq: characterService.get_Skills(character, 'Simple Weapons')[0]?.level(character, characterService) >= 2 || characterService.get_Skills(character, 'Clan Dagger')[0]?.level(character, characterService) >= 2
specialreqdesc: trained in clan daggers

name: Dwarven Lore
desc: You eagerly absorbed the old stories and traditions of your ancestors, your gods, and your people, studying in subjects and techniques passed down for generation upon generation. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Crafting and Religion. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in Dwarven Lore.
shortdesc: You eagerly absorbed the old stories and traditions of your ancestors, your gods, and your people.

name: Dwarven Weapon Familiarity
desc:
Your kin have instilled in you an affinity for hard-hitting weapons, and you prefer these to more elegant arms. You are trained with the battle axe, pick, and warhammer.

You also gain access to all uncommon dwarf weapons. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial dwarf weapons are simple weapons and advanced dwarf weapons are martial weapons.

hints.desc: You gain access to all uncommon dwarf weapons. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial dwarf weapons are simple weapons and advanced dwarf weapons are martial weapons.

shortdesc: Your kin have instilled in you an affinity for hard-hitting weapons, and you prefer these to more elegant arms.

name: Forge-Day's Rest
desc: Your unusual rest cycle allows you to recover faster. As long as you rest for 12 hours, you gain the effects of the Fast Recovery general feat and you can go 20 hours without resting before becoming fatigued.

hints.desc:
As long as you rest for 12 hours, you gain the effects of the Fast Recovery general feat and you can go 20 hours without resting before becoming fatigued. (Activate this before resting to gain the effect.)

Fast Recovery: You regain twice as many Hit Points from resting. Each time you succeed at a Fortitude save against an ongoing disease or poison, you reduce its stage by 2, or by 1 against a virulent disease or poison. Each critical success you achieve against an ongoing disease or poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 against a virulent disease or poison. In addition, you reduce the severity of your drained condition by 2 when you rest for a night instead of by 1.

internalNote: The Drained reduction is hardcoded in ConditionsService.rest()
shortdesc: Your unusual rest cycle allows you to recover faster.

name: Rock Runner
desc: Your innate connection to stone makes you adept at moving across uneven surfaces. You can ignore difficult terrain caused by rubble and uneven ground made of stone and earth. In addition, when you use the Acrobatics skill to Balance on narrow surfaces or uneven ground made of stone or earth, you aren't flat-footed, and when you roll a success at one of these Acrobatics checks, you get a critical success instead.

hints.desc: You can ignore difficult terrain caused by rubble and uneven ground made of stone and earth.

When you use the Acrobatics skill to Balance on narrow surfaces or uneven ground made of stone or earth, you aren't flat-footed, and when you roll a success at one of these Acrobatics checks, you get a critical success instead.

shortdesc: Your innate connection to stone makes you adept at moving across uneven surfaces.

name: Stonecunning
desc:
You have a knack for noticing even small inconsistencies and craftsmanship techniques in the stonework around you. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to notice unusual stonework. This bonus applies to checks to discover mechanical traps made of stone or hidden within stone.

If you aren't using the Seek action or searching, the GM automatically rolls a secret check for you to notice unusual stonework anyway. This check doesn't gain the circumstance bonus, and it takes a -2 circumstance penalty.

hints.desc:
You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to notice unusual stonework. This bonus applies to checks to discover mechanical traps made of stone or hidden within stone.

(Second activation) If you aren't using the Seek action or searching, the GM automatically rolls a secret check for you to notice unusual stonework anyway. This check doesn't gain the circumstance bonus, and it takes a -2 circumstance penalty.

shortdesc: You have a knack for noticing even small inconsistencies and craftsmanship techniques in the stonework around you.

name: Surface Culture
desc: Your interactions with other cultures on the surface have not only taught you about many other ancestries, but have also helped you realize the value of your own. You gain the trained proficiency rank in the Society skill (or another skill of your choice if you were already trained in Society), and you gain the Additional Lore skill feat for the Lore corresponding to your culture (for instance, Ouat Lore or Pahmet Lore).
shortdesc: Your interactions with other cultures on the surface have not only taught you about many other ancestries, but have also helped you realize the value of your own.

name: Unburdened Iron
desc:
You've learned techniques first devised by your ancestors during their ancient wars, allowing you to comfortably wear massive suits of armor. Ignore the reduction to your Speed from any armor you wear.

In addition, any time you're taking a penalty to your Speed from some other reason (such as from the encumbered condition or from a spell), deduct 5 feet from the penalty. For example, the encumbered condition normally gives a -10-foot penalty to Speed, but it gives you only a -5-foot penalty. If your Speed is taking multiple penalties, pick only one penalty to reduce.

hints.desc: Any time you're taking a penalty to your Speed from any reason other than your armor (such as from the encumbered condition or from a spell), 5 feet are automatically deducted from the penalty. For example, the encumbered condition normally gives a -10-foot penalty to Speed, but it gives you only a -5-foot penalty. If your Speed is taking multiple penalties, only one penalty is reduced.

internalNote: The secondary effect is hardcoded.
shortdesc: You've learned techniques first devised by your ancestors during their ancient wars, allowing you to comfortably wear massive suits of armor.

name: Vengeful Hatred
desc: You heart aches for vengeance against those who have wronged your people. Choose one of the following dwarven ancestral foes when you gain Vengeful Hatred: drow, duergar, giant, or orc. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to damage with weapons and unarmed attacks against creatures with that trait. If your attack would deal more than one weapon die of damage (as is common at higher levels than 1st), the bonus is equal to the number of weapon dice or unarmed attack dice. In addition, if a creature critically succeeds at an attack against you and deals damage to you, you gain your bonus to damage against that creature for 1 minute regardless of whether it has the chosen trait.
specialdesc: Your GM can add appropriate creature traits to the ancestral foes list if your character is from a community that commonly fights other types of enemies.
shortdesc: You heart aches for vengeance against those who have wronged your people.

name: Vengeful Hatred: Drow
desc: You heart aches for vengeance against those who have wronged your people. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to damage with weapons and unarmed attacks against creatures with the Drow trait. If your attack would deal more than one weapon die of damage (as is common at higher levels than 1st), the bonus is equal to the number of weapon dice or unarmed attack dice. In addition, if a creature critically succeeds at an attack against you and deals damage to you, you gain your bonus to damage against that creature for 1 minute regardless of whether it has the Drow trait.

hints.desc: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to damage with weapons and unarmed attacks against creatures with the Drow trait. If your attack would deal more than one weapon die of damage, the bonus is equal to the number of weapon dice or unarmed attack dice. In addition, if a creature critically succeeds at an attack against you and deals damage to you, you gain your bonus to damage against that creature for 1 minute regardless of whether it has the Drow trait.

shortdesc: You heart aches for vengeance against those who have wronged your people.

name: Vengeful Hatred: Duergar
desc: You heart aches for vengeance against those who have wronged your people. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to damage with weapons and unarmed attacks against creatures with the Duergar trait. If your attack would deal more than one weapon die of damage (as is common at higher levels than 1st), the bonus is equal to the number of weapon dice or unarmed attack dice. In addition, if a creature critically succeeds at an attack against you and deals damage to you, you gain your bonus to damage against that creature for 1 minute regardless of whether it has the Duergar trait.

hints.desc: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to damage with weapons and unarmed attacks against creatures with the Duergar trait. If your attack would deal more than one weapon die of damage, the bonus is equal to the number of weapon dice or unarmed attack dice. In addition, if a creature critically succeeds at an attack against you and deals damage to you, you gain your bonus to damage against that creature for 1 minute regardless of whether it has the Duergar trait.

shortdesc: You heart aches for vengeance against those who have wronged your people.

name: Vengeful Hatred: Giant
desc: You heart aches for vengeance against those who have wronged your people. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to damage with weapons and unarmed attacks against creatures with the Giant trait. If your attack would deal more than one weapon die of damage (as is common at higher levels than 1st), the bonus is equal to the number of weapon dice or unarmed attack dice. In addition, if a creature critically succeeds at an attack against you and deals damage to you, you gain your bonus to damage against that creature for 1 minute regardless of whether it has the Giant trait.

hints.desc: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to damage with weapons and unarmed attacks against creatures with the Giant trait. If your attack would deal more than one weapon die of damage, the bonus is equal to the number of weapon dice or unarmed attack dice. In addition, if a creature critically succeeds at an attack against you and deals damage to you, you gain your bonus to damage against that creature for 1 minute regardless of whether it has the Giant trait.

shortdesc: You heart aches for vengeance against those who have wronged your people.

name: Vengeful Hatred: Orc
desc: You heart aches for vengeance against those who have wronged your people. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to damage with weapons and unarmed attacks against creatures with the Orc trait. If your attack would deal more than one weapon die of damage (as is common at higher levels than 1st), the bonus is equal to the number of weapon dice or unarmed attack dice. In addition, if a creature critically succeeds at an attack against you and deals damage to you, you gain your bonus to damage against that creature for 1 minute regardless of whether it has the Orc trait.

hints.desc: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to damage with weapons and unarmed attacks against creatures with the Orc trait. If your attack would deal more than one weapon die of damage, the bonus is equal to the number of weapon dice or unarmed attack dice. In addition, if a creature critically succeeds at an attack against you and deals damage to you, you gain your bonus to damage against that creature for 1 minute regardless of whether it has the Orc trait.

shortdesc: You heart aches for vengeance against those who have wronged your people.

name: Boulder Roll
desc: Your dwarven build allows you to push foes around, just like a mighty boulder.
shortdesc: Your dwarven build allows you to push foes around, just like a mighty boulder.

name: Clan Protector
desc: Your clan dagger can protect your allies as easily as yourself. When you use an Interact action to gain a circumstance bonus to AC from your clan dagger's parry trait, you can grant the circumstance bonus to an adjacent ally instead of gaining it yourself. You can use multiple Interact actions to protect multiple allies, or to protect yourself and an ally. The ally benefits from the bonus to AC only when they are adjacent to you.

hints.desc:
When you use an Interact action to gain a circumstance bonus to AC from your clan dagger's parry trait, you can grant the circumstance bonus to an adjacent ally instead of gaining it yourself. You can use multiple Interact actions to protect multiple allies, or to protect yourself and an ally. The ally benefits from the bonus to AC only when they are adjacent to you.

(Your allies can apply the bonus with the Clan Protector condition.)

shortdesc: Your clan dagger can protect your allies as easily as yourself.

name: Dwarven Weapon Cunning
desc: You've learned cunning techniques to get the best effects out of your dwarven weapons. Whenever you critically hit using a battle axe, pick, warhammer, or a dwarf weapon, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect.
shortdesc: You've learned cunning techniques to get the best effects out of your dwarven weapons.

name: Protective Sheath
desc: When you lash out with your clan dagger, you keep its sheath close at hand. When you use Clan's Edge, if the hand you're not holding the dagger with is empty, you can use your clan dagger's sheath to block attacks as well. The circumstance bonus to your AC from parrying increases to a +2 against any target you hit with a Strike this turn.

hints.desc: When you use Clan's Edge, if the hand you're not holding the dagger with is empty, you can use your clan dagger's sheath to block attacks as well. The circumstance bonus to your AC from parrying increases to a +2 against any target you hit with a Strike this turn.

shortdesc: When you lash out with your clan dagger, you keep its sheath close at hand.

name: Tomb-Watcher's Glare
desc: When you critically hit an undead creature, or an undead creature critically fails a saving throw against one of your abilities, you drive your divine wrath home in your enemy's heart. The undead is enfeebled 1 for 1 round.

hints.desc: When you critically hit an undead creature, or an undead creature critically fails a saving throw against one of your abilities, you drive your divine wrath home in your enemy's heart. The undead is enfeebled 1 for 1 round.

shortdesc: When you critically hit an undead creature, or an undead creature critically fails a saving throw against one of your abilities, you drive your divine wrath home in your enemy's heart.

name: Battleforger
desc: You can sharpen weapons, polish armor, and apply special techniques to temporarily gain better effects from your armaments. By spending 1 hour working on a weapon or armor, you can grant it the effects of a +1 potency rune until your next daily preparations, gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls for a weapon or increasing armor's item bonus to AC by 1. This has no effect if the weapon or armor already had a potency rune.

hints.desc:
By spending 1 hour working on a weapon or armor, you can grant it the effects of a +1 potency rune until your next daily preparations, gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls for a weapon or increasing an armor's item bonus to AC by 1. This has no effect if the weapon or armor already had a potency rune.

Your allies can take advantage of this feat by granting themselves the Battleforger condition.

internalNote: The functionality is hardcoded on weapons, armors and worn items and in the inventory component.
shortdesc: You can sharpen weapons, polish armor, and apply special techniques to temporarily gain better effects from your armaments.

name: Energy Blessed
desc: Energy runs through your blood more powerfully. When you use Energy Emanation, you can create an emanation of 5 feet, 10 feet, or 15 feet. The damage increases to 6d6 plus an additional 1d6 for every level you have above 9th, instead of 1d6 plus an additional 1d6 for every 2 levels above 1st.

hints.desc: When you use Energy Emanation, you can create an emanation of 5 feet, 10 feet, or 15 feet. The damage increases to |dice=var1| 6d6 plus an additional 1d6 for every level you have above 9th, instead of 1d6 plus an additional 1d6 for every 2 levels above 1st.

shortdesc: Energy runs through your blood more powerfully.

name: Heroes' Call
desc: The songs of ancient heroes echo through your mind and quicken your pulse, especially in dire straits. You gain heroism as a 3rd-level innate occult spell that you can cast once per day. If you Cast the Spell when you have half or fewer Hit Points, you also gain temporary Hit Points equal to twice your level.

hints.desc: When you cast heroism as an innate spell gained through the Heroes' Call feat, and you have half or fewer Hit Points, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to twice your level.

shortdesc: The songs of ancient heroes echo through your mind and quicken your pulse, especially in dire straits.

name: Kneel for No God
desc: Your ancestors' defiance of magic and your people's strictly egalitarian mindset mean that certain forms of magic have little effect on you. When you use your Call on Ancient Blood reaction against a divine spell and roll a critical failure on the saving throw against that spell, you get a failure instead.

hints.desc: When you use your Call on Ancient Blood reaction against a divine spell and roll a critical failure on the saving throw against that spell, you get a failure instead.

shortdesc: Your ancestors' defiance of magic and your people's strictly egalitarian mindset mean that certain forms of magic have little effect on you.

name: Mountain's Stoutness
desc:
Your hardiness lets you withstand more punishment than most before going down. Increase your maximum Hit Points by your level. When you have the dying condition, the DC of your recovery checks is equal to 9 + your dying value (instead of 10 + your dying value).

If you also have the Toughness feat, the Hit Points gained from it and this feat are cumulative, and the DC of your recovery checks is equal to 6 + your dying value.

hints.desc: When you have the dying condition, the DC of your recovery checks is equal to 9 + your dying value (instead of 10 + your dying value). If you have the Toughness feat, the DC of your recovery checks is equal to 6 + your dying value.

shortdesc: Your hardiness lets you withstand more punishment than most before going down.

name: Stonewalker
desc:
You have a deep reverence for and connection to stone. You gain meld into stone as a 3rd-level divine innate spell that you can cast once per day.

If you have the Stonecunning dwarf ancestry feat, you can attempt to find unusual stonework and stonework traps that require legendary proficiency in Perception. If you have both Stonecunning and legendary proficiency in Perception, when you're not Seeking and the GM rolls a secret check for you to notice unusual stonework, you keep the bonus from Stonecunning and don't take the -2 circumstance penalty.

hints.desc: If you have the Stonecunning dwarf ancestry feat, you can attempt to find unusual stonework and stonework traps that require legendary proficiency in Perception. If you have both Stonecunning and legendary proficiency in Perception, when you're not Seeking and the GM rolls a secret check for you to notice unusual stonework, you keep the bonus from Stonecunning and don't take the -2 circumstance penalty.

shortdesc: You have a deep reverence for and connection to stone.

name: Dwarven Weapon Expertise
desc: Your dwarven affinity blends with your training, granting you great skill with dwarven weapons. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in certain weapons, you also gain that proficiency for battle axes, picks, warhammers, and all dwarven weapons in which you are trained.
shortdesc: Your dwarven affinity blends with your training, granting you great skill with dwarven weapons.

name: Acute Vision
desc: When you are raging, your visual senses improve, granting you darkvision.

hints.desc: When you are raging, you gain darkvision.

internalNote: Coded into the Rage condition
shortdesc: Your sense improve when you are raging.

name: Moment of Clarity
desc: You push back your rage for a moment in order to think clearly.
shortdesc: You push back your rage for a moment in order to think clearly.

name: Raging Intimidation
desc: Your fury fills your foes with fear. While you are raging, your Demoralize and Scare to Death actions (from the Intimidation skill and an Intimidation skill feat, respectively) gain the rage trait, allowing you to use them while raging. As soon as you meet the prerequisites for the skill feats Intimidating Glare and Scare to Death, you gain these feats.

hints.desc: While you are raging, your Demoralize and Scare to Death actions (from the Intimidation skill and an Intimidation skill feat, respectively) gain the rage trait, allowing you to use them while raging.
As soon as you meet the prerequisites for the skill feats Intimidating Glare and Scare to Death, you gain these feats.

shortdesc: Your fury fills your foes with fear.

name: Raging Thrower
desc: Thrown weapons become especially deadly in your fury. You apply the additional damage from Rage to your thrown weapon attacks. If you have the Brutal Critical feat or the devastator class feature, apply their benefits to thrown weapon attacks.

hints.desc: If you have the Brutal Critical feat or the devastator class feature, apply their benefits to thrown weapon attacks.

shortdesc: Thrown weapons become especially deadly in your fury.

name: Acute Scent
desc: When you Rage, your sense of smell improves. You gain imprecise scent with a range of 30 feet.

hints.desc: When you Rage, you gain imprecise scent with a range of 30 feet.

internalNote: Coded into the Rage condition
shortdesc: When you Rage, your sense of smell improves.
specialreqdesc: Acute Vision or darkvision

name: Furious Finish
desc: Desperate to finish the fight, you pour all your rage into one final blow.
shortdesc: Desperate to finish the fight, you pour all your rage into one final blow.

name: No Escape
desc: You keep pace with a retreating foe.
shortdesc: You keep pace with a retreating foe.

name: Second Wind
desc: You can enter a second rage, but afterward you need to catch your breath. You can Rage without waiting for 1 minute after the previous Rage (or 1 round, with quick rage), but when you end this second Rage, you're fatigued until you rest for 10 minutes.
shortdesc: You can enter a second rage, but afterward you need to catch your breath.

name: Shake it Off
desc: You concentrate on your rage, overcoming fear and fighting back sickness.
shortdesc: You concentrate on your rage, overcoming fear and fighting back sickness.

name: Farabellus Flip
desc: Surprisingly agile even in a breastplate and carrying a full rucksack, Marcos Farabellus developed this evasive maneuver during one of his many adventures.
shortdesc: Surprisingly agile even in a breastplate and carrying a full rucksack, Marcos Farabellus developed this evasive maneuver during one of his many adventures.
PFSnote: All characters have access to this feat.

name: Fast Movement
desc: Your rage is a frenzy of rapid movements. While you are raging, you gain a +10-foot status bonus to your Speed.

hints.desc: While you are raging, you gain a +10-foot status bonus to your Speed.

internalNote: Coded into the Rage condition
shortdesc: Your rage is a frenzy of rapid movements.

name: Raging Athlete
desc: Physical obstacles can't hold back your fury. While you are raging, you gain a climb Speed and swim Speed equal to your land Speed and the DC of High Jumps and Long Jumps decreases by 10. Your distance for a vertical Leap increases to 5 feet vertically, and your distance for a horizontal Leap increases to 15 feet if your Speed is at least 15 feet and to 20 feet if your Speed is at least 30 feet.

hints.desc: While you are raging, you gain a climb Speed and swim Speed equal to your land Speed and the DC of High Jumps and Long Jumps decreases by 10. Your distance for a vertical Leap increases to 5 feet vertically, and your distance for a horizontal Leap increases to 15 feet if your Speed is at least 15 feet and to 20 feet if your Speed is at least 30 feet.

internalNote: Coded into the Rage condition
shortdesc: Physical obstacles can't hold back your fury.

name: Wounded Rage
desc: You roar in pain, awakening the rage within you.
internalNote: Coded into the Rage condition
shortdesc: You roar in pain, awakening the rage within you.

name: Animal Skin
desc: Your proficiency in unarmored defense increases to expert. When you are raging and unarmored, your skin transforms into a thick hide. You gain a +2 item bonus to AC (+3 if you have the greater juggernaut class feature). The thickness of your hide gives you a Dexterity modifier cap to your AC of +3. This item bonus to AC is cumulative with armor potency runes on your explorer's clothing, mage armor, and bracers of armor.
internalNote: Coded into the Bestial Rage condition
shortdesc: Your proficiency in unarmored defense increases to expert.

name: Attack of Opportunity
desc: You lash out at a foe that leaves an opening.
shortdesc: You swat a foe that leaves an opening.

name: Brutal Bully
desc: You push your foes around and leave bruises. While raging, when you successfully Disarm, Grapple, Shove, or Trip a foe, you deal that foe bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier; add this to the damage from a critical success to Trip.

hints.desc: While raging, when you successfully Disarm, Grapple, Shove, or Trip a foe, you deal that foe |dice=strmod B| bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier; add this to the damage from a critical success to Trip.

shortdesc: You push your foes around and leave bruises.

name: Cleave
desc: You swing clear through one foe and into another.
shortdesc: You swing clear through one foe and into another.

name: Dragon's Rage Breath
desc: You breathe deeply and exhale powerful energy in a 30-foot cone or 60-foot line, dealing 1d6 damage per level.
shortdesc: You exhale powerful draconic energy.

name: Giant's Stature
desc: You grow to incredible size.
shortdesc: You grow to incredible size.

name: Spirits' Interference
desc: You call forth protective spirits to ward off ranged attacks.
shortdesc: You call forth protective spirits to ward off ranged attacks.

name: Animal Rage
desc: You transform into your animal.
shortdesc: You transform into your animal.

name: Furious Bully
desc: You bully foes across the battlefield. While raging, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks for attack actions.

hints.desc: While raging, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks for attack actions.

internalNote: Coded into the Rage condition
shortdesc: You bully foes across the battlefield.

name: Renewed Vigor
desc: You pause to recover your raging vigor.
shortdesc: You pause to recover your raging vigor.

name: Share Rage
desc: You stoke an ally's fury.
shortdesc: You stoke an ally's fury.

name: Thrash
desc: You thrash the grabbed foe around.
shortdesc: You thrash the grabbed foe around.

name: Come and Get Me
desc: You open yourself to attacks so you can respond in turn.
shortdesc: You open yourself to attacks so you can respond in turn.

name: Furious Sprint
desc: You rush forward.
shortdesc: You rush forward.

name: Great Cleave
desc: Your fury carries your weapon through multiple foes. When you Cleave, if your Strike also kills or knocks the target unconscious, you can continue to make melee Strikes until you make a Strike that doesn't kill or knock a creature unconscious, or until there are no creatures adjacent to the most recent creature you attacked while Cleaving, whichever comes first.

hints.desc: When you Cleave, if your Strike also kills or knocks the target unconscious, you can continue to make melee Strikes until you make a Strike that doesn't kill or knock a creature unconscious, or until there are no creatures adjacent to the most recent creature you attacked while Cleaving, whichever comes first.

shortdesc: Your fury carries your weapon through multiple foes.

name: Knockback
desc: The weight of your swing drives your enemy back.
shortdesc: The weight of your swing drives your enemy back.

name: Terrifying Howl
desc: You unleash a terrifying howl.
shortdesc: You unleash a terrifying howl.

name: Dragon's Rage Wings
desc: You sprout dragon wings from your back of the same color as your chosen dragon.
shortdesc: You sprout dragon wings from your back.

name: Furious Grab
desc: You grab your foe while it's distracted by your attack.
shortdesc: You grab your foe while it's distracted by your attack.

name: Predator's Pounce
desc: You close the distance to your prey in a blur, pouncing on the creature before it can react.
shortdesc: You close the distance to your prey in a blur.

name: Spirit's Wrath
desc: You call forth an ephemeral apparition.
shortdesc: You call forth an ephemeral apparition.

name: Titan's Stature
desc: You grow to even greater size. When using Giant's Stature, you can instead become Huge (increasing your reach by 10 feet if you were Medium or smaller) while you are raging. You have the clumsy 1 condition as long as you are Huge.

hints.desc: When using Giant's Stature, you can instead become Huge (increasing your reach by 10 feet if you were Medium or smaller) while you are raging. You have the clumsy 1 condition as long as you are Huge.

shortdesc: You grow to even greater size.

name: Awesome Blow
desc: Your attacks are so powerful, they can flatten your opponents. When you use Knockback, you can attempt an Athletics check against your target's Fortitude DC. Critical Success You gain the critical success effect of a Shove, then the critical success effect of a Trip against the target. Success You gain the success effect of a Shove, then the success effect of a Trip against the target. Failure You gain the normal effect of Knockback.

hints.desc:
When you use Knockback, you can attempt an Athletics check against your target's Fortitude DC.

Critical Success: You gain the critical success effect of a Shove, then the critical success effect of a Trip against the target.
Success: You gain the success effect of a Shove, then the success effect of a Trip against the target.
Failure: You gain the normal effect of Knockback.

shortdesc: Your attacks are so powerful, they can flatten your opponents.

name: Giant's Lunge
desc: You extend your body and prepare to attack foes outside your normal reach.
shortdesc: You extend your body and prepare to attack foes outside your normal reach.

name: Vengeful Strike
desc: When struck by an enemy, you respond in turn.
shortdesc: When struck by an enemy, you respond in turn.

name: Collateral Thrash
desc: When you Thrash a grabbed foe, you smack that foe into another nearby. Another foe adjacent to the grabbed foe also takes your Thrash damage, with a basic Reflex save against your class DC.

hints.desc: Another foe adjacent to the grabbed foe also takes your Thrash damage, with a basic Reflex save against your class DC.

shortdesc: When you Thrash a grabbed foe, you smack that foe into another nearby.

name: Dragon Transformation
desc: You transform into a ferocious large dragon.
shortdesc: You transform into a ferocious large dragon.

name: Reckless Abandon
desc: Your blood boils when you take a beating, and you throw caution to the wind to finish the fight.
shortdesc: Your blood boils when you take a beating, and you throw caution to the wind to finish the fight.

name: Brutal Critical
desc: Your critical hits are particularly devastating. On a critical hit with a melee Strike, add one extra damage die. This is in addition to any extra dice you gain if the weapon is deadly or fatal. The target also takes persistent bleed damage equal to two damage dice.

hints.desc: On a critical hit with a melee Strike, add one extra damage die. This is in addition to any extra dice you gain if the weapon is deadly or fatal. The target also takes persistent bleed damage equal to two damage dice.

shortdesc: Your critical hits are particularly devastating.

name: Perfect Clarity
desc: You burn out all of your rage to ensure that your attack lands and your mind remains free.
shortdesc: You burn out all of your rage to ensure that your attack lands and your mind remains free.

name: Vicious Evisceration
desc: You make a vicious attack that maims your enemy.
shortdesc: You make a vicious attack that maims your enemy.

name: Annihilating Swing
desc: You have learned from the brute destructive power of xulgaths and their kind.
shortdesc: You have learned from the brute destructive power of xulgaths and their kind.

name: Contagious Rage
desc: You can drive your allies into a frenzy, granting them incredible benefits. You can ignore the requirements on Share Rage, using it multiple times in a Rage. Allies affected by Share Rage who accept your anathema for the duration of the Rage gain your instinct ability and the specialization ability it gains from weapon specialization, but not greater weapon specialization.

hints.desc: You can ignore the requirements on Share Rage, using it multiple times in a Rage. Allies affected by Share Rage who accept your anathema for the duration of the Rage gain your instinct ability and the specialization ability it gains from weapon specialization, but not greater weapon specialization.

shortdesc: You can drive your allies into a frenzy, granting them incredible benefits.

name: Invulnerable Juggernaut
desc:
You are unstoppable, able to shrug off mortal wounds with ease. You gain resistance equal to 3 + your Constitution modifier to all damage, and your resistance from raging resistance increases to 8 + your Constitution modifier.

In addition, if you are reduced to 0 Hit Points, you can end your rage as a reaction to stay at 1 Hit Point. If you do, you become wounded 2 (or increase your wounded condition by 2 if you are already wounded).
specialdesc: The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion - ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor's Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise's trainers and records unlock this uncommon class feat.

hints.desc: Your resistance from raging resistance increases to 8 + your Constitution modifier.

internalNote: Coded into the Rage condition
shortdesc: Gain resistance to all damage.

name: Quaking Stomp
desc: You stomp the ground with such force that it creates a minor earthquake.
shortdesc: You stomp the ground with such force that it creates a minor earthquake.

name: Barbarian Dedication
desc:
You become trained in Athletics; if you were already trained in Athletics, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You become trained in barbarian class DC.

You can use the Rage action.

Choose an instinct as you would if you were a barbarian. You have that instinct for all purposes and become bound by its anathema, but you don't gain any of the other abilities it grants.
specialdesc: You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the barbarian archetype.
shortdesc: There's a rage deep inside you that sometimes breaks loose, granting you some of the might of a barbarian in addition to your other abilities.

name: Barbarian Resiliency
desc: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each barbarian archetype class feat you have. As you continue selecting barbarian archetype class feats, you continue to gain additional Hit Points in this way.
shortdesc: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each barbarian archetype class feat you have.
specialreqdesc: class granting no more Hit Points per level than 10 + your Constitution modifier

name: Basic Fury
desc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level barbarian feat.
shortdesc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level barbarian feat.

name: Advanced Fury
desc: You gain one barbarian feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your barbarian level is equal to half your character level.
specialdesc: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another barbarian feat.
shortdesc: You gain one barbarian feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your barbarian level is equal to half your character level.

name: Instinct Ability
desc: You gain the instinct ability for the instinct you chose for Barbarian Dedication.
shortdesc: You gain the instinct ability for the instinct you chose for Barbarian Dedication.

name: Juggernaut's Fortitude
desc: Your proficiency rank in Fortitude saves increases to master.
shortdesc: Your proficiency rank in Fortitude saves increases to master.

name: Animal Companion (Druid)
desc: You gain the service of a young animal companion that travels with you on your adventures and obeys any simple commands you give it to the best of its abilities. See Animal Companions on page 214 for more information.
shortdesc: You gain the service of a young animal companion that travels with you.
specialreqdesc: no animal companion

name: Leshy Familiar
desc: You gain a leshy familiar, a Tiny plant that embodies one of the many spirits of nature. Other than taking the form of a plant instead of an animal, this familiar uses all the same rules as other familiars, which are detailed here.
shortdesc: You gain a leshy familiar, a tiny plant that embodies one of the many spirits of nature.
specialreqdesc: no familiar

name: Storm Born
desc: You are at home out in the elements, reveling in the power of nature unleashed. You do not take circumstance penalties to ranged spell attacks or Perception checks caused by weather, and your targeted spells don't require a flat check to succeed against a target concealed by weather (such as fog).

hints.desc: You do not take circumstance penalties to ranged spell attacks or Perception checks caused by weather, and your targeted spells don't require a flat check to succeed against a target concealed by weather (such as fog).

shortdesc: You are at home out in the elements, reveling in the power of nature unleashed.

name: Wild Shape
desc: You are one with the wild, always changing and adapting to meet any challenge. You gain the wild shape order spell, which lets you transform into a variety of forms that you can expand with druid feats.
shortdesc: You are one with the wild, always changing and adapting to meet any challenge.

name: Call of the Wild
desc: You call upon the creatures of nature to come to your aid. You can spend 10 minutes in concert with nature to replace one of the spells you've prepared in one of your druid spell slots with a summon animal or summon plants and fungus spell of the same level.

hints.desc:
You can spend 10 minutes in concert with nature to replace one of the spells you've prepared in one of your druid spell slots with a summon animal or summon plants and fungus spell of the same level.

You can make this change in the spellbook menu. When this hint's effect is activated, selected spells are immediately prepared, as if you had used Call of the Wild to replace a currently prepared spell.

shortdesc: You call upon the creatures of nature to come to your aid.

name: Order Explorer
desc: You have learned the secrets of another druidic order, passing whatever rites of initiation that order requires and gaining access to its secrets. Choose an order other than your own. You gain a 1st-level feat that lists that order as a prerequisite, and you are now a member of that order for the purpose of meeting feat prerequisites. If you commit acts anathema to your new order, you lose all feats and abilities requiring that order but retain your other druid feats and abilities. You don't gain any of the other benefits of the order you chose.
specialdesc: You can take this feat multiple times. Each time you do, you must choose a different order other than your own.
shortdesc: You have learned the secrets of another druidic order.

name: Order Explorer: Animal Order
desc: You have learned the secrets of the animal order, passing whatever rites of initiation that order requires and gaining access to its secrets. You gain a 1st-level feat that lists that order as a prerequisite, and you are now a member of that order for the purpose of meeting feat prerequisites. If you commit acts anathema to your new order, you lose all feats and abilities requiring that order but retain your other druid feats and abilities. You don't gain any of the other benefits of the order you chose.
shortdesc: You have learned the secrets of another druidic order.
specialreqdesc: no animal order
anathema: Committing wanton cruelty to animals or killing animals unnecessarily is anathema to your order. (This doesn't prevent you from defending yourself against animals or killing them cleanly for food.)

name: Order Explorer: Leaf Order
desc: You have learned the secrets of the leaf order, passing whatever rites of initiation that order requires and gaining access to its secrets. You gain a 1st-level feat that lists that order as a prerequisite, and you are now a member of that order for the purpose of meeting feat prerequisites. If you commit acts anathema to your new order, you lose all feats and abilities requiring that order but retain your other druid feats and abilities. You don't gain any of the other benefits of the order you chose.
shortdesc: You have learned the secrets of another druidic order.
specialreqdesc: no leaf order
anathema: Committing wanton cruelty to plants or killing plants unnecessarily is anathema to your order. (This doesn't prevent you from defending yourself against plants or harvesting them when necessary for survival.)

name: Order Explorer: Storm Order
desc: You have learned the secrets of the storm order, passing whatever rites of initiation that order requires and gaining access to its secrets. You gain a 1st-level feat that lists that order as a prerequisite, and you are now a member of that order for the purpose of meeting feat prerequisites. If you commit acts anathema to your new order, you lose all feats and abilities requiring that order but retain your other druid feats and abilities. You don't gain any of the other benefits of the order you chose.
shortdesc: You have learned the secrets of another druidic order.
specialreqdesc: no storm order
anathema: Polluting the air or allowing those who cause major air pollution or climate shifts to go unpunished is anathema to your order. (This doesn't force you to take action against merely potential harm to the environment or to sacrifice yourself against an obviously superior foe.)

name: Order Explorer: Wild Order
desc: You have learned the secrets of the wild order, passing whatever rites of initiation that order requires and gaining access to its secrets. You gain a 1st-level feat that lists that order as a prerequisite, and you are now a member of that order for the purpose of meeting feat prerequisites. If you commit acts anathema to your new order, you lose all feats and abilities requiring that order but retain your other druid feats and abilities. You don't gain any of the other benefits of the order you chose.
shortdesc: You have learned the secrets of another druidic order.
specialreqdesc: no wild order
anathema: Becoming fully domesticated by the temptations of civilization is anathema to your order. (This doesn't prevent you from buying and using processed goods or staying in a city for an adventure, but you can never come to rely on these conveniences or truly call such a place your permanent home.)

name: Poison Resistance
desc: Your body has become fortified against toxins. You gain poison resistance equal to half your level, and you gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws against poisons.

hints.desc: You gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws against poisons.

shortdesc: Repeated exposure to toxic reagents has fortified your body against poisons of all kinds.

name: Form Control
desc: With additional care and effort, you can take on an alternate form for a longer period of time.
internalNote: The effect on the duration of wild shape is hardcoded into spell processing.
shortdesc: With additional care and effort, you can take on an alternate form for a longer period of time.

name: Mature Animal Companion (Druid)
desc: Your animal companion grows up, becoming a mature animal companion, which grants it additional capabilities. See the animal companion rules for more information. Your animal companion is better trained than most. During an encounter, even if you don't use the Command an Animal action, your animal companion can still use 1 action on your turn that round to Stride or Strike.

hints.desc: During an encounter, even if you don't use the Command an Animal action, your animal companion can still use 1 action on your turn that round to Stride or Strike.

shortdesc: Your animal companion grows up, becoming a mature animal companion, which grants it additional capabilities.

name: Order Magic
desc: You have delved deeper into the teaching of a new order, gaining access to a coveted order spell. Choose an order you have selected with Order Explorer. You gain the initial order spell from that order.
specialdesc: You can take this feat multiple times. Each time you do, you must choose a different order you have selected with Order Explorer.
shortdesc: You have delved deeper into the teaching of a new order, gaining access to a coveted order spell.

name: Order Magic: Animal Order
desc: You have delved deeper into the teaching of the animal order. You gain the heal animal order spell.
shortdesc: You have delved deeper into the teaching of a new order, gaining access to a coveted order spell.

name: Order Magic: Leaf Order
desc: You have delved deeper into the teaching of the leaf order. You gain the goodberry order spell.
shortdesc: You have delved deeper into the teaching of a new order, gaining access to a coveted order spell.

name: Order Magic: Storm Order
desc: You have delved deeper into the teaching of the storm order. You gain the tempest surge order spell.
shortdesc: You have delved deeper into the teaching of a new order, gaining access to a coveted order spell.

name: Order Magic: Wild Order
desc: You have delved deeper into the teaching of the wild order. You gain the wild morph order spell.
shortdesc: You have delved deeper into the teaching of a new order, gaining access to a coveted order spell.

name: Thousand Faces
desc: Your form is as mutable as the weather, changing to meet your whim. You add the forms listed in humanoid form to your wild shape list.

hints.desc: You add the forms listed in humanoid form to your wild shape list.

internalNote: Coded into the Wild Shape condition
shortdesc: Your form is as mutable as the weather, changing to meet your whim.

name: Woodland Stride
desc: You can always find a path, almost as if foliage parted before you. You ignore any difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants manipulated by magic don't impede your progress.

hints.desc: You ignore any difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants manipulated by magic don't impede your progress.

shortdesc: You can always find a path, almost as if foliage parted before you.

name: Green Empathy
desc: You can communicate with plants on a basic level and use Diplomacy to Make an Impression on them and to make very simple Requests of them. Non-creature plants typically can't fulfill most requests you might ask of them unless you have access to other magic such as speak with plants. Because of your affiliation with the leaf order, plants have a sense that you support them, so you gain a +2 circumstance bonus on your check to Make a Request of a plant using Green Empathy.

hints.desc: You can communicate with plants on a basic level and use Diplomacy to Make an Impression on them and to make very simple Requests of them. Non-creature plants typically can't fulfill most requests you might ask of them unless you have access to other magic such as speak with plants. Because of your affiliation with the leaf order, plants have a sense that you support them, so you gain a +2 circumstance bonus on your check to Make a Request of a plant using Green Empathy.

shortdesc: You can communicate with plants on a basic level and use Diplomacy to Make an Impression on them and to make very simple Requests of them.

name: Insect Shape
desc: Your understanding of life expands, allowing you to mimic a wider range of creatures. Add the forms in insect form to your wild shape list. Whenever you use wild shape to polymorph into the non-flying insect form listed in pest form, the duration is 24 hours instead of 10 minutes.

hints.desc: Add the forms in insect form to your wild shape list. Whenever you use wild shape to polymorph into the non-flying insect form listed in pest form, the duration is 24 hours instead of 10 minutes.

internalNote: Coded into the Wild Shape condition
shortdesc: Your understanding of life expands, allowing you to mimic a wider range of creatures.

name: Storm Retribution
desc: You lash out, directing a burst of storming fury toward a creature that has harmed you.
shortdesc: You lash out, directing a burst of storming fury toward a creature that has harmed you.
specialreq: character.class.spellCasting.some(casting => casting.castingType == 'Focus' && casting.className == 'Druid' && casting.spellChoices.some(spellChoice => spellChoice.spells.some(spell => spell.name == 'Tempest Surge')))
specialreqdesc: tempest surge order spell

name: Ferocious Shape
desc: You have mastered the shape of ferocious dinosaurs. Add the forms listed in dinosaur form to your wild shape list. Whenever you use wild shape to take a form that grants you a specific Athletics modifier, you gain a +1 status bonus to your Athletics checks.

hints.desc: Add the forms listed in dinosaur form to your wild shape list. Whenever you use wild shape to take a form that grants you a specific Athletics modifier, you gain a +1 status bonus to your Athletics checks.

internalNote: Coded into the Wild Shape condition
shortdesc: You have mastered the shape of ferocious dinosaurs.

effects.value: (Has_Condition('Wild Shape') && characterService.get_AppliedConditions(creature, '', '', true).some(conditionGain => ['Pest Form','Animal Form','Insect Form','Dinosaur Form','Elemental Form','Plant Form','Dragon Form','Monstrosity Form'].includes(conditionGain.name) && !['Air','Fire'].includes(conditionGain.choice))) ? 1 : 0

name: Fey Caller
desc: You have learned some of the tricks the fey use to bend primal magic toward illusions and trickery. Add illusory disguise, illusory object, illusory scene, and veil to your spell list as primal spells.
internalNote: Hardcoded in the spellchoice component.
shortdesc: You have learned some of the tricks the fey use to bend primal magic toward illusions and trickery.

name: Incredible Companion (Druid)
desc:
Your animal companion continues to grow and develop. It becomes a nimble or savage animal companion (your choice), gaining additional capabilities determined by the type of companion (page 214).

To advance a mature animal companion to a nimble animal companion, increase its Dexterity modifier by 2 and its Strength, Constitution, and Wisdom modifiers by 1. It deals 2 additional damage with its unarmed attacks. Increase its proficiency ranks in Acrobatics and unarmored defense to expert. It also learns the advanced maneuver for its type. Its attacks become magical for the purpose of ignoring resistances.

To advance a mature animal companion to a savage animal companion, increase its Strength modifier by 2 and its Dexterity, Constitution, and Wisdom modifiers by 1. It deals 3 additional damage with its unarmed attacks. Increase its proficiency rank in Athletics to expert. It also learns the advanced maneuver for its type. If your companion is Medium or smaller, it grows by one size. Its attacks become magical for the purpose of ignoring resistances.
shortdesc: Your animal companion continues to grow and develop.

name: Incredible Companion (Druid): Nimble
desc:
Your animal companion continues to grow and develop. It becomes a nimble animal companion (your choice), gaining additional capabilities determined by the type of companion (page 214).

To advance a mature animal companion to a nimble animal companion, increase its Dexterity modifier by 2 and its Strength, Constitution, and Wisdom modifiers by 1. It deals 2 additional damage with its unarmed attacks. Increase its proficiency ranks in Acrobatics and unarmored defense to expert. It also learns the advanced maneuver for its type. Its attacks become magical for the purpose of ignoring resistances.
shortdesc: Your animal companion continues to grow and develop.
specialreqdesc: no advanced animal companion

name: Incredible Companion (Druid): Savage
desc:
Your animal companion continues to grow and develop. It becomes a savage animal companion (your choice), gaining additional capabilities determined by the type of companion (page 214).

To advance a mature animal companion to a savage animal companion, increase its Strength modifier by 2 and its Dexterity, Constitution, and Wisdom modifiers by 1. It deals 3 additional damage with its unarmed attacks. Increase its proficiency rank in Athletics to expert. It also learns the advanced maneuver for its type. If your companion is Medium or smaller, it grows by one size. Its attacks become magical for the purpose of ignoring resistances.
shortdesc: Your animal companion continues to grow and develop.
specialreqdesc: no advanced animal companion

name: Soaring Shape
desc: Wings free you from the shackles of the ground below. Add the bat and bird forms in aerial form to your wild shape list. If you have Insect Shape, you also add the wasp form to your wild shape list. If you have Ferocious Shape, you also add the pterosaur form to your wild shape list. Whenever you use wild shape to gain a form that grants you a specific Acrobatics modifier, you gain a +1 status bonus to Acrobatics checks.

hints.desc: Add the bat and bird forms in aerial form to your wild shape list. If you have Insect Shape, you also add the wasp form to your wild shape list. If you have Ferocious Shape, you also add the pterosaur form to your wild shape list. Whenever you use wild shape to gain a form that grants you a specific Acrobatics modifier, you gain a +1 status bonus to Acrobatics checks.

internalNote: Coded into the Wild Shape condition
shortdesc: Wings free you from the shackles of the ground below.

name: Wind Caller
desc: You bid the winds to lift and carry you through the air. You gain the stormwind flight order spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You bid the winds to lift and carry you through the air.

name: Elemental Shape
desc: You understand the fundamental elements of nature such that you can imbue them into your body and manifest as a living embodiment of those elements. Add the forms in elemental form to your wild shape list. Whenever you're polymorphed into another form using wild shape, you gain resistance 5 to fire.

hints.desc: Add the forms in elemental form to your wild shape list. Whenever you're polymorphed into another form using wild shape, you gain resistance 5 to fire.

internalNote: Coded into the Wild Shape condition
shortdesc: You understand the fundamental elements of nature such that you can imbue them into your body.

name: Healing Transformation
desc: You can take advantage of shapechanging magic to close wounds and patch injuries.
shortdesc: You can take advantage of shapechanging magic to close wounds and patch injuries.

name: Plant Shape
desc: You can take the form of a plant creature. Add the forms listed in plant form to your wild shape list; if you don't have wild shape, you can instead cast plant form once per day, heightened to the same level as your highest-level druid spell slot. Whenever you're polymorphed into another form using wild shape, you gain resistance 5 to poison.
shortdesc: You can take the form of a plant creature.

name: Plant Shape: Wild Shape
desc: You can take the form of a plant creature. Add the forms listed in plant form to your wild shape list. Whenever you're polymorphed into another form using wild shape, you gain resistance 5 to poison.

hints.desc: Add the forms listed in plant form to your wild shape list. Whenever you're polymorphed into another form using wild shape, you gain resistance 5 to poison.

internalNote: Coded into the Wild Shape condition
shortdesc: You can take the form of a plant creature.
specialreqdesc: Wild Shape

name: Plant Shape: Leaf Order
desc: You can take the form of a plant creature. You can cast plant form once per day, heightened to the same level as your highest-level druid spell slot.
shortdesc: You can take the form of a plant creature.
specialreqdesc: no Wild Shape

name: Side by Side (Druid)
desc: You and your animal companion fight in tandem, distracting your foes and keeping them off balance. Whenever you and your animal companion are adjacent to the same foe, you are both flanking that foe with each other, regardless of your actual positions.

hints.desc: Whenever you and your animal companion are adjacent to the same foe, you are both flanking that foe with each other, regardless of your actual positions.

shortdesc: You and your animal companion fight in tandem, distracting your foes and keeping them off balance.

name: Dragon Shape
desc: You can take on the form of some of the world's most fearsome creatures. Add the forms listed in dragon form to your wild shape list. Whenever you're polymorphed into another form using wild shape, you gain resistance 5 to your choice of acid, cold, electricity, fire, or poison.

hints.desc: Add the forms listed in dragon form to your wild shape list. Whenever you're polymorphed into another form using wild shape, you gain resistance 5 to your choice of acid, cold, electricity, fire, or poison (activations 1 through 5).

shortdesc: You can take on the form of some of the world's most fearsome creatures.

name: Green Tongue
desc: You share a special kinship with all things green and living. You (and your leshy familiar, if you have one) are constantly under the effects of speak with plants. Most non-creature plants recognize you as a druid of the leaf order and are friendly to you.
shortdesc: You share a special kinship with all things green and living.

name: Pesh Skin
desc: Your plant form sprouts hundreds of spines, and your blood causes mild hallucinations in creatures exposed to it.
shortdesc: Your plant form sprouts hundreds of spines, and your blood causes mild hallucinations in creatures exposed to it.

name: Primal Focus
desc: Your connection to nature is particularly strong, and the spirits of nature flock around you, helping you replenish your focus. If you have spent at least 2 Focus Points since the last time you Refocused, you recover 2 Focus Points when you Refocus instead of 1.

hints.desc: If you have spent at least 2 Focus Points since the last time you Refocused, you recover 2 Focus Points when you Refocus instead of 1.

shortdesc: Your connection to nature is particularly strong, and the spirits of nature flock around you, helping you replenish your focus.

name: Primal Summons
desc: Whenever you summon an ally, you can empower it with the elemental power of air, earth, fire, or water. You gain the primal summons order spell.
shortdesc: Whenever you summon an ally, you can empower it with the elemental power of air, earth, fire, or water.

name: Specialized Companion (Druid)
desc: Your animal companion continues to grow in power and ability, and it is now cunning enough to become specialized. Your animal companion gains one specialization of your choice.
specialdesc: You can select this feat up to three times. Each time, add a different specialization to your companion.
shortdesc: Your animal companion continues to grow in power and ability, and it is now cunning enough to become specialized.

name: Timeless Nature
desc: With primal magic sustaining you, you cease aging. The overflowing primal energy gives you a +2 status bonus to saves against diseases and primal magic.

hints.desc: You gain a +2 status bonus to saving throws against diseases and primal magic.
You cease aging.

shortdesc: With primal magic sustaining you, you cease aging.

name: Verdant Metamorphosis
desc:
You transform into a plant version of yourself. You gain the plant trait and lose any trait that's inappropriate for your new form (typically humanoid for a PC, but also possibly animal or fungus). You can change from a form that looks mostly like your old self into a tree or any other non-creature plant as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. This has the same effect as tree shape, except you can turn into any kind of non-creature plant and your AC is 30.

If you rest for 10 minutes while transformed into a non-creature plant during daylight hours under direct sunlight, you recover half your maximum Hit Points. If you take your daily rest in this way, the rest restores you to maximum Hit Points and removes all non-permanent drained, enfeebled, clumsy, and stupefied conditions, as well as all poisons and diseases of 19th level or lower.

hints.desc:
If you rest for 10 minutes while transformed into a non-creature plant during daylight hours under direct sunlight, you recover half your maximum Hit Points. If you take your daily rest in this way, the rest restores you to maximum Hit Points and removes all non-permanent drained, enfeebled, clumsy, and stupefied conditions, as well as all poisons and diseases of 19th level or lower.

(Activate this hint to gain the effects during your daily rest. Manually restore half your maximum Hit Points when appropriate.)

internalNote: Losing humanoid and other traits is hardcoded in general, as is losing conditions in ConditionsService.rest(). The 10-minute rest effect needs to be applied manually.
shortdesc: You transform into a plant version of yourself.

name: Impaling Briars
desc: You can fill an area with devastating briars that impale and impede your foes. You gain the impaling briars order spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You can fill an area with devastating briars that impale and impede your foes.

name: Monstrosity Shape
desc: You can transform into a powerful magical creature. Add the purple worm and sea serpent forms listed in monstrosity form to your wild shape list. If you have Soaring Shape, also add the phoenix form to your wild shape list.

hints.desc: Add the purple worm and sea serpent forms listed in monstrosity form to your wild shape list. If you have Soaring Shape, also add the phoenix form to your wild shape list.

shortdesc: You can transform into a powerful magical creature.

name: Invoke Disaster
desc: You can invoke nature's fury upon your foes. You gain the storm lord order spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You can invoke nature's fury upon your foes.

name: Perfect Form Control
desc: Thanks to magic and muscle memory, you can stay in your alternate forms indefinitely; you may have even forgotten your original form. When you use Form Control, instead of lasting 1 hour, wild shape is permanent until you Dismiss it.

hints.desc: When you use Form Control, instead of lasting 1 hour, wild shape is permanent until you Dismiss it.

shortdesc: Thanks to magic and muscle memory, you can stay in your alternate forms indefinitely.

name: Primal Wellspring
desc: Your reservoir of Focus Points is a deep wellspring. If you have spent at least 3 Focus Points since the last time you Refocused, you recover 3 Focus Points when you Refocus instead of 1.

hints.desc: If you have spent at least 3 Focus Points since the last time you Refocused, you recover 3 Focus Points when you Refocus instead of 1.

shortdesc: Your reservoir of Focus Points is a deep wellspring.

name: Apex Companion
desc: You can call upon the essence of every individual animal of a particular species to temporarily transform your animal into an exemplar of its kind. You learn the apex companion order spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
specialdesc: The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion - ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor's Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise's trainers and records unlock this uncommon class feat.
shortdesc: Gain the apex companion focus spell.

name: Hierophant's Power
desc: You have entwined yourself with the natural world, and its full power flows through you. You gain an additional 10th-level spell slot.
shortdesc: You have entwined yourself with the natural world, and its full power flows through you.

name: Leyline Conduit
desc: You can cast your spells effortlessly by tapping into the leylines of the world.
internalNote: Hardcoded into spellbook component.
shortdesc: You can cast your spells effortlessly by tapping into the leylines of the world.

name: True Shapeshifter
desc: You transcend the limitations of form.
shortdesc: You transcend the limitations of form.

name: Verdant Presence
desc: The life-giving properties of the aeon orbs flourish within you.
shortdesc: The life-giving properties of the aeon orbs flourish within you.

name: Druid Dedication
desc:
You cast spells like a druid. You gain access to the Cast a Spell activity. You can prepare two common cantrips each day from the primal spell list in this book or any other primal cantrips you learn or discover. You're trained in spell attack rolls and spell DCs for primal spells. Your key spellcasting ability for druid archetype spells is Wisdom, and they are primal druid spells.

You learn the Druidic language, and you are bound by the druid's anathema.

Choose a druidic order. You become a member of that order and are also bound by its specific anathema, allowing you to take the order's feats. You become trained in Nature and your order's associated skill; for each of these skills in which you were already trained, you become trained in a skill of your choice. You don't gain any other abilities from your choice of order.
specialdesc: You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the druid archetype.
shortdesc: You have entered a druidic circle and learned a few of the order's secrets, granting you primal power.
anathema: Using metal armor or shields.
Despoiling natural places.
Teaching the Druidic language to non-druids.

name: Basic Druid Spellcasting
desc:
You gain the basic spellcasting benefits:

At 4th level, you gain a 1st-level spell slot. At 6th level, you gain a 2nd-level spell slot. At 8th level, you gain a 3rd-level spell slot.
shortdesc: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.

name: Basic Wilding
desc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level druid feat.
shortdesc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level druid feat.

name: Order Spell
desc: You gain the initial order spell from your order. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by being one with nature.
shortdesc: You gain the initial order spell from your order.

name: Order Spell: Animal Order
desc: You gain the heal animal order spell from the animal order. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by being one with nature.
shortdesc: You gain the initial order spell from your order.

name: Order Spell: Leaf Order
desc: You gain the goodberry order spell from the leaf order. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by being one with nature.
shortdesc: You gain the initial order spell from your order.

name: Order Spell: Storm Order
desc: You gain the tempest surge order spell from the storm order. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by being one with nature.
shortdesc: You gain the initial order spell from your order.

name: Order Spell: Wild Order
desc: You gain the wild morph order spell from the wild order. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by being one with nature.
shortdesc: You gain the initial order spell from your order.

name: Advanced Wilding
desc: You gain one druid feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your druid level is equal to half your character level.
specialdesc: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another druid feat.
shortdesc: You gain one druid feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your druid level is equal to half your character level.

name: Primal Breadth
desc: Increase the spell slots you gain from druid archetype feats by 1 for each spell level other than your two highest druid spell slots.
shortdesc: Increase the spell slots you gain from druid archetype feats by 1 for each spell level other than your two highest druid spell slots.

name: Expert Druid Spellcasting
desc:
You gain the expert spellcasting benefits:

You become an expert in spell attack rolls and spell DCs for primal spells. At 12th level, you gain a 4th-level spell slot. At 14th level, you gain a 5th-level spell slot. At 16th level, you gain a 6th-level spell slot.
shortdesc: You gain the expert spellcasting benefits.

name: Master Druid Spellcasting
desc:
You gain the master spellcasting benefits:

You become a master in spell attack rolls and spell DCs for primal spells. At 18th level, you gain a 7th-level spell slot. At 20th level, you gain a 8th-level spell slot.
shortdesc: You gain the master spellcasting benefits.

name: Blessed Blood
desc: Your deity's blessings manifest in your blood-borne power. Add up to three of your deity's spells (spells your deity grants to clerics) to your spell list. They are not automatically added to your repertoire, but you can select them just as you would spells normally on the divine spell list.
internalNote: The selection is hardcoded in the character component.
shortdesc: Your deity's blessings manifest in your blood-borne power
specialreqdesc: bloodline that grants divine spells, you follow a deity

name: Counterspell (Spontaneous)
desc: When a foe Casts a Spell and you can see its manifestations, you can use your own magic to disrupt it.
specialdesc: [Sorcerer] This feat has the trait corresponding to the tradition of spells you cast (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).
internalNote: Using a spell slot to counterspell is hardcoded.
shortdesc: When a foe Casts a Spell and you can see its manifestations, you can use your own magic to disrupt it.

name: Dangerous Sorcery
desc: Your legacy grants you great destructive power. When you Cast a Spell from your spell slots, if the spell deals damage and doesn't have a duration, you gain a status bonus to that spell's damage equal to the spell's level.

hints.desc: When you Cast a Spell from your spell slots, if the spell deals damage and doesn't have a duration, you gain a status bonus to that spell's damage equal to the spell's level.

shortdesc: Your legacy grants you great destructive power.

name: Arcane Evolution
desc:
Your arcane legacy grants you an exceptional aptitude for intellectual and academic pursuits. You become trained in one skill of your choice. Additionally, you keep a book of arcane spells similar to a wizard's spellbook. You add all the spells in your spell repertoire to this book for free, and you can add additional arcane spells to the book by paying the appropriate cost and using your Arcana skill, similarly to how a wizard can Learn Spells to add those spells to his spellbook.

During your daily preparations, choose any one spell from your book of arcane spells. If it isn't in your spell repertoire, add it to your spell repertoire until the next time you prepare. If it's already in your spell repertoire, add it as an additional signature spell for that day.

hints.desc: During your daily preparations, choose any one spell from your book of arcane spells. If it isn't in your spell repertoire, add it to your spell repertoire until the next time you prepare. If it's already in your spell repertoire, add it as an additional signature spell for that day.

internalNote: Learning spells from your repertoire and activating a signature spell is hardcoded.
shortdesc: Your arcane legacy grants you an exceptional aptitude for intellectual and academic pursuits.
specialreqdesc: bloodline that grants arcane spells

name: Divine Evolution
desc: The divine might provided by your bloodline flows through you. You gain an additional spell slot of your highest level, which you can use only to cast your choice of heal or harm. You can cast either of these spells using that spell slot, even if they aren't in your spell repertoire.
usageNote: Instead of gaining an extra spell slot, you gain harm and heal as spells of your highest spell level and can use one of them once per day without using a spell slot.
internalNote: You gain a once-per-day spellChoice with these two spells.
shortdesc: The divine might provided by your bloodline flows through you.
specialreqdesc: bloodline that grants divine spells

name: Occult Evolution
desc: Glimpses of the obscure secrets of the universe loan you power. You become trained in one skill of your choice. Additionally, once per day, you can spend 1 minute to choose one mental occult spell you don't know and add it to your spell repertoire. You lose this temporary spell the next time you make your daily preparations (though you can use this ability to add it again later).

hints.desc: Once per day, you can spend 1 minute to choose one mental occult spell you don't know and add it to your spell repertoire. You lose this temporary spell the next time you make your daily preparations (though you can use this ability to add it again later).

internalNote: Deselecting the choice at rest is hardcoded.
shortdesc: Glimpses of the obscure secrets of the universe loan you power.
specialreqdesc: bloodline that grants occult spells

name: Primal Evolution
desc: You can call upon the creatures of the wild for aid. You gain an additional spell slot of your highest level, which you can use only to cast summon animal or summon plants or fungus. You can cast either of these spells using that spell slot, even if it they aren't in your spell repertoire.
usageNote: Instead of gaining an extra spell slot, you gain summon animal and summon plant or fungus as spells of your highest spell level and can use one of them once per day without using a spell slot.
internalNote: You gain a once-per-day spellChoice with these two spells.
shortdesc: You can call upon the creatures of the wild for aid.
specialreqdesc: bloodline that grants primal spells

shortdesc: You have studied your bloodline to learn the secrets of its magic.

name: Bloodline Resistance
desc: Your magical blood makes you more resistant to magic. You gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws against spells and magical effects.

hints.desc: You gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws against spells and magical effects.

shortdesc: Your magical blood makes you more resistant to magic.

name: Crossblooded Evolution
desc: Odd interactions in your bloodline provide you with unexpected spells. You can have one spell in your spell repertoire from a tradition other than the one that matches your bloodline. You cast that spell as a spell from your bloodline's tradition. You can swap which spell you add and from which tradition as you could any other sorcerer spell, but you can't have more than one spell from another tradition in your spell repertoire at the same time using this feat.

hints.desc: You can have one spell in your spell repertoire from a tradition other than the one that matches your bloodline. You cast that spell as a spell from your bloodline's tradition. You can swap which spell you add and from which tradition as you could any other sorcerer spell, but you can't have more than one spell from another tradition in your spell repertoire at the same time using this feat.
